en: Extremist Rebels Launch Deadly Attack in Northeast Nigeria
sna: Vapunduki Vanokakatira Kurutivi Vanotanga Hondo Inotyisa Kumaodzanyemba akaererekera kumabvazuva eNigeria
mt0: <pad> The Separatist tribesmen start a fierce war</s>

en: Islamic extremist rebels have killed at least seven people in an attack in northeast Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told The Associated Press on Wednesday.
sna: Vapanduki vechi Islam chinokakatira kurutivi auraya vanhu vanomwe mukurwisa kwaitika kumaodzanyemba akadzvivira kumabvazuva mudunhu reBorno muNigeria, vakaona zvichiitika vakaudza Associated Press neChitatu
mt0: <pad> Islamist militants have killed seven people in an attack north-eastern Nigeria, witnesses told the Associated Press on Wednesday.</s>

en: The rebels attacked Kautukari village in the Chibok area of Borno on Tuesday evening, said residents.
sna: Vagari veko vakati vapanduki avavakarwisa musha weKautukari munzvimbo yeChibok iri mudunhu reBorno manheru eChipiri.
mt0: <pad> Residents said rebels attacked the Kautukari village in Chibok, Borno state on Tuesday night.</s>

en: The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
sna: Kurwisa uku kwakaitika panguva imwe chete apo Munyori Mukuru weMubatanidzwa Wenyika Dzepasi Rese vaAntonio Gueterres mudunhu iri vachishanyira avo vakange vapukunyuka mhirizhonga yechi jihad iyi.
mt0: <pad> The attack occurred at the same time as UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres was in the region to visit the victims of the jihadist terror.</s>

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.
sna: Nzvimbo yeChibok iri mufambo ungaite zana negumi nemashanu wemakiromita (kana kuti mamaira makumi manomwe nerimwe) kubva muguta guru redunhu reBorno, uko vaGuterres vakasangana nevakambenge vari vapanduki avo vava kudzoserwa zvakare kuti vagarisane nevamwe, uye vakaonana vezviuru zvevabhu vakabviswa kubva pavavaigara nekuda kwekupanduka uku.
mt0: <pad> The Chibok site is about 150 kilometers (or about 70 miles) from the capital of the Borno province, where Guterres met with former rebels who have been repatriated to the community, and talked to thousands of IDPs who were displaced by the rebellion.</s>

en: They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community, said Hassan Chibok, a community leader.
sna: Vakauya vakawanda uye vaine zvombo zvinesimba zhinji vakabva vatotora musha wedu kuuita wavo, vakadaro vaHassan Chibok mumwe wevakuru venzvimbo iyi.
mt0: <pad> They came in a large number and with many heavy weapons and took our village for their own, said Hassan Chibok, one of the elderly people of the area.</s>

en: Troops from a nearby military base were deployed to repel the attack but "the damage had been done," Chibok said, adding that "casualties are up to 10."
sna: Varwi vemumwe muzinda unogara mauto vakatumwa kunorwisana nekudzinga vapanduki ava, asi "vakange vaparadza nekutsokodzera kare,"vaChibok vakadaro, vachiwedzerawo kuti vakange vafa vakange vosvika gumi.
mt0: <pad> The residents of Chibok said they had been sent to fight the rebels, but "they had destroyed everything," they said, adding that 10 people were killed.</s>

en: Another resident Yana Galang said at least seven people were killed in the latest violence before the Nigerian military intervened.
sna: mumwewo mugari wenzvimbo iyi, vaYana Galang vakati vanhu vanosvika vanomwe vakange vaurayiwa mukurwisa kwakapedzesera kuitika mauto ehurumende yeNigeria asati apindira. Asi mapurisa emuNigeria haana kutsinhidzira kuti kurwiswa uku kwakange kwaitika here kana kuti kwete.
mt0: <pad> A neighbour of the area, Mrs. Yana Galang, said that up to seven people had been killed in an attack that ended before the government forces intervened. But the Nigerian police have not confirmed whether the attack occurred or not.</s>

en: Nigerian police did not immediately respond to a request for confirmation of the attack.
sna: Mapurisa emuNigeria haana kurumidza kupindura kuchikumbiro chekuti vabvume kuti kurwiswa uku kwakange kwaitika
mt0: <pad> The Nigerian police did not respond quickly to a request to confirm the attack.</s>

en: Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province.
sna: Nigeria, iyo ine vagari vanosvika mamiriyonimazana mairi nematanhatu,ndiyo nyika ine vanhu vakawanda kudarika dzimwe nyika dzese muAfrica, inoramba ichitambura nekugadzirisa hondo yevapanduki iyo yava nemakore gumi ichipisa kumaodzanyemba akadziva kumabvazuva eNigeria uko vapanduki vechi Isam vanokakatira kurutivi veBoko Haram nerimwe boka rakabuda kubva muvapanduki ava, reIslamic State of West Africa Province.
mt0: <pad> Nigeria, the country with the most people in Africa, is still struggling to resolve a ten-year rebel war that has been raging in north and east Nigeria where Islamist militants Boko Haram and another group of jihadists, the Islamic State of West Africa Province, have been fighting.</s>

en: The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.
sna: Vapanduki ava varikurwisa kuti vamise mutemo wechi-Isam weSharia kuti ushandiswe uye kuti vadzivise nekumisa dzidziso yemuzvikoro yakabva kunyika dzevarungu dzekumavirazuva.
mt0: <pad> The protesters are fighting to impose the Isam Sharia law and to stop and ban school education from the Western European countries.</s>

en: More than 35,000 people have died and millions have been displaced by the extremist violence, according to the U.N. Development Program.
sna: Sangano reUN Development Program rinoti vanhu vanodarika zviuri makumi matatu nezvishanu vakapondwa, uye mamiriyoni mazhinji evagari vakabviswa mumisha yavaigara nemhirizhonga yakakozereswa nevapambuki vanokakatira kurutivi ava. Mukutanga kwesvondo rino, mutungamiriri weNigeria vaMuhammadu Buhari vakati hondo yekurwisa vapanduki ava yava"kuswedera kumagumo ayo," vachitaurawo pamusoro pekurohwa kwevapanduki nehondo yemuchadenga yeNigeria uyewo nezvekutiza kwevarwi vazhinji vachisiya vapanduki ava, avo vanonzi nevaongorori vezvenyaya iyi vavakukanda zvombo zvavo pasi nenyaya yekumukirana nekurwisana muboka revapanduki vejihad iri.
mt0: <pad> UN Development Program says over 350 people have been killed and millions of people have been displaced by the violence committed by the Islamist militants.</s>

en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari said earlier this week that the war against the extremists is "approaching its conclusion," citing continued military airstrikes and the mass defection of thousands of the fighters, some of whom analysts say are laying down their arms because of infighting within the jihadi group.
sna: Mutungamiriri weNigeriamukutanga kwesvondo rino vakati hondo yekurwisa vapanduki vanokakatira kurutivi yava “kuswedera kumagumo ayo” vakapa muenzaniso kurohwa nepfuti dzemuchadenga nekutiza kuri kuita zviuru zvevarwi vachisiya bato iri, vamwe vacho varikunzi vava kukanda zvombo pasi nekuda kwekurwisana mukati mechikwata che jihadi ichi.
mt0: <pad> Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari earlier this week said the war against Islamists was "close to its end" citing airstrikes and the fleeing of thousands of soldiers, some of whom were reportedly killed by internal clashes in the jihadi group.</s>

en: The violence, however, continues in border communities and areas closer to the Lake Chad region, the stronghold of the Islamic State-linked group, ISWAP.
sna: Bonggozozo rekukuvadzana iri riri kuenderera mberi kumisha iri kumiganhu yenyika yeNigeria, uye nekunzvimbo dziri mujinga redhamu guru re Lake Chad, inova nzvimbo inoparutsigiro rwakawanda kuboka reISWAP, iro rinodyidzana nechikwata che Islamic State.
mt0: <pad> The fighting continues in villages on the Nigerian border, and in the areas of Lake Chad, which is a major supporting site for the ISWAP group, which is affiliated with the Islamic State group.</s>

en: Things are getting worse in Kautukari village in Chibok and adjourning areas closer to the forest, said community leader Chibok, saying the extremists' presence near the forest is a contributing factor.
sna: zvinhu zviri kuramba zvichienda kumawere mumushaweKautukari kuChibok nenzvimbo dzakaipoteredza dzakadziva kumasango, vakadaro mukuru wenzvimbo iyi vaChibok, vachitiwo kuvapo kwevapanduki vanokakatira kurutivi ava pedyo nesango iri kuri kuwedzera pkuti kurwisana uku kutsviriridze.
mt0: <pad> The situation is continuing to deteriorate in Kautukari slum in Chibok and the surrounding areas of the forest, said the Chibok mayor. He also said that the presence of rebels near the forest is increasing as the fight intensifies.</s>

en: Reporting Under Attack in South Sudan, Sudan
sna: Kutapa Nhau Korwuswa Kunyika DzeSouth Sudan neSudan
mt0: <pad> The latest news from South Sudan and Somalia</s>

en: Journalists in both Sudan and South Sudan say threats, intimidation and arbitrary arrests are part of everyday life, limiting their ability to inform the public.
sna: Vatapi vebhau munyika mbiri dzinoti Sudan ne South Sudan vanoti kutyisidzrirwa, kuvhundutsirwa nekungosungwa pasina mhosva yaparwa ndokwakudya kwavo kwezuva nezuva,izvo zvavakuganhura goneso yavo kupakurura mashoko kune veruzhinji,
mt0: <pad> Writers in the two countries of Sudan and South Sudan say that intimidation, harassment and detention without charge is their daily meal, which has hampered their ability to publish information to the public.</s>

en: South Sudan ranks 128th and Sudan ranks 151st out of 180 countries in Reporters Without Borders annual World Press Freedom Index, released Tuesday to coincide with the United Nations annual recognition of World Press Freedom Day.
sna: South Sudan iri pachimbo che zana nemakumi maviri nemasere, ukuwo Sudan iri pachinhanho chezana nemakumi masanu nerimwe pakati penyika dzinosvika zana nemakumi masere muchikero chekuona kuti nyika dzinochengetedza sei rusununguko rwezvevanotapa nhau gore negore chinoitwa nesangano renhau rinonzi Reporters Without Borders, icho chakaburitswa nemusi weChipiri kuti chibva chaita mahwekwe nechiitiko chegore negore chezuva rekucherechedza kusununguka kwezvekutorwa kwenhau chinoitwa nesangano remubatanidzwawenyika dzepasi rose re United Nations.
mt0: <pad> South Sudan is ranked as the 123rd and Sudan as the 151st in the Reporters Without Borders' annual Index on Protecting Journalists, which was released on Tuesday to coincide with the United Nations' annual day of press freedom.</s>

en: The bigger the number, the worse the environment for news media.
sna: Kana nyika iine chinzvimbo chekuzasi pachiyero ichi,zvinorevawo kuti mabasa ezvekutora nhau anenge akaomarara chaizvo.
mt0: <pad> If a country is in the bottom of this list, it means that the press freedom is very difficult.</s>

en: Irene Ayaa of the Association for Media Development in South Sudan says government censorship in her country is widespread.
sna: Irene Ayaa wesangano reAssociation for Media Development muSouth Sudan anoti kurambidzwa kushambadza mashoko nhau idambudziko ratekeshera munyika yavo.
mt0: <pad> Irene Ayaa of the Association for Media Development in South Sudan says that the ban on the publication of news is a problem widespread in their country.</s>

en: Last month, we registered four articles removed from newspapers, she said.
sna: Mwedzi wakapfuura takaverenga zvinyorwa zvenhau zvinoitazvina zvakarambidzwa kuburitswa mamapepanhaumkadaro muzvare Irene ayaa
mt0: <pad> Last month we read reports that the government had banned the publication of newspapers in Zimbabwe.</s>

en: Between January and March alone, security personnel removed dozens of articles from the Juba Monitor, Anna Namiriano, editor-in-chief of an English-language daily, told South Sudan in Focus.
sna: Annah Namiriano mupepepeti mukuru webepanhau rinobuda mazuva ese reJuba Monito akaudza sangano reSouth Sudan in Focus kuti, 'Pakati paNdira naKurume, vashandi mubazi rezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyika vakabvisa zvizvinyorwa zvenhau zvakawanda kubva mubepanhau.
mt0: <pad> Annah Namiriano, editor-in-chief of the daily Juba Monito newspaper told South Sudan in Focus that, 'Between January and March, security officers removed many news articles from the newspaper.</s>

en: "They removed stories and we left the space blank. They say why we are not listening to them, so on 17th of March, they suspended the newspaper."
sna: Vakaakabvisa nhau dzaifanirwa kunge dziri mubepanhau, saka isuwo takasiya nzvimbodzenhau idzi dzakashama dzisina chakange chiripo. Vashandivehurumede ava vakazotiti seimuine nharo,nekudaro musi wa17 Kurume vakabva vamisa kushanda kwebepanhau redu."
mt0: <pad> They removed the news from the paper, so we also left the newsrooms empty. The activists finally decided that you were in conflict, and on March 17 they suspended the publication of our newspaper.</s>

en: In February, a handful of journalists were briefly detained for covering a press conference by opposition lawmakers in parliament.
sna: Muna Kukadzi vamwe vatapi venhau vakatorwa nemapurisakwechinguva chipfupi mushure mekunge vaenda kunotapa nhau pachiitiko chekuti vamiririri veparamende vari mumapoka anokwikwidza vakange vachitura mashoko avo kumasangano ezvenhau.
mt0: <pad> In February, some journalists were detained by police for a short time after going to cover the event where rival political parties were giving their statements to press organizations.</s>

en: A Juba Monitor newspaper article about the incident was removed by security agents at the printing plant.
sna: Nhau dzakange dziri pamusoro pechiitiko ichi dzakange dzanyorwa nebepanhau reJuba Monitor dzakabviswa nevashandi vemubazi rekuchengetedzwakwenyika bepanhau rava pamushina wekudhinda.
mt0: <pad> The news of the incident which was reported by the Juba Monitor was removed by security personnel from the press machine of the paper.</s>

en: We dont have freedom of the press in the country, Namiriano said.
sna: Muzvare Namiriano akati,'hatinakusunguka kwezvekutorwa kwenhau munyika muno.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Namiriano said,'We don't have freedom of press in this country.</s>

en: "The solution is let us do our work as media houses. We have the code of conduct, we have the media law to guide us, and removal of stories is really very bad."
sna: Mhinguro iri pakutenderwa kuti tiite basa redu semasangano anotapa nhau. Tine bumbiroredu reku tinofanirwa kubata basa redu sei nehunyanzvi nemwero wakanaka, uye tine mitemo inoona mashandiro ezvekutapwakwenhau. naizvozvo kubviswa kwenhau dzinofanirwa kuverengwaneveruzhinji chinhu chakaipisisa zvachose."
mt0: <pad> The complaint is about allowing us to do our job as news organizations. We have a code of conduct that defines how we should handle our work with professionalism and good standards, and we have rules that govern the operation of news organizations. so removing stories that are worthy of public reading is absolutely wrong."</s>

en: South Sudans information minister, Michael Makuei, insists press freedom is alive and well in his country.
sna: Gurukota rinoona nezvekufambiswa kwemashoko muSouth Sudan,vaMichael Makuei vanotsinhidzira kuti kusununguko kwezve kutapwa kwenhau kupenyu, kwakagwinya kuchipfachukira nehupenyu
mt0: <pad> The Minister of Information in South Sudan, Michael Makuei, has declared that the freedom of live news coverage, which is strongly supported by the people, has exploded with life.</s>

en: South Sudan is the only place where journalists are free, where they enjoy absolute freedom according to the law.
sna: "South Sudan ndiyo nzvimbo yoga iyo vatapi venhau vanoshanda vaine kusununguka kuzere maringe nemitemoyedu.
mt0: <pad> "South Sudan ndiye yega nzvimbo iyo vatapi venhau vanokwanisa kuita basa ravo nevatongi vachishandisa rusununguko rwekuratidza nyaya dzavo."</s>

en: I say, 'according to the law,' because there is nothing absolute in this world, Makuei told South Sudan in Focus.
sna: Ndati maringe nemitemo yedu nekuti pasipano hapana chinhu chinonzi vanhu ngavangoita sezvavada pavanenge vadira", vakadaro vaMakuei vachiudza sangano renhau reSouth Sudan in Focus.
mt0: <pad> I said it according to our law because there is no such thing as people can do what they want when they want," he said in an interview with South Sudan's news agency Focus.</s>

en: The United Nations Commission on Human Rights refutes that assertion.
sna: Sangano remubatanidzwa wenyika dzose richiona nezvekodzero dzevanhu reUnited Nations Commision on H uman Rights haribvumirane nemaonero aya.
mt0: <pad> The United Nations Commission on Human Rights does not agree with this view.</s>

en: In a report issued last October, it said the government is harassing activists, journalists and their families, limiting their activities and targeting their work and finances.
sna: Muchinyorwa  chakabuda chemaonero arinoita mamiriro ezvinhu muSouth Sudan chavakaburitsa muna Gumiguru, sangano irirakati hurumendeirikutambudza nekushungurudza vanorwira kodzerodzevanhu,vatorivenhau andnemhuridzavo, vachikanganisa nekuganhura basa ravo nezvemari dzavo.
mt0: <pad> In their most recent report on the situation in South Sudan in October, the organization said the government was abusing and harming human rights workers, journalists and their families, interfering with their work and stealing their money.</s>

en: South Sudan is one of the most dangerous places in the world to be a journalist, according to the commission.
sna: Sangano iri rinoti South Sudan ndiyo imwe yenzvimbo dzine njodzi hurusa kumutori wenhau kuti ange achishandira mairi.
mt0: <pad> The organization says South Sudan is one of the most dangerous places for journalists to work.</s>

en: South Sudan has a lot of work to do to establish and solidify the institutions that are critical to a well-functioning democratic state, David Renz, charge daffaires for the U.S. Embassy in South Sudan, said in a statement Tuesday, adding that the U.S. remains deeply concerned about the state of press freedom in South Sudan.
sna: South Sudan ichiri iine basa zhinji rekuita kutiimise nekusimbisa masangano nemapazi akakosha mukushanda mekufambira mberi kwe nyika yegutsaruzhinji, vakadaro vadavid Renz mukuru mumuzinda unomiririra nyika ye United statesmuSouth Sudan mumashoko avo akabuda musi weChipiri, umo vakatsinhidzirawo kuti nyika yeUSA inoshushikana zvikuru nemamiriro ekushaiwa kusununguka kwemasangano enhau muSouth Sudan.
mt0: <pad> South Sudan still has much work to do to establish and strengthen key institutions and roles in the process of building a democratic state, said David Renz, senior United States envoy to South Sudan on Tuesday, where he also expressed concern about the situation of media freedom in South Sudan.</s>

en: We have seen some of the local radio stations shut down over very trivial matters, Renz said.
sna: "Takaona zvimwe zviteshi zvemaredhiyo emuno achimiswa kuita basa pamusoro petwunyaya twusina nemusorowese," vakadaro vaRenz.
mt0: <pad> "We have seen some local radio stations being shut down over issues we don't know or about the world," said Mr. Renz.</s>

en: "And we also are aware that journalists of radio and television and even social media are self-censored" and wary of local and national governments actions "to penalize journalists who say things the government would prefer that they not say."
sna: "Uye tinozvizivawo kuti vashandi vanoita zvekutepfenyura pamasaisayi emaredhiyo, pamadzangaradzimu nepamadandemutande enhaurirano dzepamadariro esocial media avakutya kutaura zvavanenge vachida kutaura.
mt0: <pad> "We also know that journalists on radio, television and social media platforms are afraid to speak out their minds.</s>

en: Further complications from coup
sna: Zvimwe zvimhingamupinyi zvotanga mushure mekubvutwa kwemasimba ekutonga nyika nemauto
mt0: <pad> Some protests started after the power of government was seized by the rebels.</s>

en: In Sudan, journalists in the capital city of Khartoum say harassment and threats have increased since the October 25 military takeover.
sna: MuSudan, vatori venhau vanoshanda vari muguta guru renyika iyi, Khartoum, vanotikushungurudzwa nekutyisidzirwa kwavo kwakawedzerwa kubva mauto akabvuta masimba ekutonga nyika neganyavhu musi wa25 Gumiguru
mt0: <pad> In Sudan, journalists working in the capital city of Khartoum say their harassment and intimidation has increased since the military seized power on 25 August.</s>

en: Shoggi Abdulazeem, an investigative journalist in Sudan, said he received a death threat in November and was warned not to speak to international media.
sna: Shoggi Abdulazeem,uyo anotora nhau achiita zvekuferefeta nekubvunzurudza kusvika abata mudzi wayo, akati munaMbudzi akatumirwa mashoko ekumutyisidzira nekupondwa, akanzi asataure nevmasangano enhau ekune dzimwe nyika.
mt0: <pad> Shoggi Abdulazeem, a journalist who investigates and reports on the killings of innocent people in Somalia, said in December he received threats and abuse messages, and was told not to speak with international news organizations.</s>

en: I was hosting live on Al Jazeera and after leaving their office, eight armed security men followed me in a pickup.
sna: Ndakange ndiine Al Jazeera pamhepo, uye mushure mekubuda muhofisi mangu, varume vezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyika vasere vakapakata pfuti vakanditevera vari mumotokari inotakura zvinhu kumashure.
mt0: <pad> I had Al Jazeera on the internet, and after leaving my office, eight armed security men in a back-up vehicle followed me.</s>

en: They surrounded my car, Abdulazeem said.
sna: Vakakomberedza motokari yangu, akadaro Abdulazeem.
mt0: <pad> They surrounded my car, said Abdulazeem.</s>

en: He told South Sudan in Focus he was blindfolded and moved around "for more than two hours" and was ordered "not to criticize the military again."
sna: Akaudza South Sudan in Focus kuti akavharwa kumeso nejira akafambwa fambwa naye “kwenguva inodarika maawa maviri” ndokuzorayirwa “kusafa akatsoropodza vechiuto zvakare.”
mt0: <pad> He told South Sudan in Focus that he was blindfolded for "over two hours" and then ordered "not to insult the troops again."</s>

en: Covering pro-democracy protests in Sudan continues to be a dangerous endeavor, Abdulazeem said.
sna: Kunyora nhau pamusoro pekuratidzira kwevanodakutonga kwegutsaruzhinjirava basa rinenjodzi hurusa,akadaro Abdulazeem.
mt0: <pad> Writing about the protests is a risky job, said Abdulazeem.</s>

en: Many newspapers, TV channels and radio stations received directives not to host or conduct interviews with some named individuals who criticize military leaders, Abdulazeem said.
sna: Mapepanhau, mazhinji nezviteshi zvinotepfenyura pamadzangaradzimu nemaredhiyo akagamuchira mashoko aivaudza kuti vasaite nhaurirano kana kana kuburitsa mashoko anobva pamhinduro dzinobva pamibvunzo inenge yapindurwa nevanhu avo vanotsoropodza vatungamiriri vemauto akadaro Abdulazeem.
mt0: <pad> The newspapers, most and radio stations on the Internet and in the radio have received messages that they should not interview or publish any responses to questions from people who criticize military leaders such as Abdulazeem.</s>

en: He added, "There are intelligence officers who are assigned to monitor this situation."
sna: Akazotiwo, "Pane vaferefeti vehurumende vakatumwa kuzoferefeta nekuongorora kuti zvisungo izvi zvirikuteedzerwa here.
mt0: <pad> He added, "There are government investigators sent to investigate and assess whether these commitments are being complied with."</s>

en: Aisha Assamani, an executive member of the independent Sudanese Media Network, told South Sudan in Focus he has recorded more than 10 attacks on journalists and media houses since last year's coup.
sna: Aisha Assamani, anova nhengo yesangano revatapi venhau vekuSudan rakazvimiririra roga rinonzi Sudanese Media Network, akaudza sangano renhau reSouth Sudan in Focus kuti kubva mauto zvaakabvuta hutungamiriri hwenyika nechisimba averenga kanodarika kagumi kushungurudzwa nekupfuviswa kwevatapi venhau nemasangano ezvenhau.
mt0: <pad> Aisha Assamani, a member of the Sudanese Media Network, told South Sudan's Focus news organization that since the forces seized power in June she has seen at least 10 cases of harassment and expulsion of journalists and media organizations.</s>

en: They are targeting freedom of speech with so much excessive force, Assamani said.
sna: Vari kumbunyikidza kodzero dzekuti vanhu vanotaura zvavanofunga vakasununguka nechisimba chakanyanyisa, Assamani akadaro.
mt0: <pad> They are abusing the right of people to speak out their minds with excessive force, Assamani said.</s>

en: "The majority of our journalists now are fearful and their lives are in danger.
sna: "Ruzhinji rwevatapi venhau vedu vava kutya uye hupenyu hwavo hwava munjodzi.
mt0: <pad> "Our many journalists are afraid and their lives are in danger."</s>

en: Most of them remain anonymous due to the danger of the situation."
sna: Vazhinji vavo havachaise mazita avo panhau dzavanenge vanyora nekuda kwekutyisa kuri kuita maririro ezvinhu kuvatapi venhau."
mt0: <pad> Most of them don't name their stories because of the fears that the situation is causing to journalists.</s>

en: On December 30, Sudanese security forces stormed the offices of three television stations al-Arabiya, al-Hadath and al-Sharq firing tear gas, assaulting staff and destroying broadcast equipment, according to local news media.
sna: Nhau dzinobva kumasangano enhau emuSuda anoti nemusi wa 30 Zvita, mauto emuSudan akapinda zvinechisimba muma hofisi ezviteshi zvitatu zvinotepfenyura pamadzangaradzimu (Television) anoti al-Arabiya, al-Hadath uye ne al-Sharq ndokuputitsa hutsi hunokachidza nekutossvora pamwe nekurova vashandi nekupaza midziyo inoshandiswa kutepfenyura zvirongwa
mt0: <pad> Sudan news agencies report that on December 30, Sudanese troops entered the offices of three television stations al-Arabiya, al-Hadath and al-Sharq and burned them with fire and tear gas, beating employees and destroying equipment used to transmit programs.</s>

en: That same day, security forces detained al-Sharq correspondents Maha Al-Talb and Sally Othman for hours before releasing them.
sna: Musi mumwe chete uyu mauto akatora vatori venhau yenhpfenyuro ye al-Sharq vanoti Maha Al-Talb na Sally Othman kwemaawa akawanda pedzezvo ndokuzovasunungura.
mt0: <pad> The same day, troops held two journalists of al-Sharq radio station Maha Al-Talb and Sally Othman for several hours before freeing them.</s>

en: On January 16, Sudanese authorities withdrew the broadcast license of Al Jazeera Live and closed its office in Khartoum.
sna: Musi wa16 Ndira, vakuru vakuru vemuSudan vakatora marezinesi nezvitambi zvekutepfenyura kubva kunhepfenyuro ye Al Jazeera Live uye nekuvharisa mahofisi ayo muguta guru reKhartoum.
mt0: <pad> On January 16, Sudan's authorities seized the licenses and broadcasting materials from Al Jazeera Live and closed its offices in the capital Khartoum.</s>

en: A letter from the Information Ministry to the director of Al Jazeera television in Sudan attributed the closing to an "unprofessional approach" and media content that "harmed the countrys higher interests and national security."
sna: Tsamba yakabva kubazi rezvekufambiswa kwemashoko muSudan ichienda kumukuru wenhepfenyuro ye Al Jazeera Television muSudan yakati chakakozeresa kuvharwa kwenhepfenyuro iyi kwaiva"kusabata basa nemazvo nehumhizha" uyewo nezvirongwa izvo "zvaikuvadza nekukanganisa zvido nezvis higher interests huvo zvikuru zvenyika uyewo kuchengetedzwa kwayo kubva kumhandu."
mt0: <pad> The Sudan's ministry of information sent a letter to the director of Al Jazeera television in Sudan saying that the reason for the station's closure was "incompetence and poor professionalism" and programs that "deservedly and wrongly affected the interests and higher interests of the country and its protection from external influence."</s>

en: The Doha-based network condemned the closure.
sna: Nhepfenyuro iyi inemuzinda wavo muguta re-Doha kuUnited Arab Emirates rakatsoropodza kuvharwa kwechiteshi chayo muKhartoum nehurumende.
mt0: <pad> The station, which has its headquarters in Doha, the United Arab Emirates, criticized the government for closing its station in Khartoum.</s>

en: In February, Sudanese authorities arrested a group of BBC reporters in Khartoum and questioned them for several hours before releasing them.
sna: Muna Kukadzi, vakuru vakuru vemuSudan vakasunga boka revatapi venhau vesangano renhau reBBC muguta reKhartoum ndokuvabvunzurudza kwemaawa akati kuti kwava kuzovaregedza vachienda.
mt0: <pad> In February, Sudanese authorities detained a team of BBC journalists in Khartoum and interrogated them for hours before they said they would be freed.</s>

en: VOA repeatedly called Sudans government for comment, but those calls to Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, press advisor to military leader Abdul Fattah al-Burhan went unanswered.
sna: Sangano renhau reVOA rakada kunzwa kuti hurumende yeSudan inoti kudii panyaya iyi, nhare yakaridzirwa Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja vanova mupi wemazano kumukuru wemauto arikutonga muSudan,  asi nhare idzi dzairira dzisina anodaira.
mt0: <pad> The Sudan government did not respond to the request for comment from the VOA news agency. Brigadier General Attahir Abu Haja, a military adviser to the commander of the armed forces in Sudan, answered the phone but the phones rang without anyone answering.</s>

en: Michael Atit reported from Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng and Manyang David Mayar reported from Juba, South Sudan.
sna: Michael Atit akatumira nhau ari muKhartoum, kuSudan; Deng Ghai Deng naManyang David Mayar vatumirawo zvayiitika vai muJuba, kuSouth Sudan.
mt0: <pad> Michael Atit reported from Khartoum, Sudan; Deng Ghai Deng and Manyang David Mayar also reported from Juba, South Sudan.</s>

en: At Least 30 Burundian AU Soldiers Killed in Al-Shabab Attack, Official Says
sna: Vakuru vakuru Vanotii Mauto EkuBurundi Anosvika Makumi Matatu Aive Pakati Pemasoja eAU Akaurayiwa Pavakarwiswa ne Al-Shabab.
mt0: <pad> Burundian officials say about 30 soldiers among the AU peacekeepers were killed in an attack by al-Shabab.</s>

en: At least 30 Burundian soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in Tuesday's attack by al-Shabab militants on an African Union base in southern Somalia, according to a Burundian official.
sna: Mumwe mukuru wemuBurundi anoti mauto ekuBurundi anosvika makumi matatu akaurayiwa nevamwe makumi mairi akakuvadzwa musi weChipiri mukurwiswa kwakaitwa muzinda wemasoja eAfrican Union nevarwi veAl-Shababkuchamhende kwe  Pavakarwiswa ne Al-Shabab.
mt0: <pad> A Burundian official said about 30 Burundian soldiers were killed and 20 wounded in the attack on the African Union base by Al-Shabab militants on Tuesday.</s>

en: The official, who requested anonymity because he is not allowed to speak to media, told VOA Somali that 10 soldiers died on the spot, and the rest of the soldiers succumbed to their wounds.
sna: Mukuru uyu akakumbira kuti asadomwe nezita rake nekuti haana mvumo yekutaura nevatapi venhau, akaudza vatori venhau veVOA yekuSomali kuti masoja anodarika gumi akafira panzvimbo yavakarwisirwa, vamwewo ndokuzofa nekuda kwemaronda avaive nawo.
mt0: <pad> The official, who asked not to be named because he did not have the right to speak to the press, told Somalian VOA journalists that over 10 soldiers died in the siege, and others later died from wounds sustained during the siege.</s>

en: He confirmed that other soldiers are still missing.
sna: Akatsinhidzirawo kuti kune mamwe masoja asati azivikanwa kuti aripi.
mt0: <pad> He also implied that there were some soldiers who were not known where they were.</s>

en: Al-Shabab said it killed 173 soldiers in the attack on the AU base in the village of El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu.
sna: weAl-Shabab inoti yakauraya masoja anosvika zana nemakumi manomwe nevatatu payakarwisa kamba yemasoja eAU mumusha El-Baraf, iri makiromita angasvike zana nemakumimashanu kubva kumaodzanyemba eMogadishu.
mt0: <pad> Al-Shabab says it has killed up to 173 AU troops in an attack on the AU base in El-Baraf, about 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu.</s>

en: The casualty figure has not been independently verified.
sna: Huwandu hwevavakakuvara hausati hwaongororwa nenyanzvi dzisina divi ravakarerekera.
mt0: <pad> The number of injured has not yet been assessed by experts who do not have a specific part of the body.</s>

en: A separate source told VOA Somali that 161 soldiers were at the camp at the time of attack.
sna: Mumwe munhu akanyevera VOA Somali kuti paive nemasoja zana nemakumi matanhatu nerimwe panguva paitwa kurwiswa uku. Mukuru wemuBurundian uyu akatsinhira kuti huwandu hwemauto hwakataurwa kuti aive mukamba ndowechokwadi.
mt0: <pad> A source told VOA Somali that there were 161 soldiers in the camp at the time of the attack. The Burundian official confirmed the number of troops said to be in the camp was true.</s>

en: The Burundian official confirmed that number.
sna: Mukuru wemuBurundian uyu akatsinhira kuti huwandu hwemauto hwakataurwa kuti aive mukamba ndowechokwadi.
mt0: <pad> The Burundian official confirmed that the number of troops said to be in camp was true.</s>

en: The Burundian official told VOA Somali that the soldiers had intelligence al-Shabab was gathering in a nearby village about 48 hours prior to the attack.
sna: Mukuru wemuBurundi uyu akaudza VOA Somali kuti masoja akange anzwa runyerekupe rwekuti al-Shabab yakange yakaungana panemumwe musha waiva pedyo nekamba yavo kwemaawa angaite makumi mana nemasere kukrwiswa uku kusati kwaitika.
mt0: <pad> The Burundian general told VOA Somali that the troops had received information that al-Shabab was meeting in a village near their camp for about 40 hours before the attack.</s>

en: He said the soldiers prepared to defend themselves and dug trenches.
sna: Akatiwo masoja akange agadzirira kuzvichengetedza nekuzvirwira uye akange achera makomba ekuhwanda maari.
mt0: <pad> He also said the troops were prepared to defend and protect themselves and were digging tunnels for hiding.</s>

en: He said what caught the soldiers by surprise was the enormity of al-Shabab explosives detonated at the camp.
sna: Akaenderera mberi achiti chakashamisa masoja aya kwaiva kukura kwemabhomba e al-Shaba avakakanda akaputikira mukamba yavo.
mt0: <pad> He continued by saying that the troops were alarmed by the size of the bombs al-Shabab had planted in their camp.</s>

en: He said the militants used three truck bombs, one of which fell into a ditch.
sna: Akatizve varwi ava vakashandisa marori matatu kutakura mabhomba aya, imwe yemarori aya yakawira mugoma.
mt0: <pad> He said the soldiers used three cars to transport the bombs, one of which fell into the water.</s>

en: He estimated the militants detonated about 20 kilograms of explosives, and that 450 militants overran the camp.
sna: Akafungidzira kuti varwi ava vakashandisa mabhomba ane huremu hwungasvike ma kilogramme makumi mairi uye varwi vakapinda mukamba iyi vachiyirwisa vaisvika mazana mana nemakumi mashanu.
mt0: <pad> He estimated that they used bombs weighing up to 20 kilograms and that there were about 450 soldiers entering the camp and attacking it.</s>

en: The official said the suicide truck bombs caused most of the casualties.
sna: Mukuru muhurumende uyu akati marori akange ane mabhaobhu nevanhu vakazvipira kuzviiputsitira mabhombu kuti vaurayewo vanhu ndizvo zvakakonzeresa kufa nekukuvara kuzhinji..
mt0: <pad> The government official said that bomb-laden trucks and self-propelled bombs were the cause of most deaths and injuries.</s>

en: Earlier, the government of Burundi reported 10 of their soldiers were killed, with five others missing and 25 injured.
sna: Izvi zvisati zvazivikanwa, hurumende yeBurundi yakatura mashoko ekuti masoja avo gumi akange afa, paine vashanu vakange vashaikwa uye ne vamwe makumi maviri nemashanu vakange vakuvara.
mt0: <pad> Before this was known, the government of Burundi reported that 10 of its soldiers had been killed, five were missing and 25 injured.</s>

en: Burundi also said 20 al-Shabab militants were killed in the attack.
sna: Burundi yakatiwo makumi maviri evarwi ve al-Shabab vakange vaurayiwawo mukurwiswa uku.
mt0: <pad> Burundi said that 20 al-Shabab fighters were killed in the attack.</s>

en: On Twitter, Burundi President Evariste Ndayishimiye said there are no words strong enough to condemn the terrorist attack against the Burundian contingent.
sna: Padandemutande reTwitter,Mutungamiriri weBurundi, vaEvariste Ndayishimiye vakati vakuna mashoko akasimbarara angawaninikwe angatsoropodze nekushora kurwiswa kwakaitwa nemagandsanga uku.
mt0: <pad> On Twitter, the President of Burundi, Evariste Ndayishimiye said that they had received strong information to condemn and condemn the attack by the Tuaregs.</s>

en: He wrote, "I join with all of Africa which has just lost sons and daughters to console the hard-hit families."
sna: Vakanyora kuti, "Ndinobatana pamwepo neAfrica yose iyo ichangorasikirwa ne vanakomana nevanasikana  mukunyaradza mhuri dzarwadziswa nechiitiko ichi."
mt0: <pad> He wrote, "I join all Africa who have just lost their sons and daughters in consoling the families affected by this tragedy."</s>

en: The African Union, the Somali government and the embassy of the United States in Mogadishu have all strongly condemned the al-Shabab attack.
sna: Mubatanidzwa wenyika dzemuAfrica weAfrican Union, hurumende ye Somali nemuzinda unomiririra United States uri muMogadishu vose vashora zvakasimbisisa kurisa kwakaitwa ne al-Shabab uku.
mt0: <pad> The African Union, the Somali government and the United States consulate in Mogadishu have all condemned the al-Shabab attack.</s>

en: AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian soldiers killed, and said the "heinous" attack will not lessen support of AU forces to Somalia.
sna: Mukuru weAU vaMoussa Faki Mahamat vakapa kuremekedza kumauto eBurundian akafa aya, vakatiwo "kurwisa uku "kwakange kuzere chinya" hakuzoite kuti rutsigiro runopiwa varwi veAU vari kuSomalia rwuderere.
mt0: <pad> AU chief Moussa Faki Mahamat paid tribute to the Burundian troops who died, saying that the attack "was full of hatred" and would not allow the support given to the AU forces in Somalia to be delayed.</s>

en: The Somali ministry of foreign affairs called on the international community to increase and provide higher-end capability to Somali security forces and AU forces so they can effectively combat terrorism in Somalia.
sna: Bazi rinoona nezvekudyidzana nedzimwe nyika muSomali rakakumbira nyika dzepasi rose riwedzere kupa goneso nezvombo zvepamusoro soro kuvarwi venyika yeSomali nemauto eAU kuti vanyarwisana nekupedza hugandanga muSomalia.
mt0: <pad> The Ministry of International Development in Somalia has urged the international community to provide more weapons and equipment to the Somali National Guard and AU forces to fight and end the violence in Somalia.</s>

en: The U.S. embassy in Mogadishu said the U.S. extends condolences to the families of the troops killed and wished a quick recovery to those injured.
sna: Muzinda unomiririra US muMogadishu wakati unotumira mashoko ekunyaradza nekubata maoko kumhuri dzine masoja akaurayiwa nekushuvira kupora nekukasira kune vose vakakuvara.
mt0: <pad> The US embassy in Mogadishu said it sent condolences and hugs to the families of the soldiers killed and wished quick recovery to all injured.</s>

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told VOA that Tuesday's fighting at the camp was the heaviest the area has seen.
sna: Mukuru weguta reEl-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, wakaudza VOA kuti kurwisana kwakaitika pakamba yemasoja iyi ndiko kwaingekwakaipisisa kwati kwamboonekwa mugua mudunhu iri.
mt0: <pad> The mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, told the VOA that the clashes at the army base were the worst in the region since they began to see each other.</s>

en: Fighting like this never happened in this area, he said, explaining that the violence also killed two civilians and injured 10 others. "It was heavy fighting."
sna: Kurwisana kwakadai hakusati kwamboitika mudunhu rino, akadaro ndokuzoenederera mberi achiti kurwisana uku kwakange kwaurayawo vanhuwo zvavo vaviri nekukuvadzawo vamwe gumi. "Kwaiva kurwisana kwakadzama chaizvo."
mt0: <pad> "This was a very serious fight," he added, adding that two civilians had been killed and 10 injured.</s>

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
sna: Chiitiko ichi kwakava kurwiswa kwekutanga kukuru pamauto eAU anoshanda muEthiopia kubva zvakaashandura zita ravo nemamiriro ekushanda kwavo mwedzi wapera.
mt0: <pad> The attack was the first major attack on AU forces in Ethiopia since they changed their name and mission last month.</s>

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, gave it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to the Somali government.
sna: Bazi rinoona nezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyikamusangano renyika dzepasi rose re U.N. Security Council, iri rakapa mvumo yekuti kuve nebasa iri rekuchengetedza runyararo muSomalia rinonzi African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, rakaripa mutoro wekuderedza njodzi inobva kumagandanga evapanduki  e al-Shabab, vachipa rutsigiro negoneso kumauto emuSomalia uye kuzopa muzvidimbu masimba ekuchengetedza nyika kuhurumende yeSomalia dzamara yavakuita basa racho yega.
mt0: <pad> The UN Security Council, which approved the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia, has been assigned the task of assessing the danger posed by al-Shabab, providing support and training to the Somali army and transferring security powers to the Somali government after it is able to do it alone.</s>

en: The mission's mandate runs through the end of 2024.
sna: Basa reboka iri rinenge riripo kusvikira kumagumo egore ra2024.
mt0: <pad> The committee will be in place until the end of 2024.</s>

en: This story comes from VOA's Somali and Central African services.
sna: Nyaya iyi inobva kumahofisi eVOA ari muSomali nemu Central African.
mt0: <pad> This story comes from the VOA offices in Somalia and Central African Republic.</s>

en: Kenya Trains Domestic Workers in Middle East About Rights
sna: Kenya Yodzidzisa Vashandi Vemudzimba Vari kuMiddle East Nezvekodzero Dzavo
mt0: <pad> Kenya to train domestic workers in the Middle East on their rights</s>

en: Kenyan authorities are training domestic workers who accept jobs in the Middle East about their rights after years of reported abuses there, including beatings, rapes and deaths.
sna: Vakuru vemu Kenya vava kudzidzisa vashandi vekudzimba veko vatambira mabasa munyika dzemu Middle East pamusoro pekodzerodzavo mushure memakore ekutaurwa nezve kumbunyikidzwa kwekodzero ikoko, zvinosanganisira kurohwa, zvibharo nekupondwa.
mt0: <pad> Kenyan officials are now training domestic workers who go to work in the Middle East about their rights after years of reports of human rights abuses there, including beatings, rapes and rapes.</s>

en: It's been a year since Bernard Njenga learned his wife, Esther Thuku, had died in Saudi Arabia, where she had been a domestic worker for three years.
sna: Rava gore kubva apo Bernard Njenga akazoziva kuti mudzimayi wake, Esther Thuku, akafira kuSaudi Arabia, uko akange ari mushandi wemumba kwemakore matatu.
mt0: <pad> It's been a year since Bernard Njenga learned that his wife, Esther Thuku, had died in Saudi Arabia, where she had been a housemaid for three years.</s>

en: Saudi authorities reported that his wife had committed suicide at her employer's home, Njenga said, but he believes the mother of four was murdered.
sna: Vakuru vemuSaudi vakazivisa kuti mukazi wake  akange azviuraya pamba pevanhu vaayishandira, Njenga akadaro, asiakagutsikana kuti  mudzimai wake waive nevana vana akapondwa.
mt0: <pad> Saudi authorities informed him that his wife had committed suicide in the home of his employers, he said, unhappy that his wife who had four children was kidnapped.</s>

en: Njenga said his wife's body did not have any marks that would show that she had hanged herself.
sna: Njenga akati muviri wedzimayi wake wakange usina mavanga ayiratidza kuti akange azvisungirira.
mt0: <pad> Njenga said his mother's body was uncovered with blankets, showing that she had been self-sufficient.</s>

en: It appeared the body had been buried because it was very dirty and looked like she had been stabbed on the left side, he added.
sna: Akaendereramberi achiti zvairatidza sekunge chitunha ichi chakambofushirwa nekuti  chaive netsvina yakawanda uye zvaiita sekuti mukadzi wake wakange abayiwa nechinhu chinopinza parutive rweruboshwe.
mt0: <pad> He continued by saying that the body looked like it had been burned before because it was soiled and his wife seemed to have been hit with something stuck in her left eye.</s>

en: Kenyan authorities say that since November, at least 23 domestic workers have died while working in the Middle East.
sna: Vakuru vemu Kenya vanoti kubva munMbudzi achangodarika, vashandi vemumba vasiri pasi pemakumi maviri vevatatu vakafa vachishanda kuMiddle East.
mt0: <pad> Kenyan officials say that since last December, less than 23 domestic workers have died while working in the Middle East.</s>

en: Most of those deaths occurred in Saudi Arabia, according to labor officials.
sna: Vanoshanda munezvekuwaniswa mabasa vanoti ruzhinji rwendufu idzi rwakaitika kuSaudi Arabia.
mt0: <pad> According to human rights activists, most of the deaths occurred in Saudi Arabia.</s>

en: Saudi authorities have reported that all 23 of those deaths resulted from cardiac arrest.
sna: Vakuru vemuSaudi vakazivisa kuti ndufu dzese dziri makumi maviri nenhatu dzakange dzakonzereswa nemwoyo yakangorega kushanda.
mt0: <pad> Saudi officials said that all sixteen deaths were caused by a heart attack.</s>

en: In April of 2020, rights advocacy group Amnesty International reported that Kenyans who have jobs as domestic workers in the Middle East often complain of lack of payment, forced labor, physical abuse, rape and dangerous working conditions.
sna: Muna Kubvumbi wegore ra2020, chikwata chinorwira kodzero dzevanhu cheAmnesty International chakaburitsa mashoko ekuti vanhu vekuKenya vanoshanda mudzimba kuMiddle East vanowanzogunun'una pamusoro pekusabhadharwa mihoro yavo, kumanikidzwa kuita basa,  kurohwa nekukuvadzwa muviri, kubatwa chibharo nekushandiswa mumamirirro ezvinhu nemunzvimbo dzine njodzi.
mt0: <pad> In May 2020, the human rights group Amnesty International reported that Kenyan domestic workers in the Middle East often complain about unpaid wages, forced labor, physical and sexual abuse, rape and being used in dangerous and hazardous conditions.</s>

en: Now, Kenya is offering safety training for domestic workers who take jobs abroad.
sna: Iyezvino, Kenya yavakupa vanoda dzidziso yekuzvichengetedza kuvashandi vemudzimba vanotora mabasa kunze kwenyika.
mt0: <pad> Now, Kenya is giving the needy self-protection training to domestic workers who take on jobs abroad.</s>

en: When you don't train them, basically, you are exposing them to a lot of exploitation and abuse, said Edith Murogo, director at East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi.
sna: Kana usingavadzidzise,zvaunenge uchitoita, kuvarega vachipinda munjodzi huru yekubatirirwa nekumbunyikidzwa, akadaro muzvare Edith Murogo, mukuru weEast Africa Institute of Homecare Management muNairobi.
mt0: <pad> If you don't educate them, you are putting them at great risk of abuse and neglect, said Ms Edith Murogo, the director of the East Africa Institute of Homecare Management in Nairobi.</s>

en: "Part of the training also includes labor rights awareness.
sna: "Chikamu chedzidziso iyi chinosanganisira kuvaonesa nekuvajekesera nezvekodzero dzevashandi.
mt0: <pad> "Part of this training includes establishing and educating them about the rights of employees.</s>

en: They have to know how to bargain and talk to employees about decent terms and conditions of employment."
sna: Vanofanirwa kuti vazive  kuti vanotaurirana seyi nevashandi pamusoro pezvakanangana nemashandirwo ebasa nemihoro zvinechiremera."
mt0: <pad> They should know that they talk to employees about issues of working conditions and pay with dignity.</s>

en: An estimated 30,000 Kenyans migrate to the Middle East to find work each year.
sna: Vanhu vemuKenya vanosvika zviuru makumi matatu vanotamira kuMiddle East kuti vanotsvaga mabasa ikoko gore negore.
mt0: <pad> Over 30,000 Kenyans travel to the Middle East every year to look for jobs there.</s>

en: Kenya's cabinet secretary for labor, Simon Chelugui, said his department is working with Saudi officials on labor law reforms.
sna: Gurukota rinoona nezvemabasa muhurumende yeKenya, vaSimon Chelugui, vakati bazi ravo riri kushanda nevakuru vekuSaudi kuti pave nekushandurwa mitemo yezvemabasa.
mt0: <pad> The Kenyan Ministry of Labor, Simon Chelugui, said his ministry is working with Saudi Arabian officials to change the labor law.</s>

en: We would want them also to upscale their law to protect workers and employers equally, not to discriminate and have the attitude of the employer is right always, Chelugui said.
sna: Tinodawo kuti vakwidziridze mitemo yavo kuti ichengetedze vashandi nevashandirwi zvakaenzana, kwete kusarudza nekuva nemaonero ekuti mushandirwi ndiye arimugwara nhambo dzose,  Chelugui akadaro.
mt0: <pad> We want them to adopt their laws so that they protect both workers and employers equally, not discriminate and have the view that the employer is always at the wrong end of the story, Chelugui said.</s>

en: "Number two is the pay is reasonable and commensurate to the work."
sna: "Chechipiri ndechekuti mari inotambirwa ine mwero uye inoenderana nebasa riri kuita here."
mt0: <pad> "Second is whether the amount of money paid is reasonable and in line with the work done.</s>

en: VOA reached out to the Saudi embassy in Nairobi for comment on alleged mistreatment and deaths of Kenyan workers.
sna: VOA yakabata muzinda weSaudi muNairobi kuti vanzwewo kuti vanoti kudii nekunenedzerwa kusabatwa zvakanaka nekufa kwevashandi vanobva kuKenya.
mt0: <pad> VOA contacted the Saudi Consulate in Nairobi to hear what they think of allegations of unlawful detainment and the death of Kenyan workers.</s>

en: In an email response, the embassy said the kingdom does not condone illegal and ill treatment of anyone and said Riyadh is working with Nairobi to protect citizens from any offense.
sna: Vachinyora mutsamba yepapotonjere muzinda uyu wakati, humambo hweSaudi Arabia hunoti hautunhidze nekupembedza kubata zvisiri kunze kwemutemo kana kushungurudza munhu upi zvake, wakatizve Saudi Arabia iri kushanda pamwe chete ne Kenya kuti vagari vave vakachengetedzwa kubva pakunetswa kupi zvako.
mt0: <pad> He wrote in a letter to the ambassador that, the kingdom of Saudi Arabia does not endorse or glorify any form of illegal detainment or harassment, and that Saudi Arabia is working with Kenya to ensure its citizens are safe from any danger.</s>

en: Meanwhile, officials say with an estimated 2 million young people graduating each year, according to national figures, and only about 800,000 new jobs, many Kenyans will continue to go abroad to find work.
sna: Zvichakadai, vakuru vakuru vanoti, pane vanhu vachidiki vanofungidzirwa kuti vangasvike mamiriyoni maviri  vari kupedza makosi muzvikoro zvepamusoro gore rega rega, zvichibva paqkuhwerengedzwa kwehuvandu hwevanhu vakadai munyika yese, asi kuine mabasa evanhu vangasvike zviuru mazana masere zvinoreva kuti vanhu vazhinji vemuKenya vacharamba vachienda kunze kwenyika kunotsvaga mabasa.
mt0: <pad> Also, officials say, there are approximately two million young people graduating from high school every year, according to the population of such people in the country, but only about eighteen thousand jobs are available, meaning that many Kenyans will continue to go abroad to look for jobs.</s>

en: South Africa Urges Africa's First COVID-19 Vaccine Plant to Keep Its Doors Open
sna: South Africa Inokurudzira Kuti Kambani Yekutanga Kugadzira Mishonga YeCovid Irambe Ichiita Basa
mt0: <pad> South Africa calls for the first Covid drug company to continue producing</s>

en: South African health officials are urging COVID-19 vaccine manufacturer Aspen to keep its plant in the Eastern Cape province open.
sna: Vakuru vezvehutano muSouth African vari kukurudzira Aspen. kambani inogadzira mishongainodzivirira COVID-19 kuti irambe yakavhura mushina wavo uri mudunhu reEastern Cape.
mt0: <pad> South African health authorities are urging Aspen. the company that produces the COVID-19 drug to keep its plant in the Eastern Cape open.</s>

en: This follows a Reuters article quoting Aspens senior director saying they may have to shut down as there have been no orders for their rebranded COVID vaccine.
sna: Izvi zvinotevera nhau dzakanyorwa nesangano renhau reReuters dzakatapa mukuru article quoting Aspens senior  to shut down as there have been no orders for their rebranded COVID vaccine.
mt0: <pad> This follows a Reuters article quoting Aspens senior to shut down as there have been no orders for their rebranded COVID vaccine.</s>

en: A South African-owned subsidiary of pharmaceutical giant Aspen struck a deal with American company Johnson & Johnson in March to package, price, sell and distribute its vaccine in Africa.
sna: Imwe kambani iri chikamu chehwitakwi yezvekugadzira mishonga yemuSouth Africa inonzi Aspen chakawirirana nekamabani yekuAmerica yeJohnson & Johnson muna Kurume kuti irongedze, kuisa mitengo, kutengesa nekukuona kuti mishonga yeJonson & Jonson inodzivirira chirwere cheCovid  yatekeshera nedunhu rese reAfrica.
mt0: <pad> South African pharmaceutical company Aspen has signed a deal with the American pharmaceutical company Johnson & Johnson in March to plan, price, sell and make sure that the Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 drugs are widely available in Africa.</s>

en: This vaccine was rebranded as Aspenovax.
sna: Musonga wekudzivirira Covid uyu wakazopiwazita idzva rekuti Aspenovax.
mt0: <pad> The Covid vaccine was renamed Aspenovax.</s>

en: The move was hailed by many as there had been much concern about Africas reliance on imported vaccines which were often costly and at times in short supply.
sna: Chiitiko ici chakarumbidzwa nevazhinji nekuti pakange paine kushushikana kukuru pamusoro pekuti Africa yaipona nemishonga inobva kune dzimwe nyika iyo yainge ichidhura uye ichinestsa kuwana.
mt0: <pad> The event was controversial because there was great concern about the dependence of Africa on drugs from other countries which were expensive and difficult to get.</s>

en: But there have been no orders for Aspenovax. South Africas National Health Department Spokesperson Foster Mohale said the lack of orders is due to low vaccination rates not only at home, but globally.
sna: Asi mishonga yeAspenovax iyi yange isina ari kutenga. VaFoster Mohale, mutauriri wechikamu chinoona nezvehutano muSouth Africa vakati kusatengwa kwemishonga uku kwaikonzereswa nekuti kune vanhu vashoma chose varikubaiwa majekiseniekudzivirira Covid kwete muAfrica chete, asi pasi rose.
mt0: <pad> But the Aspenovac drugs were out of demand. Foster Mohale, a spokesman for the South African Department of Health said this was due to the low number of people being vaccinated against Covid not only in Africa but around the world.</s>

en: Vaccine hesitancy is one of the factors which contribute to these low vaccination rates or demand for more vaccines which also affect the production.
sna: Vakatiwo kuzengurira kubaiwa ndicho chimwe chezvikonzero zviri kuita kuti pane nekuderera kwevanobaiwa majekiseni ekudzivirira kana kuwanda kwekutengwa kwemishonga iyi zviri kukanganisa basa rekugadzira iyi.
mt0: <pad> They also said that delays in vaccinations are one of the reasons for the decline in the number of people being vaccinated or the high demand for this drug is affecting the production of the drug.</s>

en: Because obviously we understand that they are in a business, they cant keep on producing vaccines when they know that the demand for vaccines is very low.
sna: Nekuti tinonzwisisawo kuti vanhu ava vari mubhindauko rekuitawo mari, naizvozvo havagone kungoramba vachigadzira mishonga iyi  asi vachiziva kuti vanoda kuishandisa vashoma.
mt0: <pad> Because we understand that these people are in business, so they can't just keep producing these drugs while knowing that the demand for them is low.</s>

en: So, we understand the situation where they are, and we sympathize with them, he said.
sna: Naizvozvo, tinonzwisisa kuti pavari pakaoma uye tonovanzwira tsitsi.
mt0: <pad> So, we understand that they are struggling and we feel compassion for them.</s>

en: Mohale said for now, South Africa has enough vaccines.
sna: VaMohale vakati pari zvino, South Africa ine mishonga inokwana.
mt0: <pad> Mr Mohale said that at present, South Africa has enough medicine to treat the disease.</s>

en: He adds that in March, 100,000 vaccines expired. And more are due to expire in June and July.
sna: Vanotiwo muna Kurume mishonga yekudzivirira inosvika mazana ezviuru zvemishonga  yakasvikirwa nezuva rekusashandisika isati yashanda. Uye mimwe mishonga mizhinji ichasvika pakusashanda muna Chivabvu naChikunguru.
mt0: <pad> They also said that in March about 100 thousand anti-viral drugs were reaching the expiration date before they were used. And many more will be reaching the expiration date in May and June.</s>

en: However, he said that Aspens vaccine plant is important because no one knows what the future holds.
sna: Zvisineyi, vakati mushina wekugadzira mushonga weAspens wakakosha nokuti hapana anoziva kuti ramangwana rineyi.
mt0: <pad> However, they said that the Aspen drug plant was important because no one knows what the future will bring.</s>

en: We will try to engage them not to rush their decision precisely because we anticipate especially our scientists, our epidemiologists, we anticipate that the fifth wave might hit the country, South Africa, during the winter season which is a few weeks away from now.
sna: Vakati, 'Tichaedza kutaura navo kuti vasamhanye pahurongwa hwavo nekuti tiri kutarisira zvikuru sei nyanzvi dzedu dzesainzi, nyanzvi dzedu dzinoona nezvekudzivirira kupararira kwemadenda, tinotarisira kuti kusimuka kwedenda kwechishanu kucharova nyika yeSouth Africa mumwaka wechando uyo wasarirwa nemasvondo mashomanana kuti usvike."
mt0: <pad> They said, "We will try to talk to them to make sure they don't interfere with their plan because we are very much dependent on our science, our scientists on earthquake prevention, and we expect the fifth eruption of the earthquake to hit South Africa in the winter that is only a few weeks away."</s>

en: As you can see the number of daily COVID-19 patients has been rising for the past seven days, he said.
sna: Vakatiwo, "Sezvamunoonawo, huwandu hwevanhu varikurwara neCovid-19 hwanga huchikwira pamazuva manomwe achangopfuura."
mt0: <pad> They also said, "As you can see, the number of people infected with Covid-19 has been at its highest level for the last seven days."</s>

en: Professor Petro Terblanche, who is the managing director of South African company, Afrigen, which in a continent-first made an mRNA COVID vaccine using Modernas data said the situation at Aspen is a tragedy for the industry.
sna: Muzvinafundo Petro Terblanche, avo vanova mukuu wekambani yekuSouth African, inonzi Afrigen, inova yakava yekutanga munhu ese reAfica kugadzira mushonga wekudzivirira Covid uchiita zvekubayiwa sejekiseni, vachisndisa zivo yekambani inonzi, Modena vakati mamiriro akaita zvinhu paAspen injodzi huru muchikamu chezvekugadzirwa kwemishonga.
mt0: <pad> Dr. Petro Terblanche, former CEO of South African company Afrigen, which was the first privately-owned African company to produce a Covid-19 vaccine as a shot, using knowledge from Modena, said the situation at Aspen is a major risk to the industry of drug production.</s>

en: This is just indicating again how important it is that this continent looks at policy reform.
sna: Muzvinafundo Terrablanche vakati, Izvi zvinonongoratidza  zvakare kuti zvakakosha sei kuti dunhu rino reAfrica rifungisise pamusoro pekushandura zvisungo nenzira dzekushanda nadzo.
mt0: <pad> Dr. Terrablanche said, "This underlines the importance of this African region to rethink its commitments and work practices."</s>

en: This is about how are we going to make sure that we give preferential procurement to local companies.
sna: Iyi inyaya yekuona kuti tichaita se kuti tapa mikana yekutenga kumakambani emudunhu remuno.
mt0: <pad> This is about making sure we create opportunities for local companies to buy.</s>

en: How are we going to make sure that we create a marketplace and eco-system that will absorb local capacity?
sna: Tichaita sei kuti tivake musika wekutenga nekutengesera nemamiriro ezvinhu achasahndisa goneso yattinayo munharaunda dzemudunhu redu?
mt0: <pad> How can we build a market that will enhance the competitiveness of our local economies?</s>

en: Otherwise, we will not have capacity locally in a sustainable manner and were going to get the next pandemic and we will be unprepared, and we will not have health security, said Terblanche.
sna: Tikasadaro, tinozoshaiwa goneso nesimba zvinobva munharaunda dzatigere mudunhu munhu nenzira yekuti tinogona kuramba tichizviitira zvinhu zvedu, zvekuti rimwe deda parinoozouya timenge tisina kurigadzirira. , saka tinenge tisina kuchengetedzeka panezvehutano.
mt0: <pad> If not, we will be deprived of the nutrients and energy from the environment in which we live in such a way that we can continue to do our own thing, so that when a disease comes we will be unprepared., so we will be unsafe on health grounds.</s>

en: She believes money should also be put into educating people on the importance of vaccines.
sna: Vanofunga kuti mari inofanirwa kushandiswa mukudzidzisa vanhu pamusoro pekukosha kwemishonga yekudzivirira matenda.
mt0: <pad> They think the money should be used to educate people about the importance of vaccines.</s>

en: We need to ensure that we also put effort into advocacy for vaccination.
sna: Tinofanirwa kuona kuti tawedzera kushanda pakukurudzira kubayiwa majikeseniekudzivirira matenda.
mt0: <pad> We need to see that we have increased our efforts to promote the vaccination of children against disease.</s>

en: Because we now have 17% of the continent that is vaccinated.
sna: Iyezvino tava nezvikamu gumi nezvinomwe zwedunhu redu reAfrica rakabayiwa majekiseni aya.
mt0: <pad> Now we have 17 percent of our African continent vaccinated with this vaccine.</s>

en: We need to get them to at least 40% to ensure that we fully arrest this pandemic, she said.
sna: Tinofanirwa kuti tisvitse huwandu wevanobayiwa kuti vasvike pamakumimana kubva muzana kuti tinyatsosunge denda iri mbiradzakondo risarambe richipararira.
mt0: <pad> We need to raise the number of vaccinated to at least 80% to better control this disease as a mosquito-borne outbreak.</s>

en: Mohale was unable to say when the Health Department would be meeting with Aspens executives.
sna: VaMohale havana kutaura kuti bazi rezvehutano richange richisangana rinhi vekuru veAspens.
mt0: <pad> Mr Mohale said the ministry of health will meet with the chiefs of the Aspens.</s>

en: Journalists in Ethiopia Say Press Freedom is at 'Crossroads'
sna: Vatapi Venhau MuEthiopia Vanoti Rusununguko Rwezvekutapwa Kwenhau Ruri 'Pamharadzano'
mt0: <pad> Ethiopian journalists say the freedom of press is "in danger"</s>

en: When Ethiopia's Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based group that promotes press freedom, raised Ethiopia's ranking in its international press freedom index by 40 places.
sna: Apo Mutungamiriri weEthiopia, vaAbiy Ahmed vakapinda muhofisi makore mana apfuura, Reporters Without Borders, sangano rekuParis rinorwira nekukurudzira kusununguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau rakasimudzira chinzvimbo cheEthiopia nezvinhanho makumi mana pachikero chinoyera kusununguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau pakati penyika dzepasi rose.
mt0: <pad> When the new President of Ethiopia, Abiy Ahmed took office four years ago, Reporters Without Borders, a Paris-based organization that fights for and promotes press freedom, raised the position of Ethiopia by 40 steps on its global press freedom scale.</s>

en: It was a giant leap forward after decades of media repression by the state.
sna: Uku kwaiva kusvetukira kumberi kukuru mushure memakore mazhinji ekudzvinyiriewa kwezvekutorwa kwenhau nehurumende.
mt0: <pad> This was a major step forward after many years of government-imposed censure of the press.</s>

en: But since the war between federal government forces and rebels in the Tigray region began in late 2020, Ethiopia has dropped in the rankings.
sna: Asi kubva pakatanga hondo pakati pemauto ehurumende yezvedunhu reTigray nevapanduki mukupera kwa2020, Ethiopia yakawira pasi zviyero zvekusunguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau.
mt0: <pad> But since the war started between the government forces of the Tigray region and rebels in late 2020, Ethiopia has seen its levels of press freedom fall.</s>

en: To mark World Press Freedom Day 2022, VOA spoke to Ethiopian journalists about how free they feel to carry out their work.
sna: Pakucherechedza Zuva Rekusununguka Kwezvekutapwa Kwenhau Pasi Rose muna2022, VOA yakataura nevatapi venhau vemuEthiopian pamusoro pekuti vanonzwa kuti vakasununguka kusvikira papi pamusoro pekuita basa ravo.
mt0: <pad> While celebrating World Press Freedom Day in 2022, VOA talked to Ethiopian journalists about how free they feel to do their job.</s>

en: Elias Meseret, who worked with the Associated Press, told VOA that press freedom in Ethiopia is at a crossroads.
sna: Elias Meseret, uyo akamboshanda neAssociated Press, akaudza VOA kuti rusunguko rwezvekutapwa kwenhau muEthiopia ruri pamharadzano.
mt0: <pad> Elias Meseret, a former Associated Press reporter, told VOA that the press freedom in Ethiopia is at risk.</s>

en: Overall, I can say that lack of professionalism and also extreme views have become the hallmarks of the state of the media in Ethiopia, at this point in time, Elias said.
sna: Elias akati, Pamusoro pezvose. ndingati kushaikwa kwenzira dzekuita basa nemazvo uye nemaonero anokakatira kurutivi ndodzava mbiru nezviratidzo zvemamiriro ezvekutapwa kwenhau muEthiopia, panguva ino yatiri.
mt0: <pad> Elias said, "Above all, I can say that the lack of effective procedures and a biased approach have become the primary causes and symptoms of the state of media abuse in Ethiopia, at this particular time."</s>

en: "For this to change, I think the government has a responsibility to let media professionals do their job freely.
sna: "Kuti izvi zvishanduke panguva ino, ndinofunga kuti hurumende inebasa rekutendera vatapi venhau kuti vaite basa ravo vakasununguka.
mt0: <pad> "To change this at this time, I think the government has a duty to allow journalists to do their work freely.</s>

en: This means without any harassment and intimidation."
sna: Izvi zvinoreva kuti panenge pasina kumbunyikidzwa nekutyisidzirwa."
mt0: <pad> This means that there is no harassment and intimidation.</s>

en: Assegid Mulugeta, a radio presenter for the government-owned broadcaster, the Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, or EBC, thinks press freedom has improved in recent years.
sna: Assegid Mulugeta, mushamarari wenhepfenyuro yehurumende yeEthiopian Broadcasting Corporation, kana kuti  EBC, anofunga kuti rusunguko rezvekutapwa kwenhau kwasimukira mumakore mashoma achangopfuura.
mt0: <pad> Assegid Mulugeta, chief of the state radio station of Ethiopian Broadcasting Corporation, or EBC, thinks that the freedom of press has improved in recent years.</s>

en: In 2018, the prime minister released all journalists from prison, However, that progress has since been reversed according to Ethiopian journalists, who documented that 46 journalists were detained in the country in 2021, making Ethiopia one of the worst jailers of journalists in Africa.
sna: Muna 2018, mukuru wenyika akasunungura vatapi venhau vese vainge vari mujeri, Kunyangwe zvakadaro, budiriro iyi irikudududzwa, mumaonero evatapi venhau vemuEthiopian journalists, vakaratidza kuti vatapi venhau makumi mana nevatanhatu vakasungwa munyika muna 2021, izvo zvakaita kuti Ethiopia imwe yenyika dzinosunga vatapi venhau zvakanyanyisa muAfrica yose.
mt0: <pad> In 2018, the president released all journalists in jail, However, this success is under scrutiny, according to the Ethiopian Journalists' Union, which showed that 46 journalists were detained in the country in 2021, making Ethiopia one of the most persecuting journalists in Africa.</s>

en: The state-backed Ethiopian Human Rights Commission released a statement Tuesday expressing concern for journalist Gobeze Sisay, whose whereabouts are unknown since plainclothes officers arrested him on Sunday.
sna: Sangano remuEthiopia rinotsigirwa nehurumende rinoona nezvekodzero dzevanhu reEthiopian Human Rights Commission rakaburitsa chinyorwa neChipiri richiratidza kushushikna kwaro pamusoro pemutapi wenhau Gobeze Sisay, uyo asingazivikanwe kuti aripi kubvira mapurisa anoshanda asina nhumbi dzebasa rechipurisa vakamutora nemusi weSvondo.
mt0: <pad> The Ethiopian government-backed Human Rights Commission on Tuesday expressed its concern over the disappearance of journalist Gobeze Sisay, who is missing since police officers without uniforms arrested him on Sunday.</s>

en: Another journalist, Amir Aman Kiyaro, and his colleague Thomas Engida were arrested in November and released in March.
sna: Mumwezve mutapi wenhau, Amir Aman Kiyaro, nemumwe waanoshanda naye Thomas Engida vakasungwa muna Mbudzi vakazosunungurwa munaKurume.
mt0: <pad> Another journalist, Amir Aman Kiyaro, and his co-worker Thomas Engida were arrested in November and released in March.</s>

en: But they still may face years in prison if convicted of violating the country's wartime state of emergency law and anti-terrorism law.
sna: Asi vanogona kugara mujeri kwemakore kana vakawanikwa vaine mhosva yekutyora mutemo wakaiswapanguva yehondo wairambidzakufamba famba panguva dzakatarwa, uyenekutyora mutemo wekurwisa vanomukira hurumende vachishandisa nzira dzekutyisidzira, kuuraya nekupamba.
mt0: <pad> But they can be imprisoned for years if convicted of violating a wartime law that prohibits movement at specific times, and violating the law on combating government opponents by threatening, killing and robbery.</s>

en: Still, radio presenter Assegid said he sees improvement.
sna: Kunyangwe zvakadaro, mushamarari wepanhepfenyuro, Assegid akati anoona anoona budiriro nekuenderera mberi.
mt0: <pad> However, the radio commentator, Assegid said he saw progress and growth.</s>

en: Under the pre-2018 government where the Tigray People's Liberation Front political party dominated, he said, there were "lots of stifling systems, there was lots of censorship, there was beating of journalists, there was lots of pressures and censorship against journalists and now we are seeing the booming of YouTube and online media this is a good thing to hear."
sna: Akati pasi pehurumende yakange iripo gore ra2018 risati rasvika bato re Tigray People's Liberation Front political ndiro raitonga "paive nkudzvinyirira kwakawanda, nekurambidzwa kutaura zvaunofunga, kurohwa kwevatapi venhau, paive nekumanikidzirwa nekurambidzwa kwevatapi venhau kunyora nekutaura zvavanofunga, uye yezvino  tavakuona kusimukira kweYouTube nedzimwe mzira dzekufambisamashoko pamadandemutande anoshadisa mapotonjere nenharembozva, zvinova zvinhu zvinodakdza kunzwa."
mt0: <pad> He said under the previous government of the Tigray People's Liberation Front "there was a lot of repression, and censorship, and violence against journalists, and now we have seen the rise of YouTube and other social media platforms that are taking over mobile and tablet devices, stealing things that are disturbing to hear."</s>

en: Sisay Sahlu, editor at The Reporter, a private newspaper based in Addis Ababa, said independent media often get stonewalled by the government.
sna: Sisay Sahlu, mupepeti we The Reporter, bepanhau rakazvimiririra  remuAddis Ababa, wakati vezvenhau vakazvimiririra vanowanzokandirwa zvimhingamupinyi munzira yavo nehurumende.
mt0: <pad> Sisay Sahlu, editor of The Reporter, a private Addis Ababa newspaper, said independent journalists are often put up with obstacles by governments.</s>

en: My experience and the experience of my friends from public media is totally different, he said.
sna: Zvandakasangana nazvo nezvakasanganikwa neshamwari dzangu dzinoshandira masangano enhau ehurumende zvakasiyana zvachose, akadaro.
mt0: <pad> What I've experienced and what my friends who work for government news agencies have experienced are completely different, he said.</s>

en: "As a private newspaper employee, it's tough to get information for me."
sna: "Semushandi webepanhau rakazvimiririra zvakagozha zvachose kuti ndiziviswe kuti chii chiri kuitika kuti ndiwane chekunyora."
mt0: <pad> "As a freelance journalist it is very important to be informed of what's going on to get a job."</s>

en: Sisay said that for a simple story, he might call 10 officials, who all may be unwilling to answer his questions.
sna: Sisay akati kuti anyore nyaya dikiki anogona kufonera vakuru muhurumende vanosvika gumi, asi vose vasingade kupindura mbvunzo yake.
mt0: <pad> Sisay said that he could call up to 10 government officials, but no one would answer his question.</s>

en: When you call them, they don't give us any clue, he said.
sna: Akati, Tikavafonera, havatipe kana kahwema zvako kekuti vanoda kuti chii.
mt0: <pad> He said, When we called them, they didn't give us any idea what they mean.</s>

en: "We write a letter to them, they are not talking.
sna: "Tinovanyorera tsamba, asi havana chavanotaura.
mt0: <pad> "We're writing letters, but they have something to say."</s>

en: Finally, when we publish [the story], they are coming to our office.
sna: Pakupedzesera, patinozonyora nyaya mubepanhau redu, ndipo pavanozouya kumahofisi edu vakatsvukisa maziso nehasha.
mt0: <pad> Finally, we published the story in our paper, and when they came back to our offices they looked at us with anger.</s>

en: Sometimes they are on the phone and start a verbal fight.
sna: Dzimwe nguva vanofona votanga kutipopotera.
mt0: <pad> They sometimes call and complain about us.</s>

en: Either they are giving us information or not."
sna: Zvisineyi kuti vazouya kumahofisi edu here kana kuti vanotifonera, mhedzisiro yacho ndeyekuti vanozongopedzesera vatipa zvatiri kuda kana kuti vanoramba."
mt0: <pad> Regardless of whether they come to our offices or call us, the end result is that they will either give us what we want or they will refuse.</s>

en: A government spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
sna: Mutauriri wehurumende akashaikwa kuti ataurewo maonero ake.
mt0: <pad> The government spokesman was not able to comment.</s>

en: In the latest World Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia is ranked 114th, down 13 places from its ranking in 2021.
sna: Pachikero chinoona kuti nyika dzinochengetedza kusununguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau kusvika papi rweWorld Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia iri pachinhanho chezana negumi nena, mushure mekudonha nezvinhanho gumi nezvitatu kubva payakange iri muna2021.
mt0: <pad> On the World Press Freedom Index, Ethiopia is on the fourteenth place, after falling 13 points from the previous year.</s>

en: Editor's note: The story has been updated with additional information about the arrests of journalists.
sna: Shoko rinokosha kubva kumupepeti: Nyaya iyi yakazovandudzwa mushure mekuwedzerwa kwenhau yekusungwa kwevatapi venhau.
mt0: <pad> Important note from the editor: This article was revised after the addition of the news of the arrest of journalists.</s>

en: As Tigray Aid Blockade Continues, Nearby Areas Also in Desperate Need of Food, Medicine
sna: Kudziviswa Kwerubatsiro Rwunoenda KuTigray Kunoenderera Mberi, Nzvimbo Dziri Pedyo Dzapererwa neChikafu, Mishonga
mt0: <pad> The announcement of aid to Tigray continues, the nearest areas have run out of coffee, food and water.</s>

en: Despite Ethiopias declared humanitarian cease-fire with Tigrayan rebels, aid groups said they are struggling to get food and medicine to those in need.
sna: Zvisineyi kuti Ethiopia yakanyoerana chibvumirano nevapanduki vemuTigray chekusarwisa masangano anobatsira vanhu vari munjodzi, zvikwata zvinobatsira vanhu vari munjodzi izvi zvinoti zviri kutambura kuti zvisvitse zvekudya nemishonga kune vanozvidisisa.
mt0: <pad> Although Ethiopia has signed a deal with the Tigray rebels to ban aid organizations, aid agencies say they are struggling to get food and medicine to the victims.</s>

en: Even outside the worst affected areas in Tigray, which are off limits to reporters, providing aid is fraught with risks and challenges.
sna: Kunyangwe kunze kwenzvimbo dzakanyanya kubatikana nedambudziko iri, uko kusingabvumirwe vatapi venhau kusvika, kupa rubatsiro kuzere nenjodzi nezvimhingamupinyi.
mt0: <pad> Even outside the most affected areas, where journalists are not permitted, providing full support to victims and their families, offering full assistance to survivors and their families.</s>

en: In Ethiopias northern Amhara region, burned tanks and other ruined military equipment lie at the roadside four months after occupying forces of the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, or TPLF, left the area.
sna: Kudunhu rekumaodzanyemba kweEthiopia reAmhara, motokari dzakatsva dzinotakura mabhambu nemimwe midziyo yehondo yakaparadzwa zvinenge zviri ungwandangwanda pedyo nemugwagwa mwedzi mitatu mushure mekunge mauto anotonga nzvimbo iyi veTigray Peoples Liberation Front, kana kuti TPLF, vabva munzvimbo iyi.
mt0: <pad> In the northeastern Ethiopian region of Amhara, newly-loaded trucks with bombs and other war equipment are piled up near the road three months after the Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, or TPLF, left the region.</s>

en: As the region recovers from a brutal civil war, the U.N. said some 9.4 million people in the Amhara region and neighboring Afar and Tigray regions need humanitarian assistance.

mt0: <pad> The region is still recovering from the war. The UN says that about 9 million people in the Amhara Region and the surrounding areas of Afar and Tigray need help.</s>

en: But aid has been slow to arrive.
sna: Asi rubatsiro urwu rwuri kunonoka kusvika.
mt0: <pad> But this help is taking a long time to come.</s>

sna: Mukomana ane makore ekuzvarwa gumi nemanomwe, Ahmed Nuru aigaramudunhu reOromia region, asi akati akazotiza mushure atanga kushumgurudzwa nekuda kwekuti anobva kuAmhara.
mt0: <pad> Ahmed Nuru, a 17-year-old boy, used to live in the Oromia region, but said he fled after being accused of Amhara because of his origins.</s>

en: He lost his mother when he was young.
sna: Akashaikirwa naamai vake achiri mudiki.
mt0: <pad> He was abandoned by his mother when he was a child.</s>

en: Last year, his father died after being unable to get lifesaving treatment due to the wars impact on the local health care system.
