mt0: <pad> Last year his father died after being unable to get treatment that could save him because of the war-devastated health system in the area.</s>

en: Now, Nuru is left to take care of his sisters, ages 10 and 8.

en: He said life is very difficult and doesnt know how he will be able to raise his sisters.
sna: Akati hupenyu hwakamuomera uye haazive kuti achariritira nekukurera hanzvadzi dzake sei.

mt0: <pad> Daniel Tigabu, a public health worker at the refugee camp where Ahmed is staying, said there were no enough equipment to treat the patients or medicines.</s>

en: The center is running out of basic medical kits, as well as a shortage of kits for malaria, hepatitis and HIV testing.
sna: Nzvimbo iyiyava kupererwa nemidziyo inodiwa pese panorapwa varwere, uye kushaikwa kwezvinodiwa kuongorora ropa pazvirwere zvinoti malaria malaria, chirwere chechiropa che hepatitis necheshuramatongo kana kuti HIV.
mt0: <pad> The site was lacking in necessary equipment for the treatment of patients, and lacked the necessary equipment to test blood for malaria, hepatitis and cholera or HIV.</s>

en: Tens of thousands live in camps for the displaced in the Amhara region.

en: Others live in host communities, like Tsgenet Tibebu, who lost her husband during the conflict with the TPLF.
sna: Vamwewo ndivo vanogara mumisha yakavagamuchira kuti vagare havo, sa Tsgenet Tibebu, uyo akashaikirwa nemurume wake pakurwisana kwakaitika nevarwi veTPLF.
mt0: <pad> Others are still living in the villages where they were accepted, such as Tsgenet Tibebu, who lost her husband in the TPLF-led fighting.</s>

en: Tibebu said she and her son rely on what her husbands friends provide as charity, which includes a room to stay in.
sna: Tibebu akati iye nemwanakomana wake oga vanopona nezvaanopihwa neshamwari dzemurume wake nekuda kwemwoyochena yavo, zvinosanganisira mupanda mumwe chete wavanoshandisa.
mt0: <pad> Tibebu said she and her only son survive on what her husband's friends give her for her cleanliness, including a single bed that they share.</s>

en: As tears begin to flow, she said she is a housewife who has nothing and is waiting for support to help her raise her two children.
sna: Misodzi yake ichiyerera, anoti anongova mudzimayi wepamusha asinawo chaayinacho uye anotomirirawo chero rubetsero rwaanopihwa kuti agone kuchengeta mwana wake mumwe chete.

en: She believes she should pay rent even though the owners have given her a place to stay.

en: She wonders how she can plan for the future when she has nothing.

en: Mulugeta Kebede, an aid worker who works in the Hayk camp, spoke to VOA and said stories like Nurus and Tibebus are not uncommon across Amhara.
sna: Mulugeta Kebede, mushandi anobatsira vanhu vakaomerwa pakamba yepaHayk, akataura neVOA akati nyaya dzinosiririsadzedza Nuru and Tibebu hadzichashamise kudzinzwa kwese kwese muAmhara.
mt0: <pad> The killings of Nuru and Tibebu will not affect the freedom of expression in Amhara, said Mulugeta Kebede, a worker at Hayk's refugee camp, who spoke with the Voice of America.</s>

en: He said the situation makes aid workers cry day and night.
sna: Vakati mamiriro ezvinhu aya anoitakuti vashandi vanobatsira vanhu varipakushushikana vacheme siku nesikati.

en: He said if someone is hungry, they cant sleep because they think about their empty stomach.

en: He said he has seen displaced people sell pans or mattresses to surved and added that the situation is at a critical stage.

mt0: <pad> He said he saw people who were driven out of their homes by the war selling their pots or their pigs to survive, and that the situation is now so bad that it's dangerous.</s>

en: About 30,000 people displaced by conflict live just north of Hayk, in Weldiya.

sna: Mumiririri wezvebazi rekutongwa kwematunhu, Habtemariam Assefa, arizve mutauriri weNorth Wollo Zone, akati pakange paine rubetsero rushomasa mushure mekunge kubva munzvimbo iyi kweTPLF, mushure mekunge dunhu iri rakange riri dariro yekurwisama kwemwedzi mizhinji.
mt0: <pad> The minister of state administration, Habtemariam Assefa, also spokesman for the North Wollo Zone, said there was a large protest after the TPLF left the region, after the region had been the scene of violent clashes for several months.</s>

en: But, he said, aid has been distributed only twice since and the aid provided by the U.N. or the federal government is not enough.

mt0: <pad> He said, but only two aid packages have been made since then and no UN or local government aid has been received.</s>

en: North of the Amhara region, in Tigray where journalists are banned from entering, the U.N. said the situation is worse, with famine-like conditions.

mt0: <pad> In the north of Amhara province, in Tigray where journalists are barred from entering, the UN said the situation was extremely bad, showing that there was a severe famine.</s>

en: Tigray is under a de facto humanitarian blockade, according to the U.N.
sna: UN inoti Tigray iri pasi pemutemo unorambidza kupinda werubatsiro.

en: For now, all Ahmed Nuru and his sisters can do is try to scrape by and hope more assistance arrives soon.

mt0: <pad> But for now, the only thing that Ahmed Nuru and his sisters can do is survive the reports of the injuries in hopes that some help will be able to reach them soon.</s>

en: State Group Investigates Video Allegedly Showing Abuse by Ethiopian Army
sna: Chikwata Chehurumende Choongorora Mifananidzo Yepamadzangaradzimu Inoratidza Kushungurudzwa Kunoitwa Nemauto EmuEthiopia
mt0: <pad> The government's investigation of the videos showing the torture by the Ethiopian military</s>

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission is investigating a video shared online that appears to show government troops abusing and shooting an ethnic Tigrayan boy.
sna: Sangano remuEthipiarinoongorora kodzero dzevanhu re The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission ririkuongorora mifananidzoyepamadzangaradzimu iri kutenderera pamadandemutande epamapotonjere inoita seinoratidza masoja ehurumende achishungurudza nekupfura kakomana kerudzi rekudunhu rekuTigray.
mt0: <pad> The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission is investigating videos circulating on social media that seem to show government soldiers abusing and shooting a young Tigray ethnic group.</s>

en: The four-minute video shows an alleged ethnic Tigray teenager being surrounded by men in Ethiopian army uniforms.
sna: Mifananidzo iyi yakareba maminetsi mana inoratidza mukomana asati asvika makore gumi nemasere akakombwa nevarume vakapfeka mbatya dzinoshandiswa nemasoja emu Ethiopia.
mt0: <pad> The four-minute video shows a boy aged eighteen being held by men dressed as Ethiopian soldiers.</s>

en: The forces are seen abusing the boy, who they refer to as being from Abbi Adi, a location in the northern Tigray region of Ethiopia.
sna: Mauto aya anoonekwa achishungurudza mukomana uyu, wavanoti anobva kuAbbi Adi, musha uri mudunhu riri kumaodzanyemba kweEthiopia reTigray.
mt0: <pad> The soldiers are seen beating the boy, who is said to be from Abba Adi, a village in the north-eastern Ethiopian region of Tigray.</s>

en: In response to a query from VOA, the state-run Human Rights Commission said it was "gathering information regarding the incident."
sna: Richipindura mibvunzo yakabva kuVOA, boka rinotsigirwa nehurumende iri reHuman Rights Commission rakati richiri "kunganidza humbowo pamusoro pechiitiko ichi."
mt0: <pad> In a statement to the Voice of America, the Human Rights Commission said it was still "gathering evidence about this incident."</s>

en: In the video, the boy, with blood on his face, is seen sitting while the men in uniform surround him and threaten him with death.
sna: Mumufananidzo uyu, mukomana uyu, achijuja ropa kumeso kwake, anoonekwa agere pasi varume vane nhumbi dzechiuto vakamukomberedza uye vachimutyisidzira nerufu.
mt0: <pad> In this picture, the boy, with blood on his face, is seen lying down in the ground surrounded by men in military uniforms and threatening him with death.</s>

en: One of the men in uniforms calls for the boy to suffer rather than being killed immediately.
sna: Mumwe wevarume ava ariwo muhembe dzechisoja anoti mukomana uyu ngamboshungurudzwe pane kuti akurumidze kuurayiwa.
mt0: <pad> One of the men in military uniforms said the boy was being molested rather than murdered.</s>

en: They tell a teenage girl to forcefully feed the boy.
sna: Vanozoudza musikana anezera rimwe chete nemukomana uyu kuti amumanikidze kudya.
mt0: <pad> They will tell a girl who is the same age as the boy to force him to eat.</s>

en: Finally, one man steps forward and shoots the boy, and the video ends.
sna: Pakupedzesera, mumwe murume anoswedera mberi kune mukomana uyu obva amupfura, mufananidzo uyu wobva wapera.
mt0: <pad> At last, another man approaches the boy and kisses him, and the film ends.</s>

en: VOA cannot independently verify the location of the incident or the identities of the individuals in the footage.
