mt0: <pad> VOA has not been able to obtain proof of the incident or who the people in the pictures are.</s>

en: Asked about the video, both the Ethiopian government communication minister and Ethiopian ministry of defense spokesperson declined to comment.
sna: Vabvunzwa pamusoro pemufananidzo uyu gurukota rezvekufambiswa kwemashoko nemutauriri webazi rezvekudzivirirwa kwenyika vose vakaramba kutaura pamusoro penyaya iyi.
mt0: <pad> When asked about the photo, the minister of information and the spokesman for the ministry of defence both refused to comment on the matter.</s>

en: A similar incident was reported by rights groups in January 2021 in which Ethiopian army members were seen executing a number of civilians in Mahibere Dego, in central Tigray.
sna: Chiitiko chakafanana nechichi chakamhan'arwa nemapoka ekodzero dzevanhu muna Ndira mugore ra2021 umo nhengo dzemamuto emuEthiopia akaonekwa achiuraya vanhuwo zvavo vakati kuti kuMahibere Dego, iri pakati nepakati peTigray.
mt0: <pad> A similar incident was reported by human rights groups in January 2021 when members of the Ethiopian army were seen killing a number of civilians in Mahibere Dego, in the central Tigray region.</s>

en: Rights group Amnesty International has verified the killing of 11 civilians in that incident.
sna: Chikwata chorwira kodzero dzevanhu cheAmnesty International chakagona kunyatsoziva kuti pakaurayiwa vanhu gumi nemumwe pachiitiko ichochi.
mt0: <pad> Amnesty International has been able to confirm that 11 people were killed in the incident.</s>

en: Forces from the rebel Tigray People's Liberation Front also have been accused of committing human rights violations.
sna: Masoja evapanduki veTigray People's Liberation Front vakapomerwawo mhosva dzekutyora kodzero dzevanhu.
mt0: <pad> The armed forces of the Tigray People's Liberation Front were also accused of human rights violations.</s>

en: In February 2022, Amnesty International reported that TPLF forces and their affiliates have killed more than a dozen people and gang raped women in towns of the Amhara region they occupied.
sna: Muna Kukadzi 2022, Amnesty International yakaburitsa mashoko ekuti varwi veTPLF nezvikwata zvinovatsigira vakauraya vanhu vanodarika gumi nevaviri uye chikwata chaibata vakadzi zvibharo mumaguta emudunhu reAmhara iro ravakange vatora.
mt0: <pad> In February 2022, Amnesty International reported that the TPLF and its allies killed over 13 people and raped women in the towns of the Amhara region they had captured.</s>

en: The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission recently reported that more than 740 civilians were killed in the Tigray war between July 2021 and March 2022.
sna: Boka rekodzero dzevanhu remuEthiopia re The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission munguva ichangopfuura rakaburitsa mashoko ekuti vanhuwo zvavo vanodarika mazana manomwe nemakumi mana vakaurayiwa muhondo yemudunhu reTigray pakati paChivabvu 2021 naKurume 2022.
mt0: <pad> The Ethiopian Human Rights Commission recently reported that over 700 civilians were killed in the Tigray region of Ethiopia between May 2021 and March 2022.</s>

en: Both the government and the TPLF deny accusations of rights violations, saying their operations do not target civilians.
sna: Vose masoja ehurumende neveTPLF vanoramba mhosva dzavanopomerwa kutyora kodzero dzevanhu, vachiti mabasa avoo haabate nekukuvadza vanhuwo zvavo.
mt0: <pad> Both the government and TPLF troops deny human rights abuses, claiming that their operations have not affected or harmed civilians.</s>

en: Disinformation, Censorship, Trigger Global Retreat of Press Freedom
sna: Nhau Dzenhema, Kurambidzwa Kwekufambiswa Kwenhau Zvokonzeresa Kuderera Kwerusununguko Rwekutapwa Kwenhau Pasi Rose
mt0: <pad> Fake news, mediacensorship has led to the erosion of press freedom under the guise of a political crisis.</s>

en: Led by the Kremlin's example, a global rise in disinformation and propaganda is having a disastrous effect on independent news around the world, a new report finds.
sna: Zvichitungamirirwa nemucherechedzo weKremlin, kusimuka pasi rose kwenhau dzenhema nedzidziso dzezvematongerwo dzizere nemanyepo zviri kukanganisa zvikuru nhau dzakazvimiririra dzega dzisina rutivi rwadzakarerekera pasi rose, sekuonekwa kwazvakaitwa neongororo itsva yezvenhau ichangoburwa.
mt0: <pad> According to the Kremlin's observation, the rise of global fake news and full-fledged political theories is significantly affecting independent, unbiased news outlets around the world, as recently published new media research has found.</s>

en: In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index released Tuesday, the Paris-based Reporters Without Borders (RSF) said Russia's invasion of Ukraine has contributed vastly to the spread of fake news and propaganda.
sna: Muchikero cha2022 chekuongorora kusununguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau munyika dzose dzepasi cheWorld Press Freedom Index chakaburitswa nemusi weChishanu boka reReporters Without Border iro rine muzinda waro muParis, rakati kupinda kweRussia  neganyavhu muUkraine kwakakonzeresa zvikuru kutekeshereswa kwenhau dzenhema nedzidziso dzezvematongerwo dzine manyepo.
mt0: <pad> In its 2022 World Press Freedom Index report, Reporters Without Borders, based in Paris, said the Russian intervention in Ukraine had led to the widespread dissemination of fake news and false political propaganda.</s>

en: The journalism watchdog group said its findings are worrying, as they show deep divisions among media within countries and between countries at the international level.
sna: Chikwata ichi chinorwira kodzero dzekutapwa kwenhau chakati zvachaona patsvakurudzo dzayo zvinoshungurudza, nekuti anoratidza mikaha yekusawirirana yakadzika chose pakati pemapoka anotapa nhau mukati menyika imwe neimwe, uye pakati penyikawo dzakasiyana siyana pasi rose.
mt0: <pad> The media rights group said its research was "disturbing" because it showed deep levels of intolerance between journalists within each network, and between different networks around the world.</s>

en: In 2022, it's really undeniable that media polarization and information chaos are really fueling social divisions in ways that are pretty new, said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States, told VOA.
sna: Muna 2022, hazvirambike kuti kusawirirana pamaonero nekumisidzana kwezvikwata zvekutapwa kwenhau nemvongamupopoto mukufambiswa kwemashoko ndizvo zviri kusundira mberi kusawirirana kwevanhu pamagariro avo nenzira itsva, akadaro Clayton Weimers, mutevedzeri wemukuru we RSF mudunhu reUnited States, achiudza VOA.
mt0: <pad> In 2022, it is unmistakable that the lack of consensus and the collaboration between journalists and activists in the media are pushing forward new forms of political disagreement, said Clayton Weimers, deputy director of RSF for the United States.</s>

en: He said the prevalence of partisan news around the world has come at the expense of authentic journalism.
sna: Akati kuwanda kwenhau dzinotsigira divi rimwe chete pasi rose kuri kuuraya kutapwa nekuturwa kwenhau dzechokwadi.
mt0: <pad> He said that the excess of propaganda in the world is killing the pursuit and dissemination of true news.</s>

en: The group's annual report ranks 180 countries based on the environment for independent journalism.
sna: Mashoko eboka iri ezvinoitika gore negore anoisa pachikero nyika dzine zana nemakumi masere zvichienderana nekuti vanotapa nhau vakazvimirira vanotenderwa kushanda mumamiriro ezvinhu akaita sei.
mt0: <pad> The group's annual report ranks 138 countries on how independent journalists are allowed to work in such conditions.</s>

en: This year, however, RSF said it used a new method that blends each country's political, legal, economic, sociocultural and security conditions.
sna: Asi gore rino, RSF yakati yakashandisa nzira itsva inosanganisira mamiriro ezvematongerwo, zvemitemo, zvehupfumi zvemagariro netsika uye zvekuchengetedzwa nekuzvidzivirira.
mt0: <pad> But this year, RSF said it had adopted a new approach that included political, legal, economic, social and cultural conditions and protection and self-defense.</s>

en: Now, the index classifies a record 28 countries as "having very bad media freedom."
sna: Iyezvino, chikero ichi chinoisa kekutanga zvachisati chamboita nyika makumi maviri nesere "dzine rusununguko rwezvenhau rwakaipisisa".
mt0: <pad> Now, the ranking places 22 countries in the "worst media freedom" category for the first time.</s>

en: That group includes China, which is exporting censorship beyond its borders while also amplifying the Kremlin's propaganda on Russia's devastating war against Ukraine.
sna: Chikwata ichi chinosanganisira China iyo yavakugovera kurambidza kufambiswa kwenhau nemashoko mhiri kwemiganhu yayo apawo ichiwedzera dzidziso dzezvematongerwo dzine manyepo uye dzakarerekera kudivi rimwe chete dzinobva kuKremlin pamusoro pehondo yeRussia iyo yaparadza nekusakadza nyika yeUkraine.
mt0: <pad> This group includes China which has already shared its commitment to censorship of information and media across its borders and adding Kremlin propaganda that is biased and one-sided about the Russian war that destroyed and destabilized Ukraine.</s>

en: Russia, China among worst
sna: Russia, China dziri pakati chenyika dzakaipisisa
mt0: <pad> Russia and China are among the worst countries in the world.</s>

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
sna: Kubva zvayapinda neganyavhu muUkraine musi wa24 Kukdazi, Russia yakabva yabvupa masimba ese pamusoro pekuti nhau dzinobuda nedzisingabude ndedzipi, ichibva yamisa mutemo mutsva une chitarafu chemakore gumi nemashanu mujeri kune anenge apomerwa kunyora kunyora kana kutepfenyura mashoko anonzi "nhau dzenhema pamusor pemauto uye kurambidza kuti zviri kuitika muUkraine inzi "ihondo."
mt0: <pad> Since its invasion of Ukraine on 24 May, Russia has taken control of all media, having promulgated a new law with a 15-year jail term for those convicted of writing or broadcasting "false news" about the troops and banning the calling of the situation in Ukraine a "war."</s>

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
sna: Izvi zvabva zvamanikidza makambani ezvenhau akazvimiririra mazhinji anga achiri kushanda muRussia , anosanganisira bepanhau rine mukurumbira rinonzi Novaya Gazeta, newspaper, nhepfenyuroyeradio yeEkho Moskvy ne nhepfenyuro yemadzangaradzimu ye Dozhd TV, kuti avhare kana kuti abude muRussia kuti agone achiita basa.
mt0: <pad> This has forced many independent media companies that were still active in Russia, including the popular Novaya Gazeta, newspaper, radio station Ekho Moskvy and television channel Dozhd TV, to close or leave Russia to continue their work.</s>

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
sna: Nyanzvi dzinoti zvapaisisna mazwi ezve nhau asina divi raakarerekera, hurumende yekuRussia yabva yatutira dzidziso yezvematongerwo ine manyepo uye yakarerekera kudivi rimwe chete inoti hondo iyi kunongova kusawirirana kudiki nekupa zvikonzero zvenhema zvinoruramisira kupinda kweRussia muUkraine neganyavhu.
mt0: <pad> Experts say that after the spread of unbiased media reports, the Russian government has adopted a biased and one-sided policy that says the war is just a small disagreement and provides false reasons to legitimize the aggressive intervention of Russia in Ukraine with force.</s>

en: Russia's media repression stands at 155 out of 180 countries included in RSF's index, where one is the most free and 180 the least.
sna: Nekuda kwekudzvanyirira kwainoita zvekutapwa kwenhau Russia iri pachinhanho chezana nemakumi mashanu neshanu pakati pezvinhanho zana nemakumi masere dziri pachikero cheRSF, apo inenge iri pachinhanho chekutanga ndiyo inenge yakanyanya kusununguka uye nyika inenge iri pachinhanho chezana nemakumi masere ndieye nyika inenge yakashatisisa.
mt0: <pad> Because of its media censorship Russia is ranked fifty-five among the eighty-one countries on the RSF scale, where the first is the most free and the eighty-nineth is the most restrictive.</s>

en: It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia, Clayton said.
sna: Nepatasvika, tingati hedu pasina kupokana kuti, kusunguka kwezvekutapwa kwenhau dzangovangano dzematakadya kare, Clayton akadaro.
mt0: <pad> When we arrived, we can say without a doubt that, the reduction of press releases about our past meetings was almost unnoticeable, Clayton said.</s>

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.
sna: Akatizve, mumakore makumi maviri nemaviri mutungamiriri weRussia Vladimir Putin achitonga, Moscow yanga yakangosona vatapi venhau nemasangano enhau asina divi raakarerekera.
mt0: <pad> He also said that in the past 21 years of Russian President Vladimir Putin's rule, Moscow has only controlled journalists and media organizations without any role to play.</s>

en: But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia, Clayton said.
sna: Asi kubva Russia yapinda neganyavhu muUkraine, zvinoita sekuti Putin abva akohovedza masangano enhau akazvimiririra muRussia, Clayton akadaro.
mt0: <pad> But since Russia's military intervention in Ukraine, it seems that Putin has been undermining independent media organizations in Russia, Clayton said.</s>

en: "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
sna: "Parizvino, hazvichagoni kuti pave nekutapa nekutura nhau nemazvo pamusoro pehondo yemu Ukraine."
mt0: <pad> "Right now, it is impossible to provide reliable and credible information about the war in Ukraine.</s>

en: China ranked 175th in the new report.
sna: China yakaiswa pachinhanho chezana nemakumi manomwe neshanu pachinyorwa chichangoburwa.
mt0: <pad> China was ranked as the 175th in the latest World Economic Report.</s>

en: And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
sna: Zvino zvayakunyatsotongwa neChina, Hong Kong yakadonha zvine mutsindo, ichibva yamhara pachinhanho chezana nemakumi mana nesere mushure menguva yakareba yekuronda, kupindira mudzimba nekusunga zvakavhara madariro epadandemutande enhau anorwira gutsaruzhinji.
mt0: <pad> Now under full control of China, Hong Kong has fallen sharply, and has slipped to the 144th place after a long period of surveillance, occupation and closure of pro-democracy online news websites.</s>

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention.
sna: Mapepa eongororo yenyika nenyika eRSF anoti China ndiyo musungi mukuru pasi rose wevatapi venhau, iine zama nemakumi maviri vari mujeri.
mt0: <pad> The annual report of the RSF says China is the world's biggest prisoner of journalists, with eighteen in jail.</s>

en: The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
sna: Hurumende iyi inoshandisa kumanikidza, kushungurudza, kutyisidzira nekutevera vatori venhau vakazvimiririra nevekunze kuti vasatape nhau dzavanoti “dzinozezesa kutaura nezvadzo.”
mt0: <pad> The government uses pressure, intimidation, harassment and persecution of independent and foreign journalists to prevent them from covering what they call "sensitive" news.</s>

en: President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime, RSF's country file states.
sna: President Xi Jinping, uyo akatanga kutonga muna 2013, akadzoredzesa tsika dzezvenhau  dzemakore emakare kare munguva dzanaMao, zvekutik yatova mhosvakudakutsvaga ruzivo rwezvinenge zvichiitika, uyezve kutokorora mhosva hurusa kuwanukwa uchigova ruzivo rwezvirikuitika, zvinodaro zvinyorwa zveRSF pamusoro peRussia.
mt0: <pad> President Xi Jinping, who took office in 2013, has re-established the Maoist media culture, so that it has become a crime to seek information, and a criminal offence to be caught up in leakage of information, according to Russian State Security Service (RSF) documents on Russia.</s>

en: Rising authoritarianism
sna: Kumuruka Kwekutonga Nedemo
mt0: <pad> The failure of government and the lack of knowledge</s>

en: North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.
sna: North Korea inoramba iri nyika yakaipisisa yakatsigira manera echikero ichi, iri pachinhanho chezana nemakumi masere. Kune dzimwe nzvimbo mudunhu remuAsia-Pacific kusagadzikana kwezvematongerwo, kurwisana nekumuruka kwetsika yekutonga nedemo zvakabva zvatsvairira kure makore ose epundutso nebudiriro.
mt0: <pad> North Korea remains the worst country to support these criteria, ranked eighteenth. In other parts of Asia-Pacific unstable political climate, conflict and the rise of a dictatorial culture and democracy have wiped out all the years of success and progress.</s>

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile.
sna: Kutorwa nechisimba chemauto hutongi hwemuMyanmar muna 2021, kwakabva kwamisa zvakanaka zvayitika mune zvekutapwa kwenhau kwemakore gumi, kuchibva kwatanga kusingwa kwevatapi venhau, marezinesi nemvumo dzekushanda kwemasangano enhau zvichibvarurwa nemasangano mazhinji enhau emuMyanamar chitiza munyika achinoshandira ari kunze.
mt0: <pad> The military coup in Myanmar in 2021, started a period of relatively good news freedom for 10 years, which began with the arrest of journalists, the revoking of press licenses and the discontinuation of many Myanmar media organizations, leading to many Myanmar media workers fleeing the country to work abroad.</s>

en: Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.
sna: Myanamar, iyo iri pasi pehutongi hwemauto, iripachimho chezana nemakumi manomwe nenhanhatu, uye ndiyo imwe  yen'an'a hurusa pakukanda mujeri vatapi venhau.
mt0: <pad> Myanmar, which is under military rule, is on the 178th place in the world's list of countries, and is one of the worst jails for journalists.</s>

en: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pledged to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021.
sna: MuAfghanistan, vamukiri veTaliban vakatsidza kuchengetedza rusunguko rwezvekutapwa kwenhau panguva yavatora matomu ekutonga munaNyamavhuvhu 2021.
mt0: <pad> In Afghanistan, the Taliban militants have promised to protect press freedom during the transitional government in June 2021.</s>

en: Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence."
sna: RS inoti, pachinzvimbo chekuzadziso chitsidzo chayo, kubvuta simba kwakaitwa nemaTaliban kwabva kwaita kuti mashandiro evatapi nemasangano enhau abva anyanya kunyangara, avo vanenge vakaiteiwa kuitira kuvatyisidzira nekuvakudza."
mt0: <pad> RS says, instead of fulfilling its warning, the Taliban's takeover of power has made journalists and media organizations more anonymous, who are being used to intimidate and protect them.</s>

en: Afghanistan ranked 154th.
sna: Afghanistan iri pachinhanho chezana nemakumi mashanu nemana.
mt0: <pad> Afghanistan is ranked 124th in the Human Development Index.</s>

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.
sna: RSF yakati muAfrica yose, mitemo inoti imhosca kutapa nhau uchishandisa masaisai epamudandemutande abva akarova chibhakera chematsenganzungu kukodzero dzekufambisa nekugamuchira ruzivo rwezvirikuitika, uyewo kuparadzira kwemakuhwa, nezinzwa wakanzwa nedzidziso dzezvematongerwo dzizere manyepo uye dzakarerekera kuritivi rumwe chete zvabva zvatuvida kuwanikwa kweruzivo rwune mandorokwati rwezviri kuitika.
mt0: <pad> RSF said that across Africa, laws that ban the use of internet media have broken the barriers to the movement and reception of information about current events, as well as the dissemination of rumors, and the spread of biased and one-sided political education which has prevented access to objective information about current events.</s>

en: In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, with its communication blackouts and restricted access, were the main factors that placed the country 114 on the index.
sna: MuEthiopia, hondo iri kuitika mudunhu reTigray, nekuvharwa kwekufambiswa kwemashoko  nekunyinyurudzwa kwevanogona kusvika kudunhu iri, ndizvo zvimwe zvezvikonzero zvakaita kuti nyika iyiinge iri pachinhanho chezana negumi nemana pachikero.
mt0: <pad> In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, the closure of information and the discouragement of access to the region, are some of the reasons that the country has been ranked as the 124th country on the Human Development Index.</s>

en: Neighboring Eritrea and Djibouti are far worse, ranking near the bottom at 179 and 164, respectively.
sna: Vavakidzani veEthiopia, Eritrea neDjibouti dziri pakanyanya kuipa, dzichitambira kumuchetochaiko, imwe iri pazana nemakumi manomwe nepfumbamwe, imwewo iri pazana nemakumi matanhatu nemana.
mt0: <pad> Ethiopia's neighbors, Eritrea and Djibouti are the worst, according to the scale, one in the top ninety, the other in the top sixty-four.</s>

en: African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said it its accompanying analysis.
sna: Ongororo yeRSF pamusoro pemamiriro ezvenhau pasi rose inoti, mabasa enhau muAfrican anoramba achigomera panyaya yekuita mari inoita kuti basa iri rienderere mberi.
mt0: <pad> The RSF's Global Media Report says that African media continue to face difficulties in financing the work to keep it going.</s>

en: Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks, the group said.
sna: Kunyangwe kwakamboita mabvumira ekupavanhu simba rekuti vanhu vanosarudza zvavanoda kuita,kunzwa nekutaura mumakore emuma 1990, pachingori nenyaya zekurambidzwa pasina chikonzero kwekufambiswa nekugamuchirwa kwe mashoko, zvikuru sei pamadandemutande anofambisa mashoko nemapotonjere , apo nepapo madandemjutande aya acitombodzimwa mune dzimwe nyika, kusungwa kwevatapi venhau nekurohwa zvakaipisisa, chikwata cheRSF ichi chakadaro.
mt0: <pad> Although there were some freedoms in the 1990s, there are still problems with the restriction of information transmission and reception, particularly on social media sites, sometimes shut down in other countries, the arrest of journalists and physical abuse, the RSF team is one of them.</s>

en: Clayton said the rising authoritarianism feeds on itself.
sna: Clayton akati kusimuka kwekutonga nedemo kunopedzesera kwazvikuvadza.
mt0: <pad> Clayton said the demonstrations and riots could have been harmful.</s>

en: When we allow a culture of impunity to exist where authoritarians are allowed to go after journalists, harass them, arrest them, beat them in the streets and kill them, it has a knock-on effect, he said.
sna: Patinorera tsika  yekuita munhu zvaada paadira munyika dzinotongwa nedemo apo vatongi vanodzingirira vatapi venhau, vovashungurudza, kuvasunga nekuvarova mumigwagwa nekutovauraya kwako, zvinokurudzira kuti vamwe vatodze mucherechedzo uyu, akadaro.
mt0: <pad> When we see the culture of dictatorship in democratic countries where rulers ban journalists, harass, detain and beat them up in the street or kill them, it encourages others to adopt this notation, he said.</s>

en: "It emboldens that same authoritarian to do it again next time, and it emboldens other authoritarians who are watching to do the same."
sna: "Zvinopa simbiso neshingiso kuti vatongi ava vapamhezve nhambo inotevera, izvi zvobva  zvapa shingiso kune vamwe vatongi vakaita savo kuti vatevedzerewo vachiita zvimwezvo."
mt0: <pad> "This gives a strong signal that the judges will be reconsidering their decisions for the next time, and gives a strong signal to other judges who have made similar mistakes to follow suit and do the same."</s>

en: US not perfect
sna: US haisi nyika isina gwapa
mt0: <pad> If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know US is not a country without religion.</s>

en: After a period of seeing its media attacked as "fake news" by former President Donald Trump, the United States retained a relatively high ranking of 42 in RSF's index.
sna: Mushure mekuona nhau dzayo dzichinzi "inhau dzemanyepo" naakambova mutungamiriri Donald Trump, nyika yeUnited States yakaramba iri pachinho chepamusoro iri pachinzvimbo chemakumi mana nemairi pachikero cheRSF.
mt0: <pad> After seeing its news labeled "fake news" by the former president Donald Trump, the United States remained on the top of the RSF rankings at fourteenth.</s>

en: That is largely thanks to the return of regular White House and federal agency press briefings.
sna: Izvi zvakakonzereswa nekudzoswa kwekuturwa kwemashoko kuvatapi venhau kumuzinda wemukuru wenyika weWhite House nekumahofisi evakuru, magavhuna ematunhu emuAmerica apo vatapi vanogona kubvunza mibvunzo kumukuru wenyika nevakuru vematunhu.
mt0: <pad> This was caused by the resumption of press conferences at the White House and the states' governorships, where journalists could ask questions to the president and the governors.</s>

en: But RSF said problems persist, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the systematic polarization of the media, and the erosion of journalism by digital platforms amid a climate of animosity and aggression toward journalists, among others."
sna: Asi RSF yakati matambudziko anongoramba aripo, anosanganisira, including "kunyangarika kwe mapepanhau emunharaunda, kumiswa kwemasangano enhau mumapoka anorwisana pamaonero, uye kuyeredzwa kwebasa rekutapa nhau nemadariro emadendemutande anokusha nhau kuvanhu kwese kwese padzinenge dzichiitika zvese izvi zvichiitika mumamiriro ezvinhu echinya neganyavhu kuvatapi venhau, nemamwe madzudzo."
mt0: <pad> But the RSF said problems remained, including "the disappearance of local newspapers, the shutdown of media organizations in politically conservative groups, and the testing of the work of journalists and online news sites that publish news to the general public when it happens all this in conditions of extremely difficult and degrading conditions for journalists, and with other punishments."</s>

en: Barriers exist, for instance, when it comes to covering state governments and protests.
sna: Zvimhingamupinyi zviriko, semuyenzaniso, kana pari pakutapa nhau dzezviri kuitika muhurumende dzemumatunhu nepanenge paine kuratidzira.
mt0: <pad> The obstacles, for example, are when it comes to reporting on the events in state governments and protests.</s>

en: We typically find that this is either due to just a blatant disregard for the laws governing open records or meetings, or they're simply misinterpreting them.
sna: Tinoona sekuti izvi zvinobva pakuti panogona kunge paita kushaiwa hanya pamusoro pemitemo iri maringe nezvinyorwa zvinogona kuonekwa naani zvake, kana misangano, kana kuti vanenge vatadza kududzira mitemo iyi.
mt0: <pad> We think this is due to the lack of concern about the law regarding printed materials that can be seen by anyone, or organizations, or the inability to interpret the law.</s>

en: An individual is misinterpreting whether a journalist can be present at a particular event, said Beth Francesco, senior director of the National Press Club Journalism Institute.
sna: Munhu anenge achitdza kududzira kuti mtapi wenhau anogona kutenderwa kuva pachiitiko here kana kuti kwete, akadaro Beth Francesco, mutariri mukuru we The National Press Club Journalism Institute.
mt0: <pad> It's a matter of judgment whether a journalist can be allowed to attend an event, said Beth Francesco, director of the National Press Club Journalism Institute.</s>

en: A few bright spots
sna: Nzvimbo shoma dzinonjenjemera
mt0: <pad> Some places are cold.</s>

en: Despite an overall trend of decline, Clayton said there are positives.
sna: Clayton anoti kunyangwe hazvo paine gundamusaira rekuderera, pane panenzvimbo dzine budiriro.
mt0: <pad> Clayton says that even though there is a poor road network, there are areas of development.</s>

en: Some governments provide funding for news media without interfering in their operations, to ensure independence from political influence.
sna: Dzimwe hurumende dzinotopa mari kumasangano enhau, asi dzisingapindire mumshandiro emasangano aya, kuti pave nekuzvimirira akasununguka pasina kusenererwa nevezvematongerwo.
mt0: <pad> Some governments often fund media organizations, but don't interfere with their operations, to ensure that they remain independent without being recognized by politicians.</s>

en: If you look at the top of our list, some of the things that stand out are these are countries that have robust public funding for media, he said, noting that "it's always important to separate state funding for media and state-controlled media."
sna: Akati, kana ukatarisa kumusoro kwechikero chedu, chimwe chezvinhu zvinokurumidza kuonekwa inyika dzinotsigira mabasa enhau nemari inobva muhomwe yehurumende. Azoenderera mberi achiti, "Zvinokosha nguva dzose kuti pave nekupatsanurwa kwerutsigiro rwehurumende rwuunopiwa masangano rnhau akazvimiririra nemasangano enhau ari pasi pehurumende."
mt0: <pad> He said, when you look at our list, one of the most obvious things is that countries fund media services with government money. He went on to say, "It's always important to distinguish government support for independent media and government-owned media."</s>

en: Three Scandinavian countries Norway, Denmark and Sweden â€” respectively come at the top of RSF's index. Estonia, a former Soviet Union republic, ranked 4th.
sna: Nyika nhatu dziri mudunhu reEurope rinonzi Scandinavia dzinoti Norway, Denmark ndidzo dziri pamusoro soro machikero che RSF. Estonia, yaimbova chikamu che Soviet Union, ndiyo iri pachinhanho chechina.
mt0: <pad> Three Scandinavian countries, Norway, Denmark are the top three members of the RSF. Estonia, a former member of the Soviet Union, is on the fourth place.</s>

en: RSF said the free exercise of journalism plays a major role in emerging democracies such as East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, ranked 33, and Mongolia, ranked 90.
sna: RSF yakati kusununguka kwemabasa enhau kuita basa ravo kwakakosha zvikuru munyika dzichiri kusimuka panyaya yegutsaruzhinji, senyika yeEast Timor, iri pachinzvimbo chegumi nenomwe, Bhutan yakamira iri yechimakumi matatu nematatu uyewo neMongolia, ine chinhanho che makumi mapfumbamwe.
mt0: <pad> RSF said that the freedom of press was particularly important in countries that are still developing in terms of media freedom, such as East Timor, ranked eighth, Bhutan, ranked thirty-third and Mongolia, ranked ninety-nine.</s>

en: East Timor was one country whose ranking skyrocketed, rising 54 places.
sna: East Timor ndiyo imwe nyika ine chinhanho chakakwirisisa nekuti yakacharika zvinhanho makumi mashanu nezvina.
mt0: <pad> East Timor is one of the most complicated states in the world, having passed through 54 stages.</s>

en: But RSF cautioned that because of its change in methodology this year, "care should be taken when comparing the 2022 rankings and scores with those from 2021."
sna: Asi RSF yakayambira kuti, nekuda kwekushandura nzira yekuyera nayo yakashandiswa gore rino, "panofanirwa kuchenjererwa panoongorwa zviyero zvemuna 2022 zvichiyenzaniswa nezvakabuda muna 2021."
mt0: <pad> But the RSF warned that, due to the change in measurement methodology used this year, "there should be caution when recording 2022 values compared with 2021 results."</s>

en: UN's Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
sna: Mukuru weUN Guterres Anosangana Nevakuru VeNigeria Mushure Mekushanyira Dunhu Risina Kugadzikana ReBorno State
mt0: <pad> UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres Meets Nigerian Leaders After Visiting the Unstable Region of Borno</s>

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa.
sna: Munyori mukuru weU.N. Antonio Guterres akasangana nevatungamiriri vemuNigeria neChitatu pakapera kushanya kwake kwemazuva maviri kuNigeria nerwendo rwemazuva matatu kuAfrica.
mt0: <pad> UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders on Wednesday after his two-day visit to Nigeria and a three-day Africa tour.</s>

en: On Tuesday, he visited internally displaced people (IDPs) in northeast Nigeria and called for them to be safely returned to their homes.
sna: NeChipiri, akashanyira vanhu vakabviswa kubva kumisha yavo muNigeria vanonzi Internally Displaced People (IDPs) kumaodzanyemba akadziva kumabvazuva eNigeria akataura kuti vadzoserwe kumisha yavo nenzira yakachengetedzeka.
mt0: <pad> On Tuesday, he visited the Internally Displaced People (IDPs) in north and east Nigeria and said that they should be repatriated to their homes safely.</s>

en: Nigerian authorities plan to close all IDP camps in the next few years despite security concerns.
sna: Vakuru memuNigeria vanehurongwa hwekuvhara  misasa inogara vanhu vakabviswa kumisha yavo mumakore mashoma onouya kunyangwe paine kutyira kuchengetedzeka kwevanhu ava pavanodzokera kumisha yavo.
mt0: <pad> Nigerian officials plan to close the refugee camps in the coming years despite concerns about the security of the people when they return to their villages.</s>

en: Antonio Guterres arrived the United Nations house in Abuja around 9 a.m. Wednesday and met with U.N. local coordinators before holding talks with Nigerian womens representatives.
sna: Antonio Guterres aakasvika kuimba yeUnited Nations muAbuja nenguva dzepfumbamwe mangwananni eChitatu akasangana vevanotungamiririra mune zvinoitwa neU.N. munzvimbo dzakasiyana siyana dzeNigeria pedzezvo ndookuzoita nhaurirano vevamiririri vevhanhukadzi vemuNigeria.
mt0: <pad> Antonio Guterres arrived at the United Nations headquarters in Abuja on Wednesday morning and met with UN representatives in different parts of Nigeria and then had a discussion with women's representatives in Nigeria.</s>

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
sna: akokwa vakauya kumusangano uyu, vachitungamirirwa negurukota rezvemadzimayi muNigeria, Amai Pauline Kedem Tallen, vakakurukura nemunyori mukuru weU.N. nyaya yekuenzanisira pakati pemadzimayi nevarume, nekupinzwawo kwemadzimayi mune zvematongerwo.
mt0: <pad> The Nigerian women's minister, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed with the UN secretary general about gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics.</s>

en: His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws, said Tallen.
sna: Kuuya kwavo kuNigeria nhasi kwatipa tariro,  nekuti tinoziva kuti achatipawo inzwi rake kunyaya dzose dzinobata vanhukadzi, kubatwa neganyavhu kuitwa vanhukadzi, kuroorwa vachiri vanana, kuishandiswa kwemimwe mitemo, akadaro Tallen.
mt0: <pad> The arrival of her today in Nigeria gives us hope, because we know she will also speak up for all issues relating to women, abuse, childbirth, and other issues, said Tallen.</s>

en: Guterres afterwards met with Nigeria's religious leaders and later attended a wreath-laying ceremony at the U.N. house to remember the 23 people killed during the 2011 bombing of the building.
sna: Mushure mazvo, Guterres akazoonanan nevatungamiriri vezvezvinamato vemuNigeria mushure mazvo akaenda pachiitiko chekuisa maruva echirangaridzo pamaba yeU.N. kuyeuka vanhu makumi maviri nevatatu vakaurayiwa pakakandwa mabhabhu mukati meimba iyi muna2011.
mt0: <pad> Afterwards, Guterres met with Nigerian religious leaders after attending a ceremony to lay a wreath at the UN headquarters to remember the 23 people killed when bombs were planted inside the building in 2011.</s>

en: He began his three-nation Africa visit Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan solidarity tour, and later went to Niger.
sna: Akatanga rwendo rwake kunyika nhatu dzemuAfrica musi weSvondo ari muSenegal sechikamu cherwendo rwekuratidza kutsigira kwake mwaka weRamadan, mushure mazvo ndookuzoenda kuNiger.
mt0: <pad> He started his trip to three African countries on Sunday in Senegal as part of his Ramadan support tour, after which he went to Niger.</s>

en: On Tuesday, he visited northeastern Borno state and met with the state governor as well as IDPs and families impacted by the Boko Haram conflict.
sna: Nechipiri akashanyira dunhu riri kumaodzanyemba akadziva kumabvazuva reBorno uko akasangana nemtungamiriri wedunhu iri, uyewo nevanhu vakabvuswa kumisha yavo pamwenehondo nemhuri dzavo nekuda kwehondo yeBoko Haram.
mt0: <pad> On Tuesday he visited the north-east state of Borno where he met with the governor of the state, and with people whose villages were displaced by the Boko Haram war and their families.</s>

en: Guterres also visited repentant Boko Haram fighters and praised authorities' reintegration program for more than 1,000 former fighters.
sna: Guterres akashanyirawo varwi veBoko Haram vakatendeuka uye akarumbidza basa riri kuitwa nevatungamiriri kuburikidza nechirongwa chekudzosera vaimbova varwi ava vanodarika chiuru kuti mudzimhuri nemisha yavo.
mt0: <pad> Guterres also visited the converted Boko Haram fighters and praised the work being done by leaders through a program to reintegrate over 1,000 of these former fighters into their families and homes.</s>

en: He also commended authorities efforts to resettle displaced people back to their communities and called for more support to rebuild the region.
sna: Vakarumbidzawo basa riri kuitwa vevakuru rekudzosera kumisha vanhu vakange vatiza matunhu avo nekuda kwehondo vakakumbirawo kuti pave nekuwedzera rubatsiro rwekuvaka zvakare dunhu iri.
mt0: <pad> They also praised the work of the authorities in repatriation of refugees who fled their villages because of the war and called for more aid to rebuild the district.</s>

en: "The Borno that I found today is the Borno of hope, the Borno with future and I was very impressed to see the policy that is being deployed here, recognizing that you don't fight terrorism just by military means, you fight terrorism addressing the root causes of terrorism," he said.
sna: "Borno yandaona nhasi iBorno ine taririro, Borno ine ramangwana, uye ndafadzwa chose kuona chirongwa chiri kushandiswa kuno, nekuti makaona kuti hamurwise hugandanga nezvombo zvehondo zvoga, asi kuti munorwisa hungandanga nekukudzura midzi nezvikonzero zvehugandanga," akadaro.
mt0: <pad> "The Borno I have seen today is a Borno with hope, a Borno with the future, and I am very happy to see the program used here, because I have seen that you don't fight terrorism with weapons of war alone, but you fight terrorism by suppressing villages and destroying the causes of terrorism," he said.</s>

en: "The people that I met today in the IDP camps want to go back home in safety and dignity.
sna: "Vanhu vandasangana navo nhasi mumisasa yemaIDP vanoda kudzokera kumusha nenzira yakachengetedzeka uye inoremekedza hunhu hwavo.
mt0: <pad> "The people I met today in the IDP camps want to return home safely and respectfully.</s>

en: The way to address terrorism effectively is to provide not only hope but a future of reality."
sna: Nzira yekugadzirisa hugandanga nenzira inogarahaingosanganisiri kupa tariro asi ramangwana rezvinhu zvinobatika."
mt0: <pad> The path to ending poverty in a sustainable way is not only giving hope but also a clear future.</s>

en: Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since late last year and want to close all camps by 2026.
sna: Vakuru vemuNigeria vange vachivhara misasa yemaIDP kubva gore rakapera, uye vanoda kunge vavhara misasa iyi yose negore ra2026.
mt0: <pad> Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since last year, and they hope to close all of them by 2026.</s>

en: More than 2 million people have been displaced from their homes since the start of the Boko Haram insurgency in 2009.
sna: Vanhu vanodarika mamiriyoni maviri vakabviswa kubva kumisha yavo kubvira pakatanga kupanduka nehondo yeBoko Haram muna 2009.
mt0: <pad> Over two million people have been displaced from their villages since the Boko Haram rebellion and war began in 2009.</s>

en: But aid groups have been warning some communities may still be attacked.
sna: Asi masangano anobatsira vanhu vari munjodzi vange vachiyambira kuti dzimwe nzvimbo dzinogona kurwisa zvakare.
mt0: <pad> But relief agencies have been warning that other areas may be at risk of another attack.</s>

en: There are multiple solutions when it comes to resettlement.
sna: Pane nzira dzakawanda dzekuunza mhinduro panyaya yekugarisa vanhu patsva.
mt0: <pad> There are many ways to solve the problem of rehousing.</s>

en: We need to get people stabilized, said Adenike Oladosu, a climate justice activist, met with the U.N. secretary-general.
sna: Tinofanirwa kuona kuti vanhu vagadzikana, akataura achidaro Adenike Oladosu, uyo anorwira zvekururamisira panyaya dzezvemamiriro ekunza, paakasangana nemunyori mukuru weU.N.
mt0: <pad> We have to see that people are not neglected, said Adenike Oladosu, a campaigner for climate justice, when he met with UN secretary general Ban Ki-moon.</s>

en: "Climate change is leading to the rise of armed conflicts affecting people in the region and around and the need for us to see that we have more climate action and not always military action."
sna: "Kushanduka kwemamiriro ekunze ari kukonzera pakuwedzera kwekukwisana mudunhu rino nenzvimbo dzakaripoteredza uye pava nezvinofanirwa kuitwa kuti tione kuti pane zvatiri kuita pane zvemamiriro ekunze kwekungogaszirisa zvehondo chete."
mt0: <pad> "Climate change is leading to increased conflict in this region and the surrounding areas and there is a need to make sure that what we are doing on climate change is not just a war-crime."</s>

en: The U.N. secretary-general ended his visit at the Abuja presidential village, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and his top Cabinet members.
sna: Munyori mukuru weU.N. akapeta rwendo rwake muAbuja ari pamuzinda wemukuru wenyika, apo akasangana nemutungamiriri wenyika Muhammadu Buhari nemakurukota ake makuru.
mt0: <pad> The UN Secretary General ended his visit to Nigeria in Abuja at the presidential palace, where he met with President Muhammadu Buhari and his senior ministers.</s>

en: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base
sna: Al-Shabab Inorwisa Kamba Yemasoja E African Union
mt0: <pad> Al-Shabab attacks an African Union base in Somalia</s>

en: Al-Shabab fighters stormed an African Union military base in the village of El-Baraf in Somalias Middle Shabelle region early Tuesday, local officials and security sources say.
sna: Vakuru vemunzvimbo nevamwe vezvekuchengetedzwa kwenyika vanoti varwi veAl-Shabab vakapinda zvine chisimba mune imwe kamba yevarwi veAfrican Union iri mumusha weEl-Baraf mudunhu reSomalia reMiddle Shabelle rungwanani rweChipiri.
mt0: <pad> Local officials and other security sources say Al-Shabab militants have broken into an African Union base in El-Baraf village in the Somalian region of Middle Shabelle on Tuesday morning.</s>

en: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian solders at the base repulsed the attack.
sna: Vakuru vakaudza VOA Somali kuti varwi ava vakabvuta kamba iyi kwechinguvana mushure ndokubva vayisiya. Masangano ezvenhau achishandira hurumende anoti  masoja eku Burundi aive pakamba apa ndiwo akarwisa varwi ava kusvikira vatiza.
mt0: <pad> Officials told VOA Somali that the rebels seized the camp for a short time and then abandoned it. Government media reports say the Burundian troops at the camp fought the rebels until they fled.</s>

en: The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle, the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.
sna: Pamashoko avakanyora padandemutande ravo reFacebook, bazi rinoona nezvekunze kweSomalia rakati, Hurumende yeSomalia inoshora zvakasimbisisa kurwisa kune hutsinye nechinya kwakange kwakanangiswa kukamba yemauto eAfrican Union yeAfrican Union Transition Mission in Somalia muElbaraf, kuMiddle Shabelle.
mt0: <pad> In a statement posted on Facebook, the Somali foreign ministry said, The Somali government condemns strongly the attack with brutality and violence that was launched on the camp of the African Union transition mission in Somalia in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle.</s>

en: We extend our deepest condolences to the victims of this terrorist attack and their families.
sna: Tinotumira mashoko enyaradzo kunevakakuvadzwa nekuurayiwa pamwe nemhuri dzavo.
mt0: <pad> We send our condolences to the injured and those who were killed and their families.</s>

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants started their attack with two suicide truck bombs.
sna: Tmukuru weguta reEl-Baraf, vaAbdullahi Haji Muhumed, vakati varwi ava vakatanga kurwisa kwavo vachishandisa motokari mbiri dzakange dziine vanhu vakazvisungirira mabhobhu dziine dzimwe motokari mbiri dziine vanhu vakazvipira kuputsitsa mabhobhu avakazvisungirira.
mt0: <pad> The mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants launched their attack by using two bomb-laden cars and two more with volunteers to blow up their bombs.</s>

en: He said the militants then fought their way onto the base.
sna: Vakati varwi ava vakazopinda mukamba umu vachiita zvekuridza pfuti dzavo.
mt0: <pad> They said the men then entered the camp with their guns firing.</s>

en: Al-Shabab claimed the killing of 173 African Union forces.
sna: Al-Shabab yakati yakauraya mauto eAfrican Union anosvika zana nemakumi manomwe nevasere.
mt0: <pad> Al-Shabab said it killed up to 170 African Union troops.</s>

en: The group also claimed responsibility for capturing AU forces as prisoners-of-war.
sna: Boka iri rakatiwo ndiro rakapamba mauto eAU ndokuvaita vasungwa vakabatwa munguva yehondo.
mt0: <pad> The group also said it captured the AU troops and made them hostages during the war.</s>

en: Both claims could not be independently verified.
sna: Izvizvose zviri zviri hazvisati zvaonekwa kuti ndezvechokwadi here.
mt0: <pad> All this is not yet proven to be true.</s>

en: AU force headquarters and Somali military officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
sna: Muzinda wemauto eAU nevakuru vemauto emuSomalia hava kukwanisa kubatwa kuti vawane mukana wekuti vataurewo zvavanofunga nezviitiko izvi.
mt0: <pad> The AU commander and the commander of the Somali forces were not able to be contacted for comment on the incidents.</s>

en: In an interview with VOA, Muhumed, who was not at the village at the time of the attack, said he was told there were "many deaths" among Burundian forces but could not give an exact figure.
sna: Muhumed akabvuma kuVOA kuti varwi ve al-Shabab vakabva pakamba iyi. Akatiwo varwi ava vakazorwiswawo nepfuti dzemuchadenga, asi haana kureva kuti ndiani akange rwisa varwi ve al Shabab.
mt0: <pad> Muhumed admitted to the VOA that al-Shabab fighters left the base. He also said they were hit by airstrikes, but did not specify who was fighting the al-Shabab fighters.</s>

en: Fighting like this never happened in this area, he said. "It was heavy fighting."
sna: Kurwisana kwakadai hakusati kwamboitika munzvimbo ino, akadaro. "Kwaiva kurwisana kwaityisa kuchishandisa zvombo zvikuru."
mt0: <pad> Such a fight has never happened in this area, he said. "It was a fierce battle with large arms used."</s>

en: He said two civilians were also killed and more than 10 others injured.
sna: Akatiwo vagari vemunzvimbo iyi vaviviri vakaurayiwa, uye vamwe gumi vakakuvadzwa.
mt0: <pad> He also said that two residents of the area were killed and 10 injured.</s>

en: Muhumed confirmed to VOA that al-Shabab militants withdrew from the base.
sna: Muhumed akabvuma kuVOA kuti varwi ve al-Shabab vakabva pakamba iyi.
mt0: <pad> Muhumed told the VOA that al-Shabab fighters had left the camp.</s>

en: He also reported airstrikes targeting the militants as they left the base but did not say who was responsible for the strikes.
sna: Akatiwo varwi ava vakazorwiswawo nepfuti dzemuchadenga, asi haana kureva kuti ndiani akange rwisa varwi ve al Shabab.
mt0: <pad> He also said the troops were hit by airstrikes, but did not specify who was attacking the al Shabab troops.</s>

en: El-Baraf, approximately 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the forward operating bases of African Union forces from Burundi.
sna: El-Baraf, iri chinhambwe chingasvike makiromita zana nemakumi mashanu kumaodzanyemba eMogadishu,  inoshandiswa sekamba inochengeta mauto zvombo nezvekushandisa zvemasoja eAfrican Union anobva kuBurundi.
mt0: <pad> El-Baraf, located about 150 km north of Mogadishu, is used as a base for the African Union troops and equipment from Burundi.</s>

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
sna: Chiitiko ichi ndicho chakava kurwisa kukuru kwekutanga kwe al-Shabab pamauto eAU kubva basa reAU muSomalia rakashandura zita raro nehwaro hwekushanda kwaro mwedzi wakapfuura.
mt0: <pad> The attack was the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the UN mission in Somalia changed its name and mission scope last month.</s>

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), gives it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity-building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to Somalia.
sna: Bazi rinoona nezvekuchengetedzwa mumubatanidzwa wenyika dzose reU.N. Security Council, iro rakatendera kuti bsa rekuSomalia richinzi African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), rinoripawo basa reku rekuderedza njodzi ingaunzwe ne al-Shabab, kutsigira basa rekupa goneso kumauto eSomalia, uye kupa basa rose rekuchengetedzwa kwenyika kuvanhu vemuSomalia, asi zvichiitwa nezviyero zvishoma nezvishoma mupakara zvapera.
mt0: <pad> The UN Security Council, which has approved the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), also provides for monitoring the al-Shabab threat, supporting the training of the Somali army, and providing all national security services to the people of Somalia, but it is done gradually in the past year.</s>

en: The mission has until the end of 2024 to operate in the country.
sna: Chirongwa ichi chichange chichishanda muSomalia kusvikira gore ra2024.
mt0: <pad> The program will work in Somalia until 2024.</s>

en: India's Muslims Mark Eid al-Fitr Amid Community Violence
sna: Vatenderi vechi Islam vekuIndia vanopemberera Kupera KweEid al-Fitr Asi Paine Kurwisana Munzvimbo Dzigere Vanhu
mt0: <pad> Muslims in India celebrate the end of Eid al-Fitr but there are clashes in some areas of the country.</s>

en: Muslims across India marked Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by offering prayers outside mosques, even as the celebrations this year came in the backdrop of a series of recent attacks against the community during the month of Ramadan.
sna: Muslims muIndia yose vakacherechedza Eid al-Fitr neChipiri vachita minamato vari panze pedzimba dzavo dzekunamatira, ma mosque,  kunyangwe hazvo mhemberero idzi dzichiuya gore rino mushure mekurwiswa chevatenderi ava munguva ichangodarika mumwedzi weRamadan.
mt0: <pad> Muslims across India celebrated Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by praying outside their mosques, despite the fact that this year's festival comes after recent riots in the month of Ramadan.</s>

en: We will not have the same kind of festivity this time, said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a civil engineer in Indias financial capital, Mumbai.
sna: Hatisi kuzove nemhemberero dzataisiita kare rwendo rwuno, akadaro Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, nyanzvi pane zvekuvaka anogara muguta guru muIndia pane zvemari, Mumbai.
mt0: <pad> "We don't have the same celebrations this time," said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, an architect who lives in Mumbai, India's biggest city for finance.</s>

en: "This is the most painful Eid with worst memories for Indian Muslims."
sna: "Iyi ndiyo nuva ye Eid inonyanya kurwadza nekuti inouya nendangariro dzinorwadzisa chose kuvatenderi vechiMuslim vemuIndia."
mt0: <pad> "This is the most painful Eid because it brings a very sad memory to Muslims of India.</s>

en: Anti-Muslim sentiment and attacks have surged across the country in the last month, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious processions and subsequent demolitions of a number of properties mostly belonging to Muslims by authorities.
sna: Pfungwa dzekuvenga maMuslim nekuvarwisa zvakawedzera munyika yose mwedzi wakapfuura, kusanganisira kutemana nematombo pakati pezvikwata zve maHindu nemaMuslim panguva dzekunamata vanhu  vachifamba vari mumitsara, ndokuzoteverwa nekuparadzwa kwakaitwa nevakuru vemudzinzvimbo kwezvivakwa, zvizhinji zvacho zviri zvemaMuslims.
mt0: <pad> Muslim-hatred and attacks have increased across the country last month, including stone-throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during prayers in the mosques, followed by local authorities' destruction of many buildings, mostly owned by Muslims.</s>

en: The community, which makes up 14% of Indias 1.4 billion population, is reeling from vilification by hard-line Hindu nationalists who have long espoused an anti-Muslim stance.
sna: Vatenderi vechiMuslim, vanotora zvikamu gumi nezvina kubva muzana zvevanhu vese vanogara muIndia, avo vanosvika bhiriyoni nezviuru mazana mana, varikushungurudzwa neruvengo rwevatenderi vechi Hindu vanokakatira kurutivi vachiti India ndeye maHindu, avo vagara vaine ruvengo rwemaMuslim. V
mt0: <pad> Muslims, who make up twenty percent of the population of India, which is about one billion and four million, are suffering from Hindu supremacists who say India belongs to the Hindus, who have long resented Muslims.</s>

en: Some leaders of Indias ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party have tacitly supported the violence, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has so far been silent about it.
sna: amwe vakuru mubato riri kutonga riri remaHindu uye richisimbisa kuti India ndeye maHindu, reBharatiya Janata Party, vanotsigira nekabisira kerweseri kurwiswa uku, apawo mutungamiriri wenyika Narendra Modi vanga vakanyararawo pamusoro penyayaya iyi.
mt0: <pad> Some senior Hindu leaders of the ruling party, the Bharatiya Janata Party, have backed the attack with a huge margin, and the president of India Narendra Modi has expressed concern about the incident.</s>

en: Eid al-Fitr is typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes, but celebrations in India for the past two years have been marred by COVID-19 restrictions.
sna: Eid al-Fitr inosicherechedzwa nekunamata kwevanhu vakabatana mudzimba nehugaro hwavo, magungano emhemberero, kudzya kwepamitambo nehanzu itsva, asi mhemberero idzi muIndia mumakore maviri apfuura akakanganiswa nekudzviswa kufamba nekuungana kwevanhu nekuda kwedenda reCOVID-19.
mt0: <pad> Eid al-Fitr is celebrated with family worship, gatherings of celebration, food and new clothes, but the Indian festivals in the last two years have been affected by travel and gathering bans due to COVID-19 because of the coronavirus pandemic.</s>

en: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, the Muslim festival has been subdued for the past three years because of an unprecedented military lockdown after India stripped the regions semi-autonomy in 2019, followed by the pandemic.
sna: Mudunhu reKashmir rinotongwa neIndia, mhemberero iyi yanga isina kuchangamuka kwemakore matatu apfuura nekuda kwekupindira zvine chisimba zvisati zvamboitika mushure mekunge India yakatorera dunhu iri masimba epakati nepakati aiyava nawo ekuzvitonga muna 2019, kwava kuziteverwa ndendamupengo.
mt0: <pad> In Indian-administered Kashmir, the festival had been cancelled for three years due to unprecedented violence after India took over the region's partial autonomy in 2019, followed by a series of riots.</s>

en: The region also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, with at least 20 militants, two civilians and five police and soldiers killed.
sna: Dunhu iri rakaonawo kusimuka kwe kurwisana munguva yeRamadan, zvakasiya varwi makumi maviri, vagari vemudunhu iri, nemapurisa nemauto mashanu vaurayiwa.
mt0: <pad> The province also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, leaving 20 soldiers, residents of the province, and five police and military personnel dead.</s>

en: As we prepare to celebrate Eid, a strong sense of collective loss jars at us, said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.
sna: Zvatiri kugadzirira kupemberera Eid, pane kunzwa pakati pedu kwekuti takadzvokorwa ne rasikirwa, akadaro Bashir Ahmed, muzvinabhizinisi wemuSrinagar.
mt0: <pad> As we prepare to celebrate Eid, there is a feeling among us that we have been reunited with the loss," said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.</s>

en: Kashmir is the Muslim-majority disputed region where a violent insurgency against Indian rule and New Delhis brutal crackdown has raged for over three decades.
sna: Kashmir idunhu rinonzi rine maMuslim akawanda kudarika vezvimwe zvitendero, asi zvichirambwa nevamwe, umo muine kupanduka kunechisimba nezvombo kunokwikwidza hutungamiriri hwenyika uye nekutonga nedemo kunozoitwa nehurumende kuti idzikamise dunhu iri, inova hondo yaenderera kwemakore makumi matatu.
mt0: <pad> Kashmir is a state that is said to have more Muslims than other religions, but it is also disputed by some, where there is armed rebellion against the national government and a democratic rule by the government to bring peace to the region, which has been a war for 30 years.</s>

en: Tens of thousands of people have died in the conflict.
sna: Zviuru nezviuru zvevanhu vakafa mukurwisana uku.
mt0: <pad> Thousands of people died in this war.</s>

en: Meanwhile in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds assembled in the Jama Masjid, one of Indias largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions.
sna: Zvichakadai muguta guru, New Delhi, mazana evanhu vakaungana pa Jama Masjid, imwe yema mosque makurusa muIndia yose, vachiita minamato ye Eid iomo kekutanga munguva inodarika makore maviri nekuda kwekudziviswa kwevanhu kufamba nekuungana nekuda kwe dendamupengo.
mt0: <pad> However, in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds of people gathered at Jama Masjid, one of the biggest mosques in India, to pray Eid ul-Fitr for the first time in over two years due to the ban on movement and gathering for the coronavirus outbreak.</s>

en: Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.
sna: Mhuri dzakaungana rungwanani rweChipiri, vazhinji vakambundikirana nekushuvirana makomborero ezvakanaka.
mt0: <pad> Families gathered on Tuesday morning, many hugging and wishing each other well.</s>

en: Beijing Residents Brace for COVID-19 Lockdown
sna: Vagari vemuBeijing Kusafamba Vagere Mudzimba Nekuda kweCOVID-19
mt0: <pad> Beijing residents stay at home to prevent the spread of COVID-19</s>

en: Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has yet to require that all its residents remain at home to contain the spread of COVID-19.
sna: Isingaite zvinoitwa neShanghai, Beijing haisati yavakumanidza vagari vemo kuti vagare mudzimba kuti idzivise kupararira kwedenda reCOVID-19.
mt0: <pad> Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has not yet required its residents to stay at home to prevent the spread of the COVID-19 virus.</s>

en: Nevertheless, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing for that possibility.
sna: Zvisineyi, vanhu vazhinji munzvimbo yeguta iri inonzi Chaoyang nedzimwewo nzvimbo, vari kugadzirira kuti izv zvichaitwawo muguta ravo.
mt0: <pad> Now, many people in the city's Chaoyang district and other places are preparing for this to be done in their city as well.</s>

en: On Wednesday, city officials closed 60 subway stations, more than 10% of Beijing's vast system.
sna: NeChitatu, vakuru veguta vakavhara zviteshi makumi matanhatu zvezvitima zvinofamba munjanji yakachererwa pasi pemigwagwa nezvivakwa, zvinova zvikamu zvinodarika gumi kubva muzana rehurongwa hwezvitima zvakatekeshera Beijing yese.
mt0: <pad> On Wednesday, city officials opened 40 undersea transit stations, which make up about 10 percent of the Beijing metro network.</s>

en: They did not say when service would be resumed, according to ABC News.
sna: Sekutaura kweABC News, havana kutaura kuti zvitima zvichatanga kushanda zvakare rinhi.
mt0: <pad> ABC News reported that they did not say when the trains will return to service.</s>

en: Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been on high alert for the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars pivot to takeout, gyms close and schools suspend classes indefinitely, according to CNBC.
sna: Beijing, guta revanhu mamiriyoni makumi maviri nerimwe, yanga yakaringe nzira nekuteya nzeve kugadzirira kudzivisa kupararira kwedenda reCOVID-19, apo dzimba dzekudyira nemabhawa oshandura mashandiro achiendesa kudya nezvinwiwa kudzimba dzevanhu, nzvimbo dzekutatamura miviri dzichivharwa nezvikoro zvichimisawo zvidzdzo pasina anoziva kuti kwenguva yakareba zvakadii, sekutaura kwakaita CNBC.
mt0: <pad> Beijing, a city of over two million people, has been preparing with all the means to prevent the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars have changed their services to deliver food and beverages to people's homes, sports centers have been closed and schools have suspended classes for no one knows how long.</s>

en: People who live in "controlled" areas, neighborhoods where cases have been discovered, have been told to stay in the city, and all residents must test for the virus three times throughout the week, according to ABC.
sna: Vanhu vagere munzvimbo "dzinoongororwa", hugaro umo makawanikwa denda iri vakaudzwa kuti vagare vasingabude muguta, uye vagari vemo vese vanofanirwa kuongororwa kuti havana dende iroi here katatu pasvondo, sekutaurwa kwazvakaitwa neABC.
mt0: <pad> People living in the "quarantined areas," the suburbs where the disease was found, have been told to stay indoors, and all residents are to be screened for the disease three times a week, ABC reported.</s>

en: Chinese authorities reported 5,489 cases nationwide on Wednesday, of which 4,982 were in Shanghai, which has been under a draconian lockdown for weeks.
sna: Vakuru vemuChina vakati vakaona vanhu vaine chirwere ichi vanosvika zviuru zvishanu nemazana mana nemakumi masere nepfumbamwe munyika yose nemusi weChitatu, asi pahuwandu uhwu, zviuru zvina nemazana mapfumbamwe nemakumi masere vevaviri vagari vemuShanghai, iyo yanga iri pasi pekutongwa nedemo chairo pasina kana munhu mumwe anobuda mumba.
mt0: <pad> China officials said they had confirmed 5,489 cases of the disease in the country on Wednesday, but of those, 4,948 were from Shanghai, which was under strict police control without any one leaving the city.</s>

en: Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday.
sna: Beijing yakawana vanhu makumi mana nevatanhatu vane denda iri uye vaine zvairatidza kuti vanorwara naro nevamwewo vashanu vakange vainaro asi vasina chairatidza kuti vanorwara neChitatu.
mt0: <pad> Beijing has identified 46 people with the disease and five people with no symptoms on Wednesday.</s>

en: The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.
sna: Huwandu hwevanhu vakabatwa nedenda iri kubva musi wa24 Kubvumbi, parinoti ndipo pakaputika mhando yedenda iri inonzi omicron vasvika mazana mashanu nemakumi mana nevana.
mt0: <pad> The number of people affected by the virus since 24 May, when it was declared that the Omicron variant of the virus had exploded, has risen to 554.</s>

en: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai.
sna: Mr. Zhang, mugari wemuBeijing, anoti akawedzera kutenga chimwe chikafu nemvura, kunyangwe hazvo asingafungidzire kuti Beijing ichavharwa zvachose sezvakaitwa Shanghai.
mt0: <pad> Mr. Zhang, a resident of Beijing, said he has increased the amount of food and water he buys, although he does not think that Beijing will be completely shut down like Shanghai.</s>

en: He asked that VOA not use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.
sna: Akakumbira VOA kuti isamudome nezita rake rizere nekuti aitya kuzoongorwa nevakuru veguta.
mt0: <pad> He asked the VOA not to mention his full name because he was afraid of being reported by hospital authorities.</s>

en: I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and several boxes of water, instant noodles and (nutritionally dense) biscuits, and I haven't stocked up too much, Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone interview last week.
sna: Ndine masaga matanhatu emupunga, masaga maviri ema noodle, mabhokisi akati kuti emabhodhoro emvura, ma noodles asinagade kukwatiswa akatogadzirira kudyiwa nemabhisikiti akazara chikafu chinovaka muviri, asi handingati ndanyatsounganidza zvakawanda, Zhang akaudza VOA Mandarin munhaurirano yaakaita nemutori wayo wenhau parunhare svondo rakapera.
mt0: <pad> I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, several boxes of water, some uncooked noodles and a few packets of protein-packed cookies, but I don't think I've collected much," Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone conversation with its reporter last weekend.</s>

en: He said he bought his groceries online because the supermarket was crowded.
sna: Akati akatenga chikafu chake chose padandemutande nekuti muzvitoro rinongova beesanwa kusingadanwe anonzwa nekuwanda kwevatengi.
mt0: <pad> He said he bought all his food online because the store was just a temporary display because of the number of customers.</s>

en: Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she had been stocking up on necessities since the beginning of this year, after the Ministry of Commerce recommended that everyone do so.
sna: Muzvare Yao, uyo anogara munzvimbo yeChaoyang, akaudza VOA Mandarin kuti akange achiunganidza pazvinhu zvaanonyanya kushandisa mumba kubva pakutanga kwegore rino, mushure mekunge bazi rinoona zvekugadzirwa nekutengeswa kwezvinhu rakakurudzira munhu wese kuti adaro.
mt0: <pad> Ms. Yao, who lives in Chaoyang, told VOA Mandarin that she has been collecting household essentials since the beginning of this year, after the ministry of industry and trade urged everyone to do so.</s>

en: She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid official retribution.
sna: Akakumbira VOA Mandarin kuti isataure zita rake rizere nekuti akange asingade kuzonetswa nevakuru.
mt0: <pad> He asked VOA Mandarin not to publish his full name because he didn't want to be harassed by the authorities.</s>

en: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarch's Yacht
sna: Yakurudzirwa neUS, Fiji Inobvuta Chikepembozha Mutsigiri Wehutongi Hwemu Rrussia.
mt0: <pad> Fiji has been urged by the US to acquire a cruise ship.</s>

en: Another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.
sna: Chimwezve chikepembozha chemutsigiri wehutongi hweRussia chakatorwa nemusi weChina
mt0: <pad> Another Russian government plane was hijacked on Tuesday.</s>

en: At the request of the United States, Fijian officials took a $300 million yacht belonging to Suleiman Kerimov, the Justice Department said. Officials say the yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji.
sna: Vakumbirwa neUnited States, vakuru vemu Fiji vakatora chikepembozha chinokosha mari inoita mazana matatu emamiriyoni chaSuleiman Kerimov, bazi rezvemutemo rataura kudaro.Vakuru vanoti chikepembozha ichi chiri kuLautoka muFiji makare.
mt0: <pad> Fijian authorities have seized the yacht of Suleiman Kerimov, a US-backed lawyer, the legal ministry said. The yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji, and was seized by the United States earlier this month.</s>

en: Kerimovs yacht, the Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico.
sna: Chikepembozha chaKerimov, chinonzi Amadea, chiine ruvara rwemureza weCayman Island, chinoonzi changa chiri muFiji kubva mwedzi wakapfuura, mushure chabva kuMexico.
mt0: <pad> Kerimov's yacht, Amadea, painted with the Cayman Islands flag, has been in Fiji since last month, after leaving Mexico.</s>

en: Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.
sna: Magweta ari kumiririra muridzi wacho anoti mudziyo uyu ndewe mumwe mutsigiri wehutongi wemuRussia.
mt0: <pad> The lawyers representing the owner say the vehicle belongs to a Russian presidential supporter.</s>

en: Kerimov had already been sanctioned by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for Russias activities in Syria and Ukraine.
sna: Kerimov akanga  atemwa nezvirango zvehupfumi ne U.S. muna 2014 nemuna 2018 nekuda kwezvakaitwa neRussia muSyria nemuUkraine.
mt0: <pad> Kerimov had been subject to economic sanctions by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for his role in Russia's activities in Syria and Ukraine.</s>

en: The European Union also sanctioned him.
sna: European Union yakamurovawo nezvirango zvehupfumi.
mt0: <pad> European Union also imposed economic sanctions on him.</s>

en: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscows February 24 invasion of Ukraine.
sna: Muna Kurume, hurumende yeU.S. yakazivisa chirongwa chakasimba chekutsvaga nekutora zvinhu zvinokosha zvezvinoto zveku Russian zvanga zvichitsigira hurumende yavaVladmir Putin, sechikamu chekupindura zvakaitwa neRussia payakapinda nechisimba munyika yeUkraine.
mt0: <pad> In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive program to target and seize Russian oil infrastructure that supports Vladimir Putin's government, as part of a response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.</s>

en: The initiative, led by the Justice Department, is called Task Force KleptoCapture.
sna: Chirongwa ichi chiri kutungamirirwa neBazi rezvemutemo, rinodaidzwa kunzi Chikwata Chekubvutira Vanotonga Nechisimba kana kuti Task Force KleptoCapture.
mt0: <pad> The program is led by the Department of Justice, called Task Force KleptoCapture.</s>

en: U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Thursday in a statement there is "no hiding place for the assets of criminals who enable the Russian regime."
sna: Muchuchusi mukuru weU.S.,  Merrick Garland akatura mashoko nemusi weChina ekuti "hapana nzvimbo yekuhwanda yezvinokosha zvezvigeven'a zvinogonesa nekutsigira hutungamiriri hweRussia kuita mabasa awo.
mt0: <pad> The U.S. Secretary of State, Merrick Garland, said on Thursday that "there is no hiding place for the vital weapons that allow and support the Russian government to perform its duties."</s>

en: He also said, "The Justice Department will be relentless in our efforts to hold accountable those who facilitate the death and destruction we are witnessing in Ukraine."
sna: Akatiwo zvakare, "Bazi Rezvemutemo harisi kuzoneta mubasa redu rekuona kuti avo vari kutsigira nekugonesa kupondwa kwevanhu neparadzwa kwenyika kwatiri kuona kuUkraine vazvidavirira pamberi pemutemo."
mt0: <pad> He also said, "The Department of Justice will not be afraid to see that those who support and allow the crimes and destruction of Ukraine are brought to account."</s>

en: In April, at the urging of the U.S., Spanish authorities seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, the owner of the Russian conglomerate Renova Group.
sna: Muna Kubvumbi, vakurudzirwa neU.S., vakuru vemuSpain vakabvuta chikepembozha chechinoto chekuRussia chinonzi Viktor Vekselberg, muridzi wemubatanidzwa wemakambani makuru ekuRussia anodaidzwa kuti Renova Group.
mt0: <pad> In May, under U.S. pressure, Spanish authorities seized the private jet of Russian tycoon Viktor Vekselberg, owner of the Renova Group of major Russian companies.</s>

en: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine.
sna: Svondo rakapera,  dare revamiririri reU.S. House of Representatives rakatendera danho raizotendera hurumende yeU.S. kuti itengese nzvimbo nezvivakwa zvakatorerwa zvinoto zvekuRussia zvinokosha mari inodarika mamiriyoni maviri emadhora, mari yacho igobatsira Ukraine.
mt0: <pad> Last Saturday, the U.S. House of Representatives approved a bill that will allow the U.S. government to sell Russian-occupied land and property worth more than two million dollars to help Ukraine.</s>

en: The measures next step is the Senate.
sna: Danho iri ramirira kuti ribvumirwe nedare ranasorojena, kana kuti Senate.
mt0: <pad> The bill still needs to be ratified by the Senate.</s>
