en: In 2003 Rwanda will hold its first national elections since the 1994 genocide.
sna: Muna 2003 Rwanda ichave nesarudzo dzenyika dzekutanga kubva zvapondwa zviuru nezviuru munyika iyi.
mt0: <pad> In 2003 Rwanda will hold its first national elections since the thousands of people were killed in the country.</s>

en: A new report says the government of Rwanda needs to relax its control over public life if the polls are to have any credibility.
sna: Zvakabuda muchinyorwa chitsva zvinoti hurumende yeRwanda inofanirwa kunyevenutsa kubata nechishwe kwayakaita zvinogona kuitwa neveruzhinji muhupenyu hwavo kana sarudzo idzi dzichizova nechiremera.
mt0: <pad> The new report says the government of Rwanda should clarify its illegal interventions that could affect the lives of the people if the election becomes too heavy.</s>

en: There was relief when the Rwandan Patriotic Front seized power in Rwanda in 1994, ending the genocide in which about 800,000 minority Tutsis and moderate Hutus were killed.
sna: Pakava nekutura befu rekudzikama apo bato reRwandan Patriotic Front rakabvuta masimba ekutonga muRwanda muna 1994, zvichibva zvapedza kupondwa kwevanhu kwakasiya kwauraya zviuru zvisere zverudzi rwechiTutsi urwo rwunevanhu vashoma nevamwe verudzi rwechiHutu vakange vasinga wirirane nekupondwa kwemaTutsi.
mt0: <pad> There was a calm after the Rwandan Patriotic Front took power in 1994, ending the genocide that left thousands of Tutsi and some Hutus who did not support the Tutsi persecution.</s>

en: The new military government promised to restore democracy to Rwanda via elections in 2003.
sna: Hurumende itsva yemauto iyi yakavimbisa kudzorera pakare kutonga kwegutsaruzvinji muRwanda kuburikidza nesarudza muna 2003.
mt0: <pad> The new military government promised to restore the rule of law in Rwanda immediately by elections held in 2003</s>

en: That process began in March this year, with district elections.
sna: Basa iri rakatanga muna Kurume gore rino, paine sarudzo dzemumatunhu.
mt0: <pad> The work began in March this year, after the provincial election.</s>

en: Senior analyst Francois Grignon, of the International Crisis Group, a Brussels-based policy research organization, says he was disappointed with the district poll.
sna: Francois Grignon, mukuru anoona nezvekuongora  muInternational Crisis Group, sangano rinonzvera nzira nemakwara anoitwa nawo basa  rine muzinda waro muBrussels kuBelgium, anoti akagumburwa nesarudzo dzemumatunhu.
mt0: <pad> Francois Grignon, director of leadership at the International Crisis Group, a non-governmental organization headquartered in Brussels, Belgium, said he was disappointed with the regional election results.</s>

en: Mr. Grignon says the process was so tightly controlled that he maintains no genuine opposition candidates were allowed to stand.
sna: Grignon anoti basa iri rakange rakasungwa chishwe zvekuti hapana nhengo dzemapato anokwikwidza echokwadi akatenderwa kupinda musarudzo idzi.
mt0: <pad> Grignon says the process was so tainted that no legitimate political parties were allowed to participate in the election.</s>

en: There was a screening and there was a preparation of the elections, which did not allow other candidates than those who had been rubber-stamped by the government to actually contest, especially for the executive positions within the local authorities, he says.
sna: Anoti iye, "Pakange paine kuongorora vanokwikwidza nekugadzirira sarudzo idzi, zvakange zvisingatendere vamwe vanhu vaida kukwikwidza vakange vasiri nhengo dzakange dzatenderwa nehurumende kuti dzikwikwidze, zvikuru sei pazvinzvimbo zvekutonga mumadhorobha nematunhu.
mt0: <pad> He said, "When we scrutinized applicants and prepared for the election, it was not possible for some applicants who were not members of the government to compete, especially in local and regional positions of power.</s>

en: "If consensual democracy means that the political debate is actually handled before the electoral contest in such a way that it does not lead to a real competition then there is no democracy at all."
sna: Kana gutsaruzhinji rinobva pakuwirirana ichireva kuti kuonesana panhaurirano dzakasiyana pamusoro pezvematongerwo dzinoitwa zuva rekusarudzo dzichiitwa nenzira yekuti panenge pasina kukwikwidzana kusvinu pakati penhengo dzemapato akasiyana , zvinenge zvichirevazve kuti hapana gutsaruzhinji."
mt0: <pad> If a coalition republic means that the different political parties are represented in a way that there is no real competition between them, then there is no republic.</s>

en: In a new report, titled Consensual Democracy in Post Genocide Rwanda, the International Crisis Group urges the international community to pressure Rwanda's government to liberalize political activity.
sna: Muchinyorwa chitsva chine zvakabuda mutsvakurudzo dzayakaita, chinonzi Gutsaruzhinji Rekubvumirana MuRwanda Yemushure Mekupondwa Kwemhomho Dzevanhu, kana kuti Consensual Democracy in Post Genocide Rwanda, musangano weInternational Crisis Group unokurudzira nyika dzepasi rose kuti dzisunde hurumende yeRwanda kuti isunungure nekutendera zviitikom nehurongwa hwezvematongerwo.
mt0: <pad> In its new report, Consensual Democracy in Post-Genocide Rwanda, the International Crisis Group urges international powers to pressure the Rwandan government to free itself and accept the political events and processes.</s>

en: The report notes that the military dominates public life and there is little open criticism of the government, either in the media or by opposition figures.
sna: Chinyorwa ichi chinoti mauto ndiwo ane izwi rinonyanya kunzwikwa mune zvinoitika muhupenyu hweveruzhinji uye pane kutsoropodza kushoma kunoitwa zviri pachena pamusoro pehurumende, mungava munhezvekutapwa kwenhau kana kuti zvichibva kuvanhu vanokwikwidzana nehurumende mune zvematongerwo.
mt0: <pad> The article says that the military has the most powerful voice in public life and there is little open criticism of the government, whether in media or by people who oppose the government in politics.</s>

en: The Rwanda government argues that allowing a range of opinions would be dangerous in a country struggling to come to terms with its bloody past.
sna: Hurumende yeRwanda inotiwo kutendera maonero akasiyana siyana pane zvematongerwo kunogona kuunza njodzi munyika ichiri kutatarika nekugamuchira nhorondo yayo yekudeurwa kweropa zhinji.
mt0: <pad> The Rwandan government also says that accepting different views on politics can bring danger to a country that is still in the process of accepting its history of bloodshed.</s>

en: But Mr. Grignon says dissent is simply being driven underground or outside Rwanda's borders.
sna: Asi Grignon anoti maonero asingawirirane neehurumende ari kungomanikidzirwa kuti aitwe neginin'ini munzvimbo dzakavanzikana kana kuti zvavakutoirwa kunze kwemiganhu yeRwanda.
mt0: <pad> But Grignon says that the government's criticism is being forced into writing in secret locations or written by a Rwandan genocide suspect outside the country's borders.</s>

en: Opponents to the regime have to flee the country or to join in rebel movements outside the country or in the Congo and no chance to express a different view, he says.
sna: Vanokwikwidzana nehurumende vanototiza vachibuda munyika kana kunobatana nezvikwata zvevapanduki zviri kunze kwenyika kana kuCongo uye hapana mukana wekutaura maonero akasiyana, anodaro.
mt0: <pad> Critics of the government flee the country or join rebel groups in the country or in Congo and there is no room for dissent, he said.</s>

en: "All the good policies that the government has been implementing - including the organization of the elections, national elections, presidential and parliamentary, in 2003 - will lack the credibility because they were not implemented in an environment that actually allowed a fair contest to take place," he says.
sna: "Hurongwa hwose hwakanaka hwanga huchiitwa nehurumende , kusanganisira kugadzirira nekurongedza hurongwa hwesarudzo dzenyika, emutungamiri wenyika neevamiririri vedare reparamende, muna 2003 - achange asina chiremera nekuti hange asina kuitwa mumamiriro ezvinhu aitendera kuti pave nekukwikwidza kune kuenzanisira kuti kuitike," anotaura achidaro.
mt0: <pad> "All the good plans by the government, including preparing and organizing the national elections, presidential and parliamentary, in 2003 - were unimportant because they were not done in conditions that allowed for fair competition," he said.</s>

en: Mr. Grignon says greater freedom of expression would strengthen Rwanda's reconciliation process and enhance its chances of a peaceful future.
sna: Grignon anoti kuwedzerwa kukusununguka pakutaura zvinofungwa nevanhu kwaizosimbisawo basa reRwanda rekuyananisa vanhu nekuwedzera mikana yekuwumba ramangwana rine runyararo.
mt0: <pad> Grignon said that the increase in freedom of expression will also strengthen the work of Rwanda to unite people and increase the chances of building a peaceful future.</s>

en: He says the international community's involvement in reconstruction projects gives it the leverage to make this plain to the Rwandan government.
sna: Anoti kupindira nekubatsira kwenyika dzepasi rese mumabasa ekuvandudza nekuvakazve nyika yeRwanda kunodzipa simba rekutaudza izvi pachena kuhurumende yeRwanda.

mt0: <pad> The anniversary of the Rwandan massacre</s>

en: The International Criminal Court (ICC) conducted its own investigation about his other activities and they found sufficient evidence to support the charge of war crimes and crimes against humanity perpetrated in the DRC and they issued an arrest warrant, which the French judicial authorities have executed.
sna: Dare renyika zhinji dzepasi rose rinoongorora kuparwa kwemhosva dzehugeven'a reInternational Criminal Court (ICC) rakaferefeta rega pamusoro pemamwe mabasa ake uye rikawana humbowo hwakakwana hunotsigira kupomerwa kwake mhosva dzehondo dzaakapara uye nemhosva dzehugeven'a pamusoro pevanhu dzakaparwa munyika yeDRC, naizvozvo vakatura chikumbiro chekusungwa kwake, icho vakuru vemuFrance vakazozadzikisa.
mt0: <pad> The International Criminal Court (ICC) has investigated all of his activities and found enough evidence to support his conviction for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in the DRC, so they have issued a request for his arrest, which French authorities have later complied with.</s>

en: The Hague-based court accused Mbarushimana and other rebels in the FDLR of using violence against unarmed civilians as their main tool in a campaign to forcefully obtain political power for the rebel group.
sna: Dare iri rine muzinda waro muHague rakapomera Mbarushimana nevamwe vapanduki veFDLR kushandisa chisimba chaikuvadza vagariwo zvavo vakange vasina zvombo senzira yavo huru yekuedza kuti vawanire boka revavapanduki iri masimba ezvematongorwo enyika.
mt0: <pad> The Hague-based court accused Mbarushimana and other FDLR rebels of using excessive force against their non-armed citizens as their main way of trying to gain the political power of the rebel group.</s>

en: According to the ICC, "as a result of this deadly blackmail (by the FDLR rebels), victims were killed, raped, and forcibly displaced, and entire villages were razed to the ground."
sna: Zvichienderana nezvakaturwa ne ICC, "nekuda kwekuedza kuwana zvavaida nehukoronyera nechikiribidi zvakaitwa  nevapanduki veFDLR, vanhu vakaurayiwa, vakabatwa chibharo, kumanikidzwa kuti vatize kwavaigara uye misha yakaparadzwa ikasiiwa rangova ivhu."
mt0: <pad> According to the ICC, "because of the crookedness and barbarity of the FDLR rebels, people were killed, raped, forced to flee their homes and villages were destroyed and left as a landfill."</s>

en: Karugarama said Mbarushimana and his FDLR rebel forces played a pivotal role in the countrys 1994 genocide in which hundreds of thousands of people were killed.
sna: Karugarama akati Mbarushimana nemasoja ake evapanduki veFDLR vakaita chikamu chikuru mukuurayiwa kwevanhu vazhinji munyika muna 1994 apo zviuru zvemazana evanhu vakapondwa.
mt0: <pad> Karugarama said Mbarushimana and his FDLR rebel army had a major part in the 1994 mass murder of the country when thousands of people were killed.</s>

en: We believe that, in the next couple of weeks after due process has taken place in France, he should be able to be transferred to The Hague in the Netherlands to face charges and be prosecuted for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed within the territory of the DRC.
sna: Tinotenda kuti, mumasvondo mashoma ari kutevera, mushure mekunge zvese zvinifanirwa kutevedzerwa pamutemo zvaitwa muFrance,  achange achitamiswa kuenda ku The Hague kuNetherlands kuti anozvidavirira mhosva dzaari kupomerwa agochichiswa nemhosva dzehondo nemhosva dzekukuvadza nekuuraya vanhu dzaakaparwa munyika yeDRC.
mt0: <pad> We believe that, in a few weeks, after all the legal proceedings have been carried out in France, he will be sent to The Hague in the Netherlands to answer his charges, including war crimes and genocide charges he was convicted of in the DRC.</s>

en: The Justice Minister also said Kigali will be cooperating with the International Criminal Court in the imminent prosecution of Mbarushimana.
sna: Gurukota rezvemutemo iri rakatiwo Rwanda ichange ibatirana neInternational Criminal Courtmukuchuchiswa nekukurumidza kwaMbarushimana.
mt0: <pad> The Rwandan minister of law also said that the country will join the International Criminal Court in the prosecution of Mbarushimana.</s>

en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-33
sna: Makurukota Ezvekunze ekuBritain neFrance Vchakuchidzira Basa Rekuunza Runyararo MuDRC
mt0: <pad> British and French foreign ministers have urged the UN peacekeeping mission in the DRC.</s>

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
sna: Makurukota Ezvekunze ekuBritain neFrance ari kuenda kuDemocratic Republic of Congo neMuvhuro vachitanga kushana kwemazuva matatu kunyika ina dziri mudunhu risina kugadzikana reCentral Africa.
mt0: <pad> British and French foreign ministers are heading to the Democratic Republic of Congo on Monday to begin a three-day mission in the unstable Central African country.</s>

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
sna: Rwendo rebasa uru rwuchange rwuchitungamirirwa negurukota rezvekunze kweBritain Jack Straw neanoita basa rimwechetero kuFrance Hubert Vedrine.
mt0: <pad> The visit was led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.</s>

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
sna: Vachange vachishanyira Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi neUganda.
mt0: <pad> The Ambassadors will visit the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.</s>

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
sna: Chinangwa chavo chikuru kufemera hupenyu hutsva kubasa rekuunza runyararo kunyika yasakadzwa nehondo yeCongo.
mt0: <pad> Their main goal is to breathe new life into the work of bringing peace to the war-ravaged country of Congo.</s>

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
sna: Chikuru kuru, Britain neFrance dziri kuda kubviswa mauto ekunedzimwe nyika anotsigira hurumende DRC) nekuisiswa zvombo pasi kwevapanduki avo vanotonga chikamu chiri pakati nepakati chenyika uye ne nhaurirano dzerunyararo kuti dzipedze gakava nehondo.
mt0: <pad> The main British and French demands are the withdrawal of all foreign troops (supporting the government of the DRC) and the arming of rebels who control the central part of the country and peace talks to end the conflict and war.</s>

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
sna: Gurukota rezvekunze muBritain Straw akati rwendo rwebasa urwu rwaivawo nedonzvo guru rekuona kuti Congo haizove imwe nyika yakasakadzwa nehondo nevapunduki seAfghanistan.
mt0: <pad> The British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw said the mission had also been to see that Congo would not be another country that was destroyed by war and rebellion like Afghanistan.</s>

en: The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states, he said.
sna: Zuva remusi wa 11th Gunyana (apo nyika yeAmerica yakarwiswa nevanhu vakapfeka mabhomhu vanhu vazhinji vakaurayiwa zvivakwa zvikuru zvika wisirwa pasi) raita kuti zvikoshe zvikuru kuti titore matanhu nekukasira kuekugadzirisa nyika dzirikukonewa kana dzakatokonewa kukuzvotonga nenzira inounza runyararo nekugadzikana.
mt0: <pad> The 11th September (when the United States was attacked by suicide bombers, killing many people and blowing down major buildings) has made it even more important to take measures quickly to help countries that are not able to or have been unable to self-rule in a way that brings peace and stability.</s>

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila.
sna: MuKinshasa, makurukota aya achasangana nemutungamiriri weCongo Joseph Kabila.
mt0: <pad> In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet with Congo's President Joseph Kabila.</s>

en: He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
sna: Akapinda pachigaro gore rakapera, mushure mekunge baba vake, President Laurent Kabila, apfurwa akafa nemumwe wechengetedzi vavo.
mt0: <pad> He took office last year, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was shot dead by one of his security guards.</s>

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
sna: Vabva uku vachazoenda kuKigali kunota hurukuro nemutungamiriri weRwanda, President Paul Kagame, nemutungamiriri webato revapanduki reCongolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
mt0: <pad> They will then travel to Kigali to meet with the president of Rwanda, Paul Kagame, and the leader of the rebel group Congolese Democracy, Adolphe Onusumba.</s>

en: The ministers will make a brief visit to Burundi to discuss that country's civil war with President Pierre Buyoya.
sna: Makurukota aya achashanya kwenguva pfupi kuBurundi kuti vanokurukura nemutungamiriri wayo Pierre Buyoya pamusoro pehondo yekusawirirana kwezvizvarwa zvemo.
mt0: <pad> The ministers will visit Burundi for a short visit to discuss with the president Pierre Buyoya about the conflict between the different ethnic groups in the country.</s>

en: The tour will end in Uganda, where meetings are scheduled with President Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, who leads the Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.
sna: Kushanya uku kuchapeterwa kuUganda, umo kwarongwa misangano nemutungamirir wenyika Yoweri Museveni naJean-Pierre Bemba, uyo anotungamirira varwi veMovement for the Liberation of Congo.
mt0: <pad> The tour will end in Uganda, where he will meet with the president of the country Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, leader of the rebels of the Movement for the Liberation of Congo.</s>

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes
sna: UNICEF Inosunda kuti masoja evana vadiki aisiswe zvombo pasi mudunhu reAfrica rinonzi Great Lakes
mt0: <pad> UNICEF supports the creation of a child soldiers in the Great Lakes region of Africa.</s>

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum.
sna: Bazi rezvemubatanidzwa wentika dzepasi rose rinoona nezvevana rinonzi UNICEF, riri kusunda kuti masoja evana vadiki vaitwe kuti vaise zvombo pasi vasiyane nehupenyu hwechiuto mudunhu remuAfrica rinonzi Great Lakes, panguva iyo hurongwa hwekutsvaga runyararo hwava pazvidanho zvepamusoro.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF is urging youth soldiers to surrender and abandon the military lifestyle in the Great Lakes region of Africa, as peace efforts are at their most advanced stage.</s>

en: The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
sna: Bazi iri rinoti mari yakatovepo yekubatsira vana ava kusiya zvechiuto vagovamba hupenyu hwavo patsva.
mt0: <pad> The ministry says it has already allocated money to help the children leave the military and start a new life.</s>

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units.
sna: Mukuru weUNICEF anoona nezvekuchengetedzwa kwevana, Manuel Fontaine, anoti matanho ekutsvaga runyararo muUganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo neRwanda arikuita kuti zvigoneke kuburitsa vana vari pasi pemakore gumi nemasere kubva muzvikwata zvinorwa hondo.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF's director of child protection, Manuel Fontaine, said peace efforts in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are helping to free children under 18 from conflict groups.</s>

en: "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations. We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group. But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
sna: "Tinotsinhidza kuti vana vari masoja vanofanirwa kusiiswa zvombo nekusiya hupenyu hwechiuto, kunyangwe munzvimbo dzine hondo. Hatifanirwe kumirira kuti pave nerunyararo kuti tibvisa vana muzvikwata zvevanhu vakapakata zvombo. Asi zviripachena kuti iyi ndiyo nguva yakanaka parizvino. Ine mamiriro akanaka anoita kuti zvive nyore kuti zvombo zviiswe pasi uye vana vasiye hupenyu hwechiuto," Fontaine akadaro.
mt0: <pad> "We believe that children who are soldiers should be disarmed and quit the military, even in war zones. We don't have to wait for peace to remove children from the armed forces. But clearly this is the right time. There are good conditions that make it easy to disarm and discharge children," said Fontaine.</s>

en: He says there are currently 1,200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the rebel Lord's Resistance Army.
sna: Anoti parizvino pane vana vari muchiuto chiuru nemazana maviri muUganda, vari kurwa vari muvapanduki veThe Lord's Resistance Army.
mt0: <pad> He says there are now over 200 children in the Ugandan army, fighting for the Lord's Resistance Army.</s>

en: He says that over the past 14 years, the group has abducted some 10,000 children, boys to fight and girls to serve as sex slaves.
sna: Anoti pamakore gumi nemana akapfuurachikwata ichi chakatora vana vanodarika zviuru zana nechisimba, vakomana kuti vave varwi, uye vasikana kuti dzive nhapwa dzavo dzavanobata chibharo pavadira.
mt0: <pad> He says that in the past 18 years this group has forced over 100 children into being soldiers, and girls into slaves, who they rape and molest on the rooftops.</s>

en: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo still has some 10,000 children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2,000 children involved in combat.
sna: Sekutaurwa kwazvinoitwa neUNICEF, nyika yeDemocratic Republic of Congo ichiine vana zviuru gumi vakapinzwa muchiuto kuti varwe, ukuwo Rwanda ine vana vanosvika kuzviuru zviviri vari kuridza gidi muhondo. combat.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF says that the Democratic Republic of Congo has 10 thousand children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2 thousand children fighting in the war.</s>

en: UNICEF says, even though some of the children do not directly engage in fighting, they are exposed to many dangers.
sna: UNICEF inoti, kunyangwe hazvo vamwe vevana ava vasingabva vabata pfuti vachirwa muhondo, vanoiswa mukati menjodzi dzakawanda.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF says, even though some of these children have never been engaged in combat or fighting in the war, they are placed in a number of risks.</s>

en: They may be used as porters, carrying very heavy loads, or as messengers or spies passing information and scouting out enemy territory.
sna: Vanoshandiswa savana mujibha, vachitakuriswa musengwa inorema, kana senhume  kana vasvori vanenge vachifambisa mashoko nekuongorora zviri kuitika mudunhu rinenge riine muvengi.
mt0: <pad> They are used as spies, either by a special mission, or as spies or scouts who carry out surveillance and gather information about the enemy's area.</s>

en: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves.
sna: Dzimwe nguva, vakomana, asi nyanye vasikana, vanoshandiswa senhapwa dzekufadza masoja makuru pane zvebonde.
mt0: <pad> Some times, men, but especially women, are used as slaves to please the larger sex army.</s>

en: They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases.
sna: Vanoiswa munjodzi yekukuvadzwa, chirwere cheshuramatongo nedzimwe njovhera.
mt0: <pad> They are at risk of injury, diabetes and other illnesses.</s>

en: The girls may become pregnant, making it harder for them to reintegrate into their communities.
sna: Vasikana vanobata pamuviri, zvobva zvanyanya kuvagozhera kuti vazodzokera kuva nhengo yemumisha yavakatorwa nevapanduki.
mt0: <pad> The girls become pregnant, which makes it more difficult for them to return to the family that the rebels took from them.</s>

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money.
sna: Mushandi weUNICEF, Manuel Fontaine, anoti kuti vana vaisiswe zvombo nekusiya chiuto zvinotora nguva nemari.
mt0: <pad> UNICEF worker Manuel Fontaine said that removing children from the conflict takes time and money.</s>

en: He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units.
sna: Anoti chekutanga ndechekuti vana ava vanofanirwa vawanikwa kwavanenge vari, pedzezvo vozobviswa kubva mapoka ehurumende kana evapanduki mavanenge vari masoja.
mt0: <pad> He says that first of all, the children should be found where they are, and then removed from government or rebel groups when they are soldiers.</s>

en: Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives.
sna: Mushure mazvo, mari nezvimwe zvekushandisa zvinozodiwa kuvabatsira kuvaka huoenyu hwavo pakare.
mt0: <pad> Afterwards, money and other resources will be needed to help them build their own life.</s>

en: That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.
sna: Izvi zvinosanganisira kuvapa zvikoro, kudzidzira mabasa amaoko nekuti vabetserwa nezvehutano.
mt0: <pad> This includes providing them with schools, training them in hand-skills and health care.</s>

en: You do not want to stigmatize them and individualize them.
sna: Havafanirwe kusemwa kana kunongedzerwa.
mt0: <pad> They should not be deleted or added.</s>

en: They are basically going back to communities where there are a lot of other children, many of whom have suffered from consequences of war, even if they were not recruited.
sna: Zviri kuitika ndezvekuti vari kudzokera kumamisha kune vamwe vana vakawanda, vazhinji vavo vakakanganiswa nekuda kwehondo, kunyangwe hazvo vasina kuzotorwa kuitwa masoja.
mt0: <pad> The truth is that many children are returning to the villages, many of them have been affected by the war, even though they haven't been recruited as soldiers.</s>

en: So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children, Mr. Fontaine said.
sna: Saka unenge uchiedza kuvaka zvinhu zvekushandisa, zvinogona kushandiswa nevana vose ava, akataura achidaro Fontaine.
mt0: <pad> So you're trying to build objects that can be used by all these children, said Fontaine.</s>

en: He says, unfortunately, the needed government institutions are not yet in place in some countries to move the process ahead quickly enough.
sna: Anoti, chakaipa ndechekuti, hapasati pava nemapazi ehurumende anofanirwa kunge aripo kuti aenderere nebasa iri pamberi nechimbi chimbi.
mt0: <pad> The problem is that there are not yet government officials who should be in place to take the work forward as soon as possible.</s>

en: He says that's why UNICEF is pressing to see such structures develop, so that children can get back home and start to lead normal lives once again.
sna: Anoti, ndicho chikonzero UNICEF iri kushingirira kuti pavakwe hwaro uhwu, kuitira kuti vana vagone kudzokera kumisha yavo vagotanga kurarama hupenyu hwamazuva ose zvakare sevamwe vana vezera ravo.
mt0: <pad> He said, that's why UNICEF is pushing for the construction of these bridges, so that the children can return to their villages and start living a normal life again like other children of their age.</s>

mt0: <pad> The US is seeking advice from world leaders about bombing Syria with missile launchers that are being used as missiles.</s>

en: World Bank, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative
sna: bhanga renyika dzepasi rese reWorld Bank ne kambani inogadzira zvipfeko nemidziyo yekushandisa pamitambo yeNike vobatana pachiringwa chinonzi "Mutsindo Wemwanasikana" kana kuti 'The Girl Effect Initiative"
mt0: <pad> The World Bank and the sports clothing and equipment company Nike have joined forces to launch the "Girl Effect Initiative" or "The Girl Effect".</s>

en: The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.
sna: Chirongwa chevanasikana vachangoputudza che The Adolescent Girls Initiative chinobatana ne, Nike Foundation nehurumende dzenyika dzakasimukira nedzichiri kubusirira kuti dzipe masimba negoneso kuvasikana vari munyika dzisina kupfuma.
mt0: <pad> The Adolescent Girls Initiative is a coalition of the Nike Foundation and governments of developed and developing countries to provide power and protection to girls in low-income countries.</s>

en: The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.
sna: Chirongwa ichi, chava nemakore matatu chichiitwa, chiri kubatsira vanasikana vari muAsia, Africa nedunhu reMiddle East kuti vawane kudzidza nehumwe humhizha hwavanoda kuti vagone kuyambuira mukuva vashandi.
mt0: <pad> The program, which has been running for three years, is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East to get education and skills that will allow them to move into the workforce.</s>

en: My name is Sanchita.
sna: Zita rangu ndinonzi Sanchita.
mt0: <pad> My name is Sanchita.</s>

en: I come from a small village called Ishwarpur in Bangladesh, American actress Anne Hathaway delivered her lines as powerfully from behind a podium at the World Bank as she does on the silver screen, telling the story of an impoverished girl.
sna: Ndinobva mumusha mudiki unonzi Ishwarpur kuBangladesh, mukadzi anoita zvemitambo yemafirimu wekuAmerica, Anne Hathaway, akataura mashoko ake aya, nehunyanzvi nesimba ari  seri kwepanomira vanhu vachitaura muimba inoitirwa misangano kuWorld Bank,, sezvaanongoita kana achiita zvemafirimu anozobuda pazvivhitivhiti, achitaura rungano rwemwanasikana anorarama muhurombo.
mt0: <pad> I come from a small village in Bangladesh, the American actress Anne Hathaway said her words, with authority and power, as if she were a speaker at a World Bank conference room, just like she does in films, telling the story of a girl who lives in poverty.</s>

en: When a baby is born in Ishwarpur, families desperately hope it will be a boy, she continued.
sna: Anoenderera mberi achiti, kana mwana azvarwa muIshwarpur, mhuri dzese dzinenge dzichidokwairira kuti deno aita mukomana.
mt0: <pad> He went on to say that in Ishwarpur, every family is looking forward to a boy.</s>

en: "It has been this way for as long as anyone can remember.
sna: "Zvagara zvakadaro kubva kumakare anagyeukwe naani zvake."
mt0: <pad> "It's been like that since ancient times, no one has ever recognized him."</s>

en: It is believed that boys will contribute to the family income in a place where people are very poor.
sna: Zvinofungidzirwa kuti vanakomana vanozobetsera pakuunza mari kumhuri inogara munzvimbo iyo vanhu vageremo vari varombo chose.
mt0: <pad> The children are expected to help bring money to the family living in a poor neighborhood.</s>

en: These circumstances are familiar to those who benefit from the Adolescent Girls Initiative.
sna: Mamiriro ezvinhu aya anozivikanwa nevose vanobetserwa neAdolescent Girls Initiative.
mt0: <pad> These conditions are known to all the girls who have been affected by the Adolescent Girls Initiative.</s>

en: Who benefits?
sna: Ndiani anobatsirwa?
mt0: <pad> Who is helped?</s>

en: A dozen such teenage girls and young women visited the World Bank from developing Asian, Middle Eastern and African countries.
sna: Vanasikana gumi nevaviri vane makore angasvike gumi nematanhatu vakashanyira World Bank vachibva kunyika dzichiri kusimukira dzeAsia, Middle East neAfrica.
mt0: <pad> Twelve girls aged between 13 and 18 visited the World Bank from developing countries in Asia, Middle East and Africa.</s>

en: They were just a few of the girls who benefit from training and education programs that help them transition from school to employment.

en: As U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence In Conflict Margot Wallstrom embarks on a new trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two activists recently concluded lobbying efforts in the United States for more effective action on trying to end conflict-related rapes in Congo.

mt0: <pad> When the UN special envoy to wartime rape Margot Wallstrom began her trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two rights activists had just finished their campaign in the United States to get more support to end wartime rape in the Congo.</s>

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.

mt0: <pad> One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a Washington, D.C. conference of university students and people with an interest in the issue that her work area, Beni, in North Kivu, is still under control of Ugandan rebels, who regularly rape women.</s>

en: She fears the overall situation in eastern Congo is getting worse, not better - despite the international attention - with rebels, militias, and renegade soldiers still running rampant.

mt0: <pad> He fears that the situation in the east of Congo is getting worse, not better - even though many countries are closely monitoring the situation - there are still rebels, armed gangs, rebel soldiers who will rise up and do what they please.</s>

en: A lot of these rebel groups are getting reorganized, and are even getting in a coalition so the movements that we see in the region, it is worrying us, said Rostagno.

mt0: <pad> When they gave their recommendations, the two lawyers, Bihamba and Rossagno, also identified specific ways to help improve the situation.</s>

en: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.
sna: Rostagno akatsangura kuti masangano akazvimiririra ekunze anofanirwa kutsvaga rubatsiro rwemari yekugadzirisa ganyavhu rinoitwa panezvepabonde, asi masangano emunyika anenge achisanwa nekusaonekwa kuti aripowo.
mt0: <pad> Rostagno stressed that international NGOs should seek financial support to combat sexual harassment, but national NGOs are often ignored and neglected.</s>

en: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access, said Rostagno.

mt0: <pad> The problem is that this money is often used to pay the already-paid wages of foreign workers who come into the country for this work, but the independent local organizations that work with different groups of people, women and children, in rural areas, who need a living wage to support their work are not given the chance to get it, said Rostagno.</s>

en: Bihamba said Congolese soldiers should be paid directly through bank withdrawals, rather than being paid through their superiors.
sna: Bihamba akati mauto emuCongo anofanirwa kupihwa mihoro yavo ichiiswa kumabhanga kwete kuti inopihwa vakuru vavo kuto vazovagamuchidza.
mt0: <pad> Bihamba said the Congolese army should be paid their wages through banks and not by their commanders to keep them from being taken advantage of.</s>

en: Bihamba said with the current system they receive only about a third of their salary, which causes some soldiers to loot and rape.
sna: Bihamba akati nenzira iri kushandiswa ikezvino, mauto anongogamuchira chikamu chimwe chete kubva muzvitatu chemihoro yavo, zvinozoita kuti mamwe mauto abe nekubvuta zvinhu zvevanhu nekubata chibharo.
mt0: <pad> Bihamba said that under the current system, soldiers only receive one-third of their salary, which will lead to some soldiers stealing and robbing property and taking advantage of civilians.</s>

en: She also called for an international tribunal for the Congo to help end general impunity, as well as more local tribunals for raped victims to seek justice.
sna: Akatiwo panofanirwa kuve nedare rinoongorora nekutonga zviri kuitika muCongo kuti zvibatsire kupedza kutyorwa kwemitemo nekodzero pasina chinoitika kune vanenge vatyora mutemo, uyewo kuve nemamwe matare emunzvimbo dzigere vanhu kuitira vakabatwa chibharo kuti vawane kururamisirwa.
mt0: <pad> He also said that a special court should be set up to help end the impunity and injustices in the Congo, and also to provide justice for victims of rape.</s>

en: In North Kivu, where more than 5 million people are estimated to live, she said there are only three tribunals.
sna: Kudunhu rekumaodanyemba reNorth Kivu, uko kunofungidzirwa kuti kunogara vanhu vanodarika mamiriyoni mashanu, akati kunongova nematare matatu chete.
mt0: <pad> In the northern region of North Kivu, which is estimated to have up to five million people, he said there are only three hospitals.</s>

en: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life
sna: Desmond Tutu Anozorora Kubva Pakushanda Neveruzhinji
mt0: <pad> Desmond Tutu Retires From Political Work</s>

en: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
sna: Desmond Tutu akarwisa rusaruraganda muSouth Africa, uye vaitsoropodza hondo yemu Iraq.
mt0: <pad> Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and criticized the war in Iraq.</s>

en: We waged a war that shouldn't have happened, he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
sna: Takarwa muhondo yakange isingafanirwe kunge yakaitika, akadaro. Vakataurawo vachitsoropodza kupondwa kwevanhu kwakaitika muRwanda.
mt0: <pad> We fought in a war that should not have happened, he said.</s>

en: God have mercy on us, he said.
sna: Mwari ngaava netsitsi nesu, vakadaro.
mt0: <pad> God have mercy on us, they said.</s>

en: The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday.
sna: Bhishopu vakasiya basa veAnglican vakazivisa muna Chikunguru kuti vaizorega basa rekushanda muruzhinji nemusi wekupemberera zuva ravakazvarwa.
mt0: <pad> The Anglican bishop who resigned in July announced that he would stop public service on his birthday.</s>

en: "The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons" he said.
sna: "Nguva yasvika zvino kuti yekuti ndichiita zvinhu zvishoma nezvishoma, ndichidzvuta zvichida svutugadzike yerudzi rwe rooibosndiine mudiwa wangu masikati" vakadaro.
mt0: <pad> "It's time for me to take things slowly, maybe smoking a joint with my girlfriend in the evening," he said.</s>

en: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
sna: VaTutu vakakwira nekusimuka muzvinhanho zvekereke ye Anglican muSouth Africa kusvikira vazove munhu mutema wekutanga kuvamubhishopu mukuru weCapetown.
mt0: <pad> The Tutus climbed and rose through the ranks of the Anglican Church in South Africa until they became the first black bishop of Capetown.</s>

en: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid.
sna: Vaive mutsoropodzi ayitaura achishora hurumende yechichena yemuSouth Africa uye vaijurudzira nzira dzisina mhirizhonga dzekupedza hutongi hwechichena.
mt0: <pad> He was a prominent speaker criticizing the white government of South Africa and urging non-violent means to end the white rule.</s>

en: Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.
sna: VaTutu vakagamuchira menduru dzakawanda, uye muna 1984, vakagamuchira menduru ye he received a Nobel Peace Prize nekuda kwebasa ravo rekurwira "nyika ine gutsaruzhinji nekururamisira pasina kutsaura maringe neruvara rweganda remunhu."
mt0: <pad> He has received many awards, and in 1984 he received a Nobel Peace Prize for his work towards "a world of justice and democracy without discrimination based on the color of skin."</s>

en: He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa.
sna: Vakashandisa izvi kuti vawedzere kurwisa hutongi hwerusarura rudzi, vachikurudzira kuti dzimwe nyika dzisadyidzane pane zvehupfumi neSouth Africa.
mt0: <pad> They used this to further criticize the system of apartheid, urging other countries not to join economically with South Africa.</s>

en: After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.
sna: Pakapera hutongi hwesaruraganda hwechichena, vaTutu vakati raive zuva rinoshamisa apo vaNelson Mandela vakakunda pasarudzo dzekutanga dzemarudzi ose.
mt0: <pad> After the short-term democratic government, Tutu said it was a wonderful day when Nelson Mandela won the first all-black general election.</s>

en: I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world," he said.
sna: “Ndingati nzvimbo yepamusoro soro yandakasvika ndeapo ndakamira ndiri muima yemamusoro pandaonekwa nevanhu vakange vari pasi ndikaratidza mutungamiriri wedu mutsva, achangoburwa kuSouth Africa nekupasi rose,” vakadaro.
mt0: <pad> "I think the most important place I've ever reached was when I stood on the podium and showed our new leader, the new South African president, to the people of South Africa and the world," he said.</s>

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission.
sna: Kubatsira kuporesa nyika, President Mandela vakagadza vaTutu semukuru webazi raizobatsira kuunza kuyanana nekuregerera kuburikidza kureurura chokwadi chezvakaitika chinonzi Truth and Reconciliation Commission.
mt0: <pad> To help heal the country, President Mandela appointed Tutu as the chair of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission to help bring peace and forgiveness through the revealing of the truth.</s>

en: The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.
sna: Boka iri rakaburitsa chinyorwa chaisanganisirawo kureurura kwemhosva dzakaparwa pasi hutongi wesaruraganda kuti munhu aganuchire kuregererwa.
mt0: <pad> The committee also issued a report that included the release of convictions committed under the apartheid regime to allow for the possibility of forgiveness.</s>

en: It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur, Tutu said.Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
sna: Chinyorwa ichi chinotaurawo zvinogona kuitwa kuti tisakurire nekukurisa tsika tekuchengetedza kodxero dzevanhu nehwaro hunoita kuti hutsinye hehumhondi hwakare ahuitike zvakare, vakadaro vaTutu.VaTutu vakamirawo vachirwisana nehurombo nedenda reshuramatongo.
mt0: <pad> The book also talks about how we can develop and strengthen our culture and protect human rights and freedoms, said Tutu. He also stands up against poverty and the legacy of imperialism.</s>

en: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.
sna: Mumakore achangopfuura, vakaratidza kugumbuka kwavo ne South Africa yakauya mushure mekutonga kwerusaruraganda, zvikuru kutyorwa kwemutemo kunenge kuine mhirizhonga nezvombo.
mt0: <pad> In recent years, they have expressed their discontent with South Africa after the democratic rule, particularly the widespread criminality that has accompanied violent and armed violence.</s>

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
sna: Kunyangwe havo vavakurega kunyanya kuonekwa pane veruzhinji, vacharamba vachitsigira sangano ravo rinorwira kuti Africa nepasi rose pave nerunyararo uye vacharanba vari chikamu chevakuru anasorojena vanopanga mazano vanorwira kuti pave nerunyararo nekodzero dzevanhu.
mt0: <pad> Although they have been less active in public, they will continue to support the African peace movement and will be part of the senior advisory group for peace and human rights.</s>

en: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."
sna: Asi vaTutu vanoti havachazenge vachitaura nevatori venhau kupindura mibvunzo yavo, nekuti, sekutaura kwavo vanenge "vakanyarara."
mt0: <pad> But Mr Tutu says he rarely speaks to journalists to answer questions, because, as he said, he is "silenced."</s>

en: I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed, he said.
sna: Ndanga ndiri chikamu chekurwira rusununguko negutsaruzhinji, uye ndiri chikamu chemhemberero yekuti takabudirira, vakadaro.
mt0: <pad> I was part of the struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration of our success, he said.</s>

en: "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."
sna: "Ndange ndiri chikamu chemwaka wakatevera nguva yekutonga kwechisaruraganda kwechichena uye ndinoshuvira kuti tive parinani nenzira yepamusoro soro."
mt0: <pad> "I've been part of the last year of a small-scale democratic government and I hope to be able to work with you in a highly professional way."</s>

en: Many say his voice will be missed.
sna: Vazhinji vanoti inzwi ravo richashuvirwa kuti deno ranga richingoripo.
mt0: <pad> Many people say they wish they hadn't been born.</s>

en: Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.
sna: VaTutu vakamirawo vachirwisana nehurombo nedenda reshuramatongo.
mt0: <pad> The Tutus also fought against poverty and the legacy of imperialism.</s>

en: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas
sna: Chikoro chenherera muMalawi che Jacaranda School for Orphans Chinopemberera Kisimusi
mt0: <pad> Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawi is celebrating Christmas.</s>

en: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
sna: Vanotungamira chikoro chenherera cheJacaranda School for Orphans chiri muguta guru mune zvetenga nekutengesa muma Malawi, Blantyre, munguva pfupi ichangopfuura vakaita mutambo wemabiko kuitira vadzidzi vavo apo chikoro chinovhara kuitira mazororo eKisimusi neGoredzva.
mt0: <pad> The management of the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Blantyre, Malawi, recently held a birthday party for their students as the school closed for Christmas and New Year holidays.</s>

en: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.
sna: Vanhu vangasvike mazana mashanu kusanganisira vadzidzi, vashandi nevamwewo vakabvamunzvimbo dzakapoteredza vakange vari pachiitiko ichi, chakaitirwa muxchivanze chechikoro  munzvimbo yeChigumula.
mt0: <pad> Over 500 people including students, teachers and others from the surrounding areas were present at the event, which was held in the school yard in Chigumula.</s>

en: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.
sna: Mutambo uyu wasanganisirawo zvipo, Santa Claus anozivikanwa sekuti Father Christmas, uye "nekuratidza zvidobi zvekutamba mimhanzi" kwakaitwa nevadzidzi.
mt0: <pad> The event also included presents, Santa Claus, known as Father Christmas, and "a musical performance" by students.</s>

en: The school management told VOA that the yearly celebration has been a school tradition for the past 13years.
sna: Vanoona nekufamba kwakanaka kwechikoro ichi vakaudza VOA kuti mhemberero inoitwa gore negore itsika yanga ichiitwa nechikoro kwemakore gumi nematatu adarika.
mt0: <pad> The school's executive director told the VOA that the school has been celebrating its birthday every year for the past 13 years.</s>

en: The school's director, Luc Deschamps, said: "[We feel] it is very important for us to celebrate Christmas because the children do not have parents.
sna: Mukuru wechikoro ichi, Luc Deschamps, akati: "Tinonzwa kuti zvakakosha kupemberera Kisimusi nekuti vana ava havana vabereki".
mt0: <pad> The head of the school, Luc Deschamps, said: "We feel it is important to celebrate Christmas because these children have no parents."</s>

en: They stay with either a grandmother or a distant aunt or uncle, and they are not able to cerebrate at home or have a party or a little bit of sweets and cake for the children.
sna: Vanogara nambuya kana tete, kana imwe hama yekure yavanoita tete, mai, baba kana sekuru, uye havakwanise kupemberera vari kumusha kana kuva nekamutambo kadiki kekufara kana kudyawo zviwitsi zvishomanana kana keke kuitira vana ava.
mt0: <pad> They live with grandma or grandmother, or another elderly relative who is their grandmother, mother, father or grandfather, and they can't celebrate at home or have a small party or eat some cookies or cake for those children.</s>

en: So, we provide a happy day for the children to celebrate the spirit of Christmas. And it is also a way of our children to learn to give."
sna: Saka tinogadzira zuva remufaro kuitira vana ava kuti vapemberere mweya weKisimusi. Uye inovawo nzira yekuti vana vedu vadzidze kupa kune vamwe."
mt0: <pad> So we make a fun day for these children to celebrate the Christmas spirit. And it's also a way for our children to learn to give to others.</s>

en: No media source currently available
sna: Hapana nhau dziri kuwanikwa ikezvino
mt0: <pad> No news is available right now.</s>

en: Deschamps, who is also an Honorary Consul of France in Malawi, said before the main event the patrons were treated to "a nice meal" from the students.
sna: Deschamps, uyo anova mumiriri anoremedzeka weFrance muMalawi, akati mutambo uyu usati watanga vaenzi vakapihwa "kudya kwainaka nice meal" kwakange kwabikwa nevadzidzi.
mt0: <pad> Deschamps, who is the former French ambassador to Malawi, said that before the match the guests had a "nice meal" cooked by students.</s>

en: We had a big, big lunch with good meat and rice,[the dish made from maize flour called] nsima, of course, and vegetables.
sna: Tava nekudya kwemasikati kwakakura chose kune nyama yakanaka nesadza kana rinonzi nsima kuMalawi uyewo nemuriwo.
mt0: <pad> Tava is a large lunch with a good meat and potatoes or nsima in Malawi and also in the neighbouring countries.</s>

en: And it was the students themselves who cooked the meal for everybody, for over 500 people, he said.
sna: Uye vanga vari vana vechikoro vamene vabikira munhu wese kudya uku, kuitira vanhu vanodarika mazana mashanu, akadaro.
mt0: <pad> And they were schoolchildren who cooked the dinner for the whole crowd, for up to 500 people, he said.</s>

en: One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "The celebrations are really cool, ... I have enjoyed myself.
sna: Mumwe wevadzidzi ava, Eddah Zimba, akati, "Mhemberero idzi dzakaisvonaka, ... Ndanakidzwa chose.
mt0: <pad> One of the students, Eddah Zimba, said, "These celebrations were beautiful,... I really enjoyed them.</s>

en: I have eaten, and now I am here dancing.
sna: Ndadya, uye iye zvino ndava kudzana.
mt0: <pad> I've eaten, and now I'm hungry.</s>

en: What has interested me most is the gift that we have received the like the puffs, the biscuits, the squash and the dance."
sna: Chanyanya kundinakidza zvipo zvatagamuchira zvakaita se shuga yakaitwa furo kana kuti ma puffs, mabhisikitsi, mutambo we squash nekudzana."
mt0: <pad> The most interesting gifts we received were like sugar-fudge or puffs, cookies, a game of squash and a trampoline.</s>

en: She thanked the schools management for hosting the Christmas party for students who in most cases do not have such celebrations at home.
sna: Akatenda vanoona kufamba zvakanaka kwechikoro nekuronga mutambo uyu kuitira vadzidzi avo kazhinjihavakwanise kuita mhemberero idzi kumusha kwavo.
mt0: <pad> He believes that the school is doing a good job of organizing this event for students who often can't celebrate their birthdays at home.</s>

en: Another student Emmanuel Chisale said good meal aside, the event has taught him the spirit of sharing.
sna: Mumwe mudzidzi Emmanuel Chisale akati kunze kwezvekudya zvakanaka, chiitiko ichi chakamudzidzisa mweya wekugoverana nevamwe.
mt0: <pad> A student Emmanuel Chisale said that besides the good food, the event taught him the spirit of sharing with others.</s>

en: This party has brought a change in my life.
sna: Mutambo uyu waunza shanduko muhupenyu hwangu.
mt0: <pad> This game changed my life.</s>

en: I have learned that we have to have a heart for sharing one another as the Father Christmas was doing, he said.
sna: Ndadzidza kuva nemweya wekugoverana nevamwe sezvanga zvichiitwa naFather Christmas, akadaro.
mt0: <pad> I learned to share with others like Father Christmas, he said.</s>

en: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.
sna: Jacaranda School for Orphan chakavambwa mugore ra2002 ndicho chikoro choga muMalawi chinopa zvidzidzo zvepachena kuvana vasina vabereki kubva kuchikoro chepazasi, chepamusoro nekuzvokoro zvinogadzirira vadzidzi kuita mabasa akasiyana siyana.
mt0: <pad> Jacaranda School for Orphans founded in 2002 is the only school in Malawi that provides free education to orphans from primary, secondary and post-secondary schools.</s>

en: A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, started the school after she returned from the United States where she spent nineteen years working as a nanny.
sna: Mumwe mudzimayi wekuMalawi, Marie Da Silva, akatanga chikoro ichi mushure mekunge adzoka kubva kuUnited States uko akange apedza makore gumi nemapfumbamwe achishanda semuchengeti wevana mumhuri.
mt0: <pad> A Malawian woman, Marie Da Silva, founded the school after returning from the United States where she had spent nineteen years working as a babysitter for a family in the United States.</s>

en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2030
sna: Nyanzvi dzezvehupfumi dzinoti zhira yehupfumi weMalawi ichange yakaoma mugore ra2030
mt0: <pad> Economic experts say the Malawian economy will change badly in the year of 2020.</s>

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate.
sna: Nyanzvi dzezvehupfumi muMalawi dzinoti nyika iyi ichakaroenderera mberi ichitarisana nezvinetso pane zvehupfumi muna 2015 kuzhe kwekuti hurumende yagonazve kupa vanobatsira nemari kugutsikana kwekuti inogona kugadzirisa zvinhu, nekuti vabatsiri vachi vakapfumbatira zvikamu makumi mana kubva muzana zvemari yekubatsira pamari yekufambisa basa rehurumende mberi nekuda kwenyaya yehuori inozivakanwa nekuti Cashgate.
mt0: <pad> Malawian economists predict that the country will continue to face economic problems in 2015 unless the government can reassure its donors that it can fix the situation, as donors have blocked 40 percent of the government's funding for running the government's operations because of the so-called Cashgate scandal.</s>

en: More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
sna: Mari inodarika mamiriyoni mazana matatau yakamorwa kubva muzvikwama zvehurumende munyaya iyi uye vanhu vazhinji, kusanganisira vashandi vakuru vehurumende vakasungwa.
mt0: <pad> Over four hundred million dollars were embezzled from the government's coffers in this case and many people, including senior government officials, were arrested.</s>

en: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the 2014-2015 fiscal year.
sna: Kusatsukunura mari yerubetsero iyi kwazomanikidza hurumende yeMalawi kuti ibvumidze hurongwa hwezvekushandiswa kwemari inoshandiswa yakapihwa zita rekuti Hurongwa Hwekushandisa Mari Munyika Pasina Rubatsiro mugore rinotanga muna2014 kusvikira 2015.
mt0: <pad> The failure to repay the aid will have forced the government of Malawi to adopt a budgetary measure called the Fiscal Independence Program for 2014 to 2015 which was approved by the UN Development Programme.</s>

en: Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
sna: Vanoongorora nekunzvera, vakaita sa Abel Mwanyungwe, uyo anodzidzisa zvehupfumi paPolytechnic College yepa University of Malawi, vanoti kuderera kwemari iri kushandiswa nehurumende kwabva kwakuvadza zvehupfumi hwenyika.
mt0: <pad> Analysts and observers, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics professor at Polytechnic College of the University of Malawi, say the government's cuts in expenditure have already affected the economy of the country.</s>

en: This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance.
sna: Iri ranga riri gore rizere kugujurwa sezvo tichiine mazvimbiswa eCashgate iyo yakasiya yakuvadza zvehupfumi hwenyika.
mt0: <pad> This was a year of great disappointment as we still had the promises made in the Cashgate scandal that left the country's economy severely damaged.</s>

en: We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals.
sna: Takaona kuti kazhinji kacho mapazi akakosha nemapoka anoita basa risingagone kusavapo ndiwo akanyanya kukanganiswa, semuenzaniso iye zvino hatichina mishonga inoringana muzvipatara.
mt0: <pad> We have seen that often the most important and critical services and groups are the most affected, for example, now we don't have enough medicine in hospitals.</s>

en: In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time, said Mwanyungwe.
sna: Muzvikoro, mari dzemihoro yevadzidzisi haisikusvika nenguva, akadaro Mwanyungwe.
mt0: <pad> In the school, the teachers' pay did not arrive on time, said Mwanyungwe.</s>

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
sna: Mwanyungwe akabatanidza Cashgate nekudonha kwehukoshi hwemari yemuMalawi, inonzi kwacha, izvo zvakonzera kuramwa mabasa kwevashandi vehurumende vari kuda mihoro yepamusoro.
mt0: <pad> Mwanyungwe linked Cashgate to the fall in the value of the Malawian currency, the kwacha, which caused government workers to stage a strike demanding higher pay.</s>

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
sna: Semuyenzaniso, vashandi vanotsigira mune zvemutemo vanga vachiramwa mabasa kwemasvondo matanhatu, vachida kuti mihoro yavo iwezderwe nezvikamu makumi mana nezvishanu kubva muzana iyo hurumende iri kuti haikwanise kuvapa nekuti haina mari.
mt0: <pad> For example, legal support workers have been on strike for six weeks, demanding a 45% pay rise that the government says it can't provide because it doesn't have money.</s>

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
sna: Vashandi vanoshanda mubazi rinorwisana nehuori muMalawi reAnti-Corruption Bureauvakaramwa mabasa vachida kuwedzerwa mihoro yavo nezvikamu makumi manomwe kubva muzana kusvikira hurumende yavatyisidzira nekuvatorera mari dzavo dzemihoro wemwedzi waZvita kana vasina kudzokera kubasa.
mt0: <pad> The employees of the Anti-Corruption Bureau in Malawi have staged a strike demanding a 70% salary hike until the government has threatened to confiscate their December salary if they do not return to work.</s>

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.
sna: Mwanyungwe akati hurumende inogona koga kunzvenga kumwe kuramwa kwemabasa nevashandi kana ikagona kuwanazve kuvimbika mumeso emasangano anobatsira nemari mumashandisiro ayinoita mari dzinofanirwa kuita mabasa anobatsira ruzhinji.
mt0: <pad> The government can avoid another industrial action and strike if it can regain trust in the eyes of donors in its use of money for social services.</s>

en: My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy, we may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation, said Mwanyungwe.
sna: Chinondityisa ndechekuti kana tikasagona kugutsa vanotibatsira nemari nemari iyi ikasadzoka ichipindazve munezvehupfumi hwenyika, zvinogona kumanikidza hurumende kuti ikwerete mari kubva kumasangano emuno izvo zvinozoita kuti mari yemuno ishaye simba ukuwo mitengo yezvinhu ichikwrira, nekudhura kwemari ingakweretwe mumabhanga, yongova nyatwa yekunzi zindakupa zindakutorera, akadaro Mwanyungwe.
mt0: <pad> The problem is that if we can't meet our donors and the money returns to the economy, it will force the government to borrow money from local institutions which will make the local currency weaker and the cost of borrowing in the banks higher, a problem of give and take, he said.</s>

en: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
sna: Masangano anobatsira nemari vari kuda, pamusoro pezvimwe zvinhu, kusungwa kweavo vese vari munyaya yehuori iyi, uye kusimbiswa hwehurongwa nehwaro hwekushandiswa kwemari yehurumende.
mt0: <pad> The donor agencies demand, among other things, the prosecution of all those involved in this graft case, and the strengthening of the system and rules for the use of government funds.</s>

en: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
sna: Newton Kambala, mutungamiriri wesangano remubatanidzwa wemakambani anogadzira nekutengesa zvinhu muMalawi, yeMalawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, akati nyaya yehuori iyi yakabva yaita kuti gore ra2014 rive "gore rakaipisisa chose muchikamu chezvemabhizimisi, nekuda kwezvikwereti zvikuru zvemari inofanirwa kubharwa nehurumende kune vemabizimisi."
mt0: <pad> Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the graft scandal made 2014 "the worst year in business, due to the large government debt that has to be paid by the government to businessmen."</s>

en: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
sna: Akayambira kuti kana mariro ezvinhu akaendera mberi, "2015 anenge akanyanya kushata."
mt0: <pad> He warned that if the current trend continues, "2015 will be the worst year in history."</s>

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
sna: Mumashoko avo pamusoro pemamiriro enyika neMoigovera vapfuura, mutungamiriri weMalawi vaPeter Mutharika vakati hurumende yavo iri kuita zvose zvainogona kugadzirisa matambudziko akakonzerwa nehuori hweCashgate.
mt0: <pad> In his speech on the state of the nation on Wednesday, President Peter Mutharika said that his government is doing all it can to solve the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.</s>

en: My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi.
sna: Hurumende yangu yasimbaradza hurongwa hwekushandisa nekuchengeta mari zvekuti huori nehumbavha hweCashgate haufe hwakaitika zvekare muMalawi.
mt0: <pad> My government has strengthened the financial management system so that cashgate fraud and embezzlement will not happen again in Malawi.</s>

en: We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible, said Mutharika.
sna: Tapa zvekushandisa zvakawanda zvinopa goneso kune vanoita zvemutemo, kusanganisira bazi rinorwisa huori reAnti-Corruption Bureau, kuti vaite basa ravo nemazvo vakazvimiririra, vagoongorora vose vanofungidzirwa kuti vakapara mhosva, vagotora zvose zvinenge zvabiwa apo izvi zvichigoneka kuitika, vakadaro vaMutharika.
mt0: <pad> The government has provided more resources to the law enforcement agencies, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, to do their work independently, investigate all suspects and seize any stolen property as soon as possible, the President said.</s>

en: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
sna: VaMutharika vakatiwo hurumende yavo yatanga kushandisa nzira itsva dzekuvandudza mashandisirwo anoitwa mari yebasa rehurumende izvo zvinoedza kukurisa zvehupfumu hwenyika nezvikamu zvisahnu nechidimbu kubva muzana muna 2014, pachiratidza kukwira kubva pazvikamu zvishanu chete kubva muzana muna 2013.
mt0: <pad> Mr Mugabe also said that his government had begun to use new ways to improve the way the public service is used to try to boost the country's economy by 6% in 2014, a rise from just 5% in 2013.</s>
